comments: The Garden Apartment is lovely. It is open, airy, clean and comfortable. It was lovely to be right off of the garden and able to sit out on the patio where there is seating, including a table for dining. The little kitchenette was well-equipped. Sarah is an attentive and thoughtful host. I very much enjoyed her conversation and company and look forward to our next stay in the Garden Apartment. I heartily recommend this listing!

We were so pleased with the apartment and our host, Sarah, that we stayed another night. Wonderful host and location. Just a few minutes by car from downtown Salem. Could even bike there easily. We will be back to stay here again, many times, I am sure.

I stayed at Sara's apt.for two weeks while working in Salem. Everything was great. Sara is a very gracious host and the apt is large, clean and opens onto a patio and garden. So much nicer than a hotel! Will definitely be staying again when I work in Salem.

My aunt and I enjoyed our stay in the lovely garden apartment. Plenty of light even in the autumn weather. Sara provided top-quality granola and greek yogurt and a nice selection of ripe fruit. I heartily recommend this rental to anyone!

We truly enjoyed a restful time and environment in Sara's accomodations.  Peaceful is how we keep talking about it.  The view of Sara's gardens was delightful, the decor was clean and minmal, the space open, and we had everything we needed, including her gift of a wonderful breakfast.  We learned so much about her interests just by browsing through her library and it was enjoyable to hear about her travels. And one of the best things about our stay was no check-out time, so we could even take a little nap before our 4 hour drive home. Thank you Sara!

The Garden studio is very comforable with a bright southern exposure overlooking teh garden. In addition to a comfortable bed, the studio offered a kitchen w/refrigerator stocked with eggs, milk, jam, etc. washer/drier, hot plate, microwave, toaster, and dishes. Breakfast was DYI for me due to being on eastern time. The den with wood burning stove made for a cozy place to read, the bathroom had an interesting map of the mideast on the wall, tiled shower small but functional.

EVERYTHING was very clean. There also was a sense of sustainablity in the use of re-useable things. My host was considerate not to expose me to the cold she was sufferning at the time which was greatly appreciated.

Don't be put off by the neighborhood. It is safe and convenient.

Overall, a great place to stay and a good experience.

Sara is a great host.  She made the breakfast we requested (on Thanksgiving, no less), kept the fireplace going, stocked the bathroom well and explained everything that could trip us up (like the bedroom heating).  The house is quiet as is the neighborhood.  The beds were comfortable, the living room was cozy (TV and a lot of Sara's books) and the view of the garden and the frolicking birds was a nice way to wake up.  Some pointers for future guests:  the bedroom heater tends to start slowly but ramp up - be careful how much you turn it up.  If you get cold easily, take the bed by the heater, because the heat doesn't move over as much to the garden-side bed.  Also consider bringing your own pillow if you need better neck support - the pillows on the heater-side bed were a bit thin for me.  If you're there during cold periods, don't be freaked to see a few ants walking around - it's pretty typical for such a ground-level unit and Sara told us she's working to exterminate them.  Just make sure to put food away in the mini-fridge or cabinets.  We'd stay there again - good value, good amenities, good location, good service!

We had such a lovely time at Sara's.  The space was beautiful and the South facing windows gave a lovely warm view to a blustery day.  There was a woodstove that made everything cozy, lots of books, and some nice breakfast treats.  We had only a short visit, and wished we could have stayed another night or two.  This would be a great place for an extended stay, if you have work in Salem.  Very close to downtown.  Also if you are doing a Willamette Valley wine tour, this would be a good home base.  Thanks Sara, we will be back!
Sara you are truly awesome!  Thank you for a lovely stay and I look forward to getting back there real soon.  All the best!  Seb

Sara was a wonderful host. My wife, daughter and I returned very late to a lit fire and warm house which was so much more than we expected. The list goes on : Cinnamon Rolls, Milk, an assortment of Teas etc. The house was spacious with great accommodations for comfort. Thank you Sara.
Sara's apartment was great! Very cozy, with a fireplace, a well stocked kitchen, lots of information about Salem and walking distance to downtown. We would definitely stay here again!!
Sara, I love staying at your place.  It feels like home.  Thank you so much for everything... leaving is always difficult!

Sara, our "house mom" for our week stay in Salem, was so very kind and considerate. From a lit fire when we arrived late to gluten free bread (she knew I had Celiac), homemade jam, organic fruit bowl, fresh juice, and other tasty selections set out for us, we felt cared for and nurtured all week! The privacy of this Garden Studio Apartment was perfect with its own kitchen (the photo doesn't do it justice), living room lined with books, large bedroom and own bathroom. The view of Sara's garden was magical and a breath of relaxation after long days of training.  I hope we need to return to Salem soon so we can stay here again!

I stayed at Sara's with my sister this time. Spoiled Sis usually would stay at The Grand Hotel, but now that she has experienced staying at Sara's, the Grand is no longer good enough!  We were so comfy reading by the gas fireplace, and the beds were so comfy, and Sara's company was so fine when she accepted our invitation to visit over a glass of wine, that we decided to stay an extra night so we could experience all that a second time. Really, this is a special bnb and a special hostess. You could not do better than to stay at Sara's.
Very nice, on very short notice. I had a lovely time. Comfortable, sparkling clean, spacious, and nice host.

This is the best place to stay in Salem. The Garden Studio is warm and inviting, and it was much bigger than it appears in the pictures. It felt like home, very cozy and very inviting. Sara is such a nice and warm person, providing gluten-free food and making great restaurant suggestions. I stayed in Salem for a conference and wished I would have had more time enjoying the studio and chatting with Sara. I also loved the view and quiet of the garden. I will be back for a vacation some day. Like I said, the best place in Salem is the Garden Studio.

Such a wonderful experience staying here. Everything was a delight-- the lovely garden, beautiful rooms, peaceful location and most of all, Sara herself. We're looking forward to our next visit to West Salem.

This basement apartment is a fantastic space. It is very light, has all of the amenities one would ever need, and even has access to the comfortable back patio. The decorations, welcoming feeling, and cleanliness were all top notch.

The spot is a bit of a trek to downtown but on foot, but totally doable. If you are walking downtown I suggest taking a bit extra time to go on the pedestrian bridge versus the more direct road bridge, a very cool trial. I wish I had my bike to explore more!

Sara is easy to deal with, this apartment is fantastic, and it is a very good value. Would definitely stay here again.
We had an excellent stay. Enjoyed drinking coffee out on the patio in the morning and sitting in front of the fire at night.
great accommodation, very roomy and a good location. loved the fire that Sara built for us!

Sara was great--so thoughtful and pleasant.
The apartment is very spacious, comfortable, and quiet.
The garden is beautiful too--it is definitely a garden studio apartment!

This was a perfect introduction to airbnb.  Sara is lovely and welcoming and the garden apartment far exceeded our expectations. It is decorated well, bed was very comfortable and it was fabulous having a small kitchen  and access to the garden patio.  I never want to  stay in a hotel again. We will definitely recommend Sara and her apartment to anyone we know visiting Salem.

Sara was an amazing host. My visit to Salem was business related and very busy. Sara was very helpful with working around my crazy schedule to get me the keys. The place was very nice and felt like a home. She has a beautiful garden and patio area that is great for sitting and enjoying a cup of coffee in the morning. I hope next time I am in Salem I can bring my family for a visit of leisure.
Loved it just as much the second time.  Especially the laundry!

Sara is a great host.  The garden studio is a large apartment with everything you need.  The little kitchen was so convenient, and Sara had even stocked the essentials.  We started the fire on the last night of our stay and it was very toasty.  The backyard garden is very private, and so beautiful!  We extended our stay and Sara was very accomodating.  Would definately stay again.

I Highly recommend staying with Sara.  My wife and I were riding a tandem bike from Eugene to Portland.   Sara helped us by finding local bike maps even before we arrived.  For breakfast she prepare non-gluten ingredients to meet our special needs.  The space is bright and clean and includes a large kitchen with a washer dryer!.  It even has a wood burning stove for extra warmth, and a beautiful garden.  You may not want to leave.

This studio is great! It's very peaceful and serene and Sara keeps it clean and well stocked. It's pretty much the perfect home away from home. Sara is an excellent host, very easy to talk to and provides great info on the area - she even filled me in on the local vernacular :)

I will definitely stay again next time I'm in Salem.
Sara is so warm and welcoming. It was my first time on airbnb so I was worried it might be a bit awkward, but it wasn't at all. I highly recommend Sara as a host.

My mother and I really enjoyed our stay at Sara's garden studio apartment.  It was clean, comfortable and was our home away from home for 11 days.  We would definitely stay here again when visiting the area.  Thank you Sara!

We stayed two nights in this lovely place.  The apartment is private, roomy and tidy with lots of good books and resources about the area.  The garden is spectacular.  Sara was a great host--we really enjoyed talking with her and wish we would have had more time to talk.  She was extremely helpful and provided coffee, berries, and granola for breakfast--unexpected but very much appreciated.  Highly recommend staying here.

Sara was so sweet and helpful! We had a very busy schedule while visiting Salem since we were visiting our friends for their wedding just outside of the city. There were alot of events planned where we didn't come back until late in the night but Sara made everything so easy. Since we didn't get back until late sometimes, it was great that we had a separate entrance to enter the apartment. You wouldn't even know that anyone was upstairs, it was so quiet! The apartment was very clean and well kept. The kitchen was totally stocked with everything you can think of and she even had the fridge stocked with the essentials! This was our first air bnb experience and we will defiantly rent again if all our hostesses are like Sara!! Whenever we are back in Salem this is the only place we will stay now!
Sara and her apt. are wonderful! She provides everything a traveller might need. Our stay there was very convenient, peaceful and pleasant

I rented this place for a whole month(!) and Sarah was a great hostess. She was so friendly and made me feel at ease being so far away from my friends and family. Her apartment was clean and comfortable. There is a mini-fridge, stove top, washer and dryer available. Lots of good parks nearby for running or walking. The neighborhood was safe and I would stay here again if in Salem.

I was on a Travel nurse assignment and spent one month of it at a hotel type apt, very nice to have it cleaned but it was close to the highway and really kind of dull and not much nature around. When I saw the garden apt it was just what I wanted and when I got in touch with Sara she was a sweetheart, easy to talk to and has become a friend. The apt is sweet and surrounded by gardens, really is what I needed and wanted. Have another month to go and Sara has been very accomodating. She also knows everything there is to know about the area!!!

Since this was my first experience as an Airbnb guest, I didn't know exactly what to expect...but I was pleasantly surprised. Sara was an excellent host, very attentive to my (rather minimal) needs. The apartment was removed enough from the hustle and bustle of city traffic to be peaceful, but close enough that I could get where I wanted to go without difficulty. All in all, it was a VERY pleasurable experience...and exactly the kind of thing for which I was looking while staying in Salem. I hope my next experiences with Airbnb come even close to approaching this caliber.

Sara's apartment is very charming and spacious.  I loved the cozy bed. I enjoyed the patio and garden, which I'm sure must be beautiful in summertime. (I was there in rainy April.)  Everything was very clean and comfortable.  I liked the little book-lined sitting room, and the kitchen had everything you'd need.  Sara is warm and helpful and I would have enjoyed chatting with her if I'd had more time, especially about her garden.  A delightful place to stay if you're visiting Salem!

I came to Salem for a conference and was not familiar with the area. Sara and the Garden Studio Apt. were wonderful! Sara met me there to give some instructions on the fireplace, amenities etc. and just to be a great and personable hostess. I indicated that I was interested in birding while I was in the area since I was traveling by foot while attending the conference and she immediately had me borrow a book specializing in the specific bird species of the area that I took on my walks each day. Her library is a wonderful resource for any traveler- just as Sara is fount of knowledge herself! I left knowing that this will be the place that I stay in Salem from now on!

We recommend Saras' garden apartment in Salem.  This is a very pleasant space to be in with a lovely garden all around.  Sara is a welcoming and good host.  We were  treated to breakfast supplies that were delicious and much appreciated as it saved on some running around and expense over a busy weekend.
The room was spacious and clean. The kitchen had basic staples. Sara was warm and inviting. The bed was comfortable. If we ever came to Salem we would stay here again

Sara is a very friendly, helpful, and accommodating host.  The apartment has tons of information on the area and she provided great recommendations on places to visit in the area.  The apartment is exactly as shown in the photos and is stocked with anything you would need to make it functional.  She was also very helpful when my traveling partner had a dental emergency and got us in with a specialist recommended by her dentist - that's not something you want to just find using google!  I look forward to staying there again!

We had planned to stay two nights, but a medical emergency required an additional two nights.  Sara made other arrangements for the guests who would have had the space we were in.  She was very graciously accommodating in our time of need.

Loved Sara's Garden Studio. It was great space for our family and she was so accommodating. It is also really close to a number of food spots and quick trip across river to downtown Salem. Plan a trip in July to get some fresh berries from the garden!

Staying at Sara's was the best decision I made here in Salem!  It's such a beautiful property with something new blooming all the time. The location is great for accessing downtown and really any other parts of Salem. It's also a half mile walk to the grocery store and post office. Sara makes great recommendations and is willing to share a lifetime of knowledge of the area. I will be back!

Sara is a wonderful host.  It is almost like staying with family - she is outgoing and friendly and respects your privacy.  Sara has a very comfortable home and beautiful (and fruitful) garden.  I would definitely stay there again next time I am in Salem.

Sara is AMAZING!!!!! And so very thoughtful!  Her studio apartment felt very much like home during my stay and it was very hard to leave.  Sara has a lot of knowledge of Oregon and the tourist places to visit and even provided me with a driver's manual to help me drive on the "wrong" side of the road.  I will definitely be coming back to Oregon and will definitely be looking up Sara's studio apartment again.  Thank you so much Sara for everything.  xoxo

This is a spacious apartment located within a quick drive to downtown Salem or Willamette University (where we were visiting our son).  Sara greeted us and made sure we knew where everything was.  The kitchen is well equipped.  Would definitely stay here again.

My mother and I stayed at Sarah's place and absolutely loved it. The apartment was very clean, spacious and inviting. We felt comfortable right away. Sarah made sure we had breakfast foods and all the information we needed for the apartment and the Salem area. We appreciated the privacy we had, coupled with the warm and friendly interactions we had with Sarah. If we ever have a need for a place in Salem again, we'll be checking if Sarah's is available. I'd love to enjoy a morning cup on the patio everyday. Such a gorgeous garden! We highly recommend staying at Sarah's.

Sara was an exceptional host and very accomodating at all times.  Very friendly and totally separate entrance from main house on th upper level. The studio apt is actually quite large and clean with all the necessary items.  Parking is very easy and the location very good.  Close to downtown Salem.  We have nothing but positive comments and memories of our 1 month stay at Sara's.

I stayed at Sara's apartment with my husband and daughter and it was the perfect place for us. We loved it!!! Sara was a wonderful host: friendly, showed us around her apartment, helpful with suggestions of places to go and where to acquire things we might need in Salem, and then left us to ourselves. Sara also provided a wonderful variety of food, which was a sweet surprise! Her place was great for the 3 of us. Plenty of room, warm and cozy, quiet, and a lovely view into the garden. I would like to go back in spring or summer and enjoy the yard and patio. The kitchen was stocked with a wide variety of pots, pans, knives and cute dishes. Great to be able to fix small meals. The apartment is very visually pleasing with Sara's furnishings and art. And she also has a huge selection of books to keep you entertained.

The neighborhood is off a busy road, but it was quiet at Sara's home and felt safe. We were able to walk to stores in the area, which had everything we needed and if we'd had more time, we would have walked to the waterfront park.

Our experience at Sara's garden apartment was better than we anticipated and we all hope to stay there again in the future.

Sara is a kind, graceful and accomodating host. The booking process was easy and smooth, the stay was very pleasant, and even though I was stuck in the apartment for a couple of days, due to a freak snow storm, I couldn't have been in a better place, with a wood-burning stove, plenty of wood, a fully stocked kitchen, cozy living room, comfortable bedroom and bathroom.
This is the second time we have stayed at Sara's and this time we were able to enjoy the beauty of the garden in full bloom.  Would stay again if we are there in the future.

We enjoyed our stay at Sara's. She lives in a quiet neighborhood and has a lovely secluded backyard for her guests to enjoy. The bed and pillows were a little too firm for me, but did enjoy the other furnishings and mini kitchen area. Thanks Sara!
Really enjoyed our stay at Sara's. Would recommend.

We enjoyed our stay in Sara's Garden studio in Salem. It was very spacious, with a separate sitting/dining room and a kitchen. It's more like an apartment with large bedroom than a studio. It was well furnished and the gardens were very pleasant. You had to walk through them to get to the unit.
The unit was very clean, large, private and very pleasant to stay in.
We never did meet Sara, but her daughter was in contact with us -- so everything was arranged and fine.
We would be happy to stay here again if we are back to Salem.

Very nice! I spent 6 nights while I conducted business in town. Everything is as described in the description / photos and other reviews so I won't repeat it all. I'll just add a few things and say that Sara was very welcoming and helpful!

The neighborhood is quiet, and very close to several parks to enjoy (don't miss the pedestrian bridge over the river). Access to downtown is very easy. The backyard garden is a very peaceful place to sit and enjoy. There is a table/chairs to eat meals or do some work. Lots of books and TV/DVD to keep you entertained along with good wireless internet. It's great to be able to make some meals when you travel and the self-contained kitchen area has everything you'd need.

It was perfect for what I needed - would definitely stay here again if I'm in the area.

This is an amazing spot...much more than we expected. Sara was so helpful with info about Salem and the areas around it, and she was also flexible for our schedule. The place was so clean AND roomy. The outdoors, just gorgeous. Parking was right outside the door and the neighborhood was great! Can't wait to visit Salem again and stay at this Airbnb. Thanks, Sara!

Our stay in Salem was great. The apt. was clean and cool and very quiet.  The apt. is close to the park, downtown and shopping.. and there are great tamales at the bottom of the hill.  Sara was helpful and kind and overall the visit was great.  The entire place was very well-appointed and Sara made every effort to ensure our pleasant stay. Thank you!

Thank you kindly, Sara! We really enjoyed meeting you - your welcome was warm and we appreciated your thoughtful check-ins to make sure we could find everything and to make sure we were enjoying our stay.

Your apartment was delightful, clean, safe, peaceful, and true to your description. Our favorite part of our stay was sitting in your garden with our morning coffee. Thank you for your sincere hospitality - we loved the fresh berries and hope to stay with you again:)

Best,
Jim and Michael

Sara's place is wonderful! It is a spacious apartment, very well equipped, clean, with a great patio to relax. The place is very quiet. Downtown and shops are within walking distance. Sara was a perfect host, helpful, communicative, and cordially. I can definitely recommend Sara's apartment!

Beautiful 'mother-in-law' apartment that 3 of us stayed in! Sara was very helpful, made excellent recommendations and made us feel very comfortable and welcome. Great place to stay as it was relaxing and close to many of Salem's amenities!

I stayed in the garden studio apartment with my two teenaged daughters. At first they were skeptical that we were "staying in someone's house" rather than a traditional hotel. But within hours they were commenting about how much they like the place. I agreed.

We had plenty of room. And there was a lovely garden that we enjoyed sitting in. We all felt like we had the space, peace and privacy that a hotel does not afford. I felt like I was staying in a friends apartment -- there were lots of homey touches like a great selection of books and provisions for the first morning. Sara also left a notebook listing everything from the wifi code to local restaurants.

Sara was out of town during our stay, but she had arranged for her adult daughter to be available for help. We ended up calling her for help with the wifi. She was totally responsive and had the wifi up and running within the agreed upon timeframe.

In short, it was a great stay. I look forward to returning. Feels like home away from home.

Sara was a wonderful host. She responded to my request right away. That prompt communication continued throughout my stay. Upon my arrival, she was kind enough to have laid out some snacks, provide me a tour of the space, and point me in the direction of some local restaurants.

The space was just as described and offered all I could possibly need during my visit to Salem. I would definitely stay again!
Spacious, secluded & sparkling clean!  Sara's place is perfect and especially nice if you are staying for any length of time.  All if our needs were met!  Graciously!
Our host was very responsive & helpful. The place was perfectly clean, and as described. We really appreciated this option, as I was "over" hotels and our need was immediate.

This was my second time staying at Sara’s. It is such a comfortable and peaceful place to stay – I can’t imagine staying anywhere else when visiting Salem. Sara is an awesome host… she is very warm and easy going. She is available if needed, but still gives you your privacy.

The kitchen is well stocked, including all you need for making coffee and some healthy snacks. I appreciate that the bathroom is also well stocked with a hair dryer, shampoo and even hairspray.

I would highly recommend Sara’s place to anyone visiting Salem.

Sara was very accommodating during our stay.  She was flexible on our arrival time and even provided a few small things we needed for packing before we left.  The apartment was very spacious and the sitting room with the eating table was just lovely.  We didn't realize from the listing that the apartment actually had a kitchenette so were pleasantly surprised to see that!  Essentially the kitchen was fully stocked and Sara left us breakfast food AND snacks for the entire stay....MUCH more than we've ever had left out for us at any other airbnb site.  She even left us fresh fruit and veggies from her garden.  We had a very nice stay and would recommend her apartment to others!

I live in Salem and stayed here for three weeks while looking for a long-term rental. The place is nice and the bedroom is spacious. There is a wood-burning stove and plenty of wood to help keep the place cozy.

The kitchen has a toaster oven and a portable two-burner electric stove. Not a full setup, but enough to easily make some small meals.

I work downtown, and it is about a 30-minute walk. This takes you through parks on both sides of the river. In the rainy season, you'll get a bit soggy on the trip, but it would be a great walk in the dry months.

Sarah was a nice, friendly host. This is a great place for one or two people. I would stay here again.

This was a perfect place to land for a college visit to Willamette.
It is cozy, and inviting, and just as pictured. The three separate yet connected spaces provide flexibility for both my son and I. Sara is warm and helpful and helped us stay warm by getting a roaring fire going on a particularly cold night. The neighborhood is easy to navigate- just about two miles from Willamette, close to everything.

Sara was a great host. My plans changed at the last minute and she was very accommodating. The apartment was even bigger that I expected, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. I really only slept at the apartment and never cooked, but the kitchen looked well stocked and ready. I would definitely recommend both the location and the host, Sara.

Sara was a great host. We were unable to stay at her garden studio apartment, but had a second property available very close to the train and the rest of town. The neighborhood was quiet and the house was beautiful. Perfect for a couple looking to getaway for a little while. Sara patiently waited for my boyfriend and I to arrive (our train was delayed) and was very welcoming. She let us know about restaurants and the park and the nearest supermarket. We really couldn't have asked for a more perfect place to stay and a more helpful host. Thank you!

Sara was an amazing hostess! We loved the garden studio and it was perfect for our family. Our girls enjoyed waking up each morning and spending time in the garden. The location is perfect for getting around Salem. We will be back again!

This lovely property with fantastic garden is quiet, peaceful, and private, while being close to downtown Salem.  We spent four nights here during our relocation to Salem.  Sara is a welcoming and helpful host; she has filled the spacious studio with wonderful books, art and pottery pieces.  The decor is tastefully and charmingly eclectic.  We give Sara and this property our highest recommendation!

Sara is a wonderful and welcoming host and her Garden Studio apartment is fantastic. The apartment is comfortable, spacious and well-stocked with just about everything needed. Sara had fresh fruit and veggies and wine waiting for our arrival. There was a more than adequate variety of breakfast items along with milk, tea and coffee to send us off with a good start each day. The quiet location is only a few minutes drive from the heart of downtown and is easily walkable through pleasant parks and trails and the old railroad bridge across the river. We were in town for an American Volkssport Association convention and with morning walks and afternoon convention sessions our schedule was very full. It was so relaxing to come back each evening to the privacy and serenity of Sara's beautifully landscaped garden apartment. If we are ever back in Salem we will certainly look first to Sara for our lodging.

If you are unsure about Airbnb, stay at Sara's and you will be an instant convert!  This lovely, huge and spotlessly clean downstairs apartment, with private patio, full kitchen (small fridge and two-burner cooktop), washer and dryer, and all the closet space you might want was the highlight of our trip.  Sara was excellent at keeping in touch through texting and e-mail.  She greeted us the evening we arrived by bringing us fresh raspberries, yogurt, English muffins, and soy milk.  Also in the fridge were cut vegetables and hummus for dipping, a variety of jams (some homemade), oranges, apples, a kiwi, half and half for coffee, a bottle of wine.  There was granola in the cupboard and trail mix on the counter.  We read through the binder of local information (restaurant menus, etc.) and my husband took some of the walks she suggested.  We were walking distance to a grocery, restaurants, and a riverside park where there was a world music festival going on, yet Sara's house is an oasis of calm and quiet.  We opened the blinds and the patio door and luxuriated in the garden setting.

We communicated with Sara as we arrived and she was there to greet us. She showed us the apartment and went over what we needed to know. She also informed us of places and local events happening in the area and how to get there.

The apartment was as described and was clean and well provisioned. It was in a very quiet neighborhood with a private entrance and a private patio garden to sit and read in.

We would certainly recommend this to others and return if heading to Salem again.
Sara is a wonderful host. She goes the extra mile. The apartment is excellent, clean, spacious, and well appointed.  This was outstanding value.

My husband and I had a wonderful experience staying at Sara's studio apartment. It was beautiful, spacious, and fully equipped with anything we would need, including a fridge full of yummy food that Sara had thoughtfully bought. Sara sent us very detailed instructions in advance and gave us a quick tour when we arrived, so everything went smoothly. She also provided us with a binder of useful information about Salem, which was much appreciated for two people who had never visited the city before. Also the location of her place is great and very convenient - minutes from downtown, but in a quiet neighborhood. We would stay there again in a heart beat!
We very much enjoyed Sara's cool apartment on a hot Oregon weekend.  Our 5 yo son enjoyed an eclectic collection of children's and art books and a family Go-Fish game on the a beautiful garden patio.

We very much enjoyed staying at Sara's beautiful, spacious, downstairs apartment in West Salem. We had a refrigerator filled with yummy breakfast items and also enjoyed eating our meals on the grapevine covered patio. We had an interesting talk with Sara and felt instantly connected to her.  This is definitely a place that I would highly recommend. Katharina
Sara's studio is very spacious and well-lit. She has a great collection of books about the region, and was also available to give recommendations. I would recommend her place for visitors to Salem.

My husband and I stayed at Sara's in law apartment for a long weekend in July and were so glad we did. The neighborhood was very peaceful and quiet and a great home base for our wine touring. We loved her place- from the beautiful decore to the garden patio- we felt so at home. The master bed was maybe the most comfiest I have ever slept in and the living room/library was a great spot too. Sara really thought of everything and had breakfast items and and snacks waiting for us in the kitchen. If you are considering staying here, we would definitely recommend it. Such a beautiful, comfortable roomy apartment.
We enjoyed our stay with Sara, check in was smooth and the apartment was clean and comfortable. Very nice outdoor area too.  Thanks Sara.

Sara's place was amazing!  The apartment was clean, private, comfortable, conveniently located and beautiful. My husband, my daughter and I had a great stay.  We felt that finding Sara's place was a stroke of good fortune.  I would recommend it many times over!

Sara was wonderful.  She was very welcoming and kind.  She had a lot a great information in a binder about the Salem area.  The neighborhood of West Salem is a lovely mix of older and new homes and is very safe.  The site was more than we expected and we were pleasantly surprised.  We would stay there again.
We really enjoyed the garden studio. Lots of room and very comfortable. Sara is a good host and welcoming.
Sarah's place was just perfect for us. Very quite, comfortable and convenient to downtown . Sarah was great, friendly but gave us our space. Would definitely recommend.

We were in Salem for a friend's wedding (actually in Independence, at the Rogue Hop Farm) and were thrilled to book with Sara. The house is easy to find, and the lower level kept nice and cool during a hot summer weekend.

The kitchen is well-stocked with dishes and utensils, and Sara was kind to ask us prior to our arrival what we preferred for breakfast -- she had the little refrigerator stocked with fruit, eggs, and yogurt. There was a little coffee maker, along with an electric kettle and french press (which we prefer).

There are two beds -- a queen and a twin (I think) and the queen size bed has a very firm mattress, for those that prefer firm mattresses.

Sara was a wonderful host, and we had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay in Salem! Thanks, Sara!

Sara's garden apartment is lovely.  Very clean.  Stocked with welcoming goodies in the fridge.  Sara was a gracious, friendly, warm hostess.  She brought down a bottle of wine and some snacks to share with us as we sat outside in her yard and chatted. It was a nice way to unwind after a day-long road trip.  We were very comfortable and would stay again.

This is a lovely place to stay. Sara is very welcoming, and friendly(she had some toys that she put out for our 3 year old:) The location is nice and quiet, with a garden patio right out the door. The space is good sized and well appointed. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, great experience!

We enjoyed our stay at Sara's. She was very hospitable, yet unobtrusive and still seemed to know exactly when we needed to see her. We felt welcomed our entire 6 weeks in the charming garden apartment. For the first four weeks our weather was mild so we could enjoy the outside patio, in a a very pleasing landscape, and each evening would find us under the grape arbor with refreshments discussing the day and planning for the next day. The apartment itself is nicely appointed and decorated, providing an overall cozy feeling, especially as the days began to get cooler and rainier.
Sara is highly knowledgeable about OR and Salem - she gave us many pointers that we used to become more familiar with Salem and OR.
Salem turned out to be a very good location for us as we explored McMinnville, Portland, and Corvallis. And, when we needed a break, we took Sara up on her suggestions for long walks by heading to parks in Salem and several others an hour or so from Salem. Needless to say, OR has some spectacular forests and coastal preserves. Overall, we had an excellent stay at Sara's.

Sara was wonderful and her place was PERFECT. I'm just sorry I didn't get to visit with her longer. Such a busy time of year for me, that I was exhausted! Her bed was VERY comfortable and I was not expecting her to have the fireplace going when I arrived. Made it nice and warm and cozy! I do hope she allows me to come visit again!
Thanks Sara!

Sara offers a wonderful place to stay.  This was our 2nd visit, and it was just as great as the first!  Sara is very welcoming, easygoing, friendly and helpful. You couldn't ask for a better host.  The apartment is so comfortable and has everything we need.  The neighborhood is quiet and within walking distance of shops and a beautiful riverfront park.  We will definitely stay here again when we're in the area.

Sara was a very welcoming hostess. She greeted me as I drove up to the house and showed me around the apartment, as well as provided maps and a magazine that highlighted local attractions.

I was working a distance from the city during my stay so I wasn't there often during the day, but enjoyed my brief interactions with Sara and wished I wasn't so busy so we could talk longer. She was very accommodating and allowed me to move furniture around to make the space work for me. She also checked in occasonally to see how the kitchenette space was working for me. I did find that for me personally, I needed a full size kitchen to feel at home. There were windows in all the rooms of the unit except the bathroom and kitchenette. Someone who likes natural light when they cook might want to consider this.

The neighborhood was pleasantly quiet and there were several conveniences within walking distance. I enjoyed the park that was within walking distance as well as the river.

Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it for anyone looking for a weekend stay or few weeks stay.

Sara is wonderful-- she is warm and friendly and goes out of her way to make you feel like a family friend who has come to visit. We arrived very late at night, yet she was kind, greeted us with a bottle of wine and snacks and exactly what we asked for in the refrigerator for a lovely breakfast-- and terrific coffee too! You are minutes away from stores and a lovely walk across a bridge to Salem's sweet downtown.

The apartment was a nice surprise-- much much larger than we thought. It has two very large sleeping areas with privacy. I was there with my adult son and adult daughter and there was plenty of room. There is a marvelous library and sitting room, with a fireplace that Sara keeps lit for your return from a rainy Salem day. The kitchen is a full kitchen with every imaginable cooking tool, spices and some staples. We were very happy to leave food there for the next lucky guests.

More than that-- we were in Salem to visit a critically ill family member and the week after we left, another set of family members arrived for a few hours-- and Sara took them in! She made the sun shine in the middle of an Oregon winter and we are so very grateful. You will enjoy this beautiful garden apartment and this warm and friendly host. We always stay in airbandb and Sara's place is one of the very, very best. If you are going to Salem, this is the place to stay.
Sara was a wonderful host and very pleasant to chat with. The apartment was large and open as well as nice and clean. I'd recommend staying with Sara any time you're in Salem.
Was very quite and cozy. The fireplace was welcoming and Sara provided snacks for our arrival and some breakfast foods which was much appreciated. Would stay again when in the Salem area!

Sara was a warm, welcoming host - all of our communication with her, both online and during our stay, was pleasant and efficient.
The neighborhood is quiet and convenient. The garden apartment is spacious, clean, well-equipped. Much more than a studio - both the kitchen and the "library" are separate rooms in addition to the large bedroom area. Comfortable bed(s) & plenty of nice linens. Great to have W/D use. Sara had asked what items we preferred for breakfast & also left treats of chocolate & fruit. All in all, highly
recommend a stay with Sara.
Hard to imagine a more perfect Airbnb: kind hostess; quiet, safe, neighborhood; comfortable bed; nice sitting area with pretty garden view and cozy fire.  Thank you so much!
Sara is an excellent host. The apt was clean and had all the comforts of home. Having breakfast food was a treat! Bed was comfortable. Would recommend staying here if traveling to Salem.

Sara's garden apartment is a relaxing spot with everything you need for a great stay in Salem.

The apartment was clean, bright, and charming, decorated with lots of art and objects from around the world. There were lots of books, including kids books, which we really enjoyed. There is a beautiful garden to enjoy, and it felt very private. Sarah brought in some of our favorite foods for breakfast, which was really going out of her way to make our stay nice. She even picked us blackberries from her garden! Yum.

We visited with our 3-year old son, and in his words, "Sarah is really nice!" We would definitely stay here again.

We absolutely loved our stay at Sara's. She was kind and friendly, the apartment was lovely and perfect for our needs. Sarah was very helpful in making it toddler safe for our son and she kindly provided blocks for him to play with. The garden was so beautiful and much larger than expected. Our son spent as much time playing outside as he could. The kitchen was just what we needed, I was able to cook our meals without issue using the hotplate and microwave. The linens on both beds were soft and pretty. We enjoyed the artwork and textiles in the apartment very much. The selection of books was very interesting and started my husband and I on some good conversations. Sarah directed us to an excellent park about a 20 mins walk (with toddler) away with an excellent playground, walking trail, and green space. The nearby grocery store had the organic items that we needed. We had such a lovely time and hope to stay there again next time we are in the area.

Sara is a wonderful hostess.  The kitchen was well stocked and she had  fresh picked cherries for us.  Her place is spacious and very quiet.  We met Sara the next day and she is a very gracious lady.  We will stay again.

Sara was an incredible host who went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and a big success! Sara offered advice for my stay and helped me navigate transportation around Salem. The apartment is a little gem-- spacious, clean and sunny and Sara is a great resource.
Sara is a great hostess, it is a roomy home/apartment. The garden outside the room is very nice. The area is quiet and peaceful.

Comfortable, quiet, charming are just a few words  to describe Sara's Garden studio apartment.  I slept great and especially enjoyed  the garden area outside the grape arbored patio and very private back yard.  Sara was so gracious with all the breakfast food that she left for me and my husband.  It was a pleasure to interact with her and stay in her studio apartment.  The neighborhood had very little traffic.  There is a large grocery store a few blocks away with a great selection of organic produce, hot and cold food bar, and deli, along with more conventional items.  We hope to return another time to enjoy the serenity of being in Sara's place.
Awesome stay! Great spot! Great hostess!

We arrived late from our cross country road trip to find a stocked fridge, Sara there to meet us and she had some vegetables that she need to use so she had cooked for us and shared a bottle of wine. Cannot rate her highly enough, I wish we could give six stars!
Sara was very accommodating . Great location near everything . We went to drop off our daughter to willamette university . Very close to the college . Nice residential area .
Sara was a great host and provided everything that I needed to be comfortable during my stay in Salem. She was available when I had questions and everything was so simple. Thanks Sara!

Sara was a great host!  The apartment was very warm and cozy, with a wonderful outdoor patio space. Sara was extremely gracious and easy to work with, and was flexible as we made some changes to our stay.  I would highly recommend Sara and her garden studio apartment!

We spent several comfortable days at Sara's.  She had thought of every possible item a guest could want.  She was friendly and helpful and best of all she had a great selection of good books.  Her cottage was conveniently located. d & d Tapley

The apartment is lovely, peaceful, comfortable, tastefully decorated, and well appointed. The location is perfect- a 25 minute scenic walk to downtown, and everything you need even closer, just a few blocks away. Sara is a great host-- friendly and accessible. I would definitely like to stay here again and I recommend it to others.

Sara is a wonderful host with a beautiful private place that was so much more than we expected. Would recommend her and definitely stay again. The cottage space is well equipped. There are many books with comfy places to relax and enjoy. Sara gives you your privacy, and also is a bright soul full of knowledge, especially about travel. I am thankful for all her care.

We had a wonderful time staying with Sara, her home is very well cared for and she is very accommodating. I would highly recommend staying here for anyone! This was our first Airbnb stay & we totally enjoyed our experience, will be doing this more!

A tranquil place to go and enjoy what the Salem Oregon has to offer - regardless of the weather!.Her place is close to down town and a great neigbourhood. Sarah is available for questions or suggestions  and provided everything that I needed to be comfortable during my stay in Salem.There are many instresting books to keep u busy and i have no complain about this place.I will recommend her place to anyone visiting salem and its surroundings.
Sara's place is amazing: more than comfortable with everything you could need, a fantastic bed, fabulous library and gorgeous garden. she's a wonderful person and host too.
I have recommended this place to all my friends! Sara is a terrific host and the house is clean and comfortable. I will be back for sure.
Lovely spacious home with all the amenities I could want on my business trip and then some. Nice patio and green space to relax in the backyard.

I stayed in this apartment while I was in Salem to attend events at Willamette University. The apartment was in a residential area about 5 - 8 minutes drive from campus and the shops and restaurants of downtown Salem, which was perfect for me. The apartment was spacious, comfortable, quiet and peaceful. The host was very kind and gracious, and quick to respond when I had any questions or needs. She provided delicious breakfast items and fresh, organic fruit upon my arrival. I'm a stickler for cleanliness and I found this apartment to be very clean and tidy --- far cleaner than the hotel I stayed at in Portland. If you're looking for a quiet and comfortable place to stay near downtown Salem, I highly recommend this apartment.

This rental felt very comfortable, I felt very much like I was in my home. The space is very well furnished, and even the colors felt well thought out. Sara was such a delightful host, making sure I had some food items, really nice! I hope to stay here again.

I had a wonderful stay at Sara's place! Her home is beautiful and has everything you'll need, including plenty of snacks :). She is also one of the most warm and welcoming hosts I've met. I highly recommend staying here!

Sara is extremely friendly and more than willing to share her knowledge of the area and beyond. The apartment is spacious and well kept. Sara provided breakfast supplies and the kitchen was well stocked.

This was our second stay with Sara and are looking forward to more stays in the future.
This is a lovely place and so comfortable. Sara has thought of everything a guest might need. I just wish we could have spent more time there and with her!

Make yourself at home in Sara's wonderfully comfortable home, surrounded by the most beautiful garden. It is the perfect place to relax with a good book. If you don't have one, Sara has an amazing library.

My wife and I spent two nights at Sara's at the beginning of a 17 day road trip from California to Canada and back. The apartment was exactly as described and depicted in the listing.

At the risk of repeating other travelers' descriptions, there are four separate rooms in the apartment: kitchen, living/reading room, large bedroom and 3/4 bathroom.

The kitchen is well equipped and Sara goes further providing granola, coffee, honey and other useful items. Any cooking would have to be done on a two-burner hotplate. We stuck to the water boiler, French Press and microwave.

Modern washer and dryer were great. The queen bed mattress is a bit too firm for me but I'm 63 and fussier than I used to be. Ten years ago it would have been fine. The daybed was softer and worked well for me.Towels were plentiful and of good quality.

Other features we appreciated were off-street parking in the driveway, a quiet neighborhood within 10 minutes of downtown and the courtyard garden outside our door.

We appreciated Sara's flexibility when we arrived later than originally planned. She was quick to respond to questions and communicated clearly. Sara is an outstanding host, both welcoming and professional and genuinely interested in making sure travelers have a positive experience. This will be our first choice for future visits to Salem.
Easy access to Salem.  Beautiful, spacious, and relaxing rooms.  Excellent host.
Sara's place was very comfortable, relaxing, beautiful yard to enjoy and overall a great place to stay in the Salem area.  Many extra special touches to make it feel like home.  Thanks again!

Perfect place for our stay in Salem. Comfortable, well-maintained, and very well-equipped space with a very quiet, private backyard patio out the door. Sara was also very warm and welcoming. I almost hate to give such a glowing review, because it may lead to Sara's place being booked the next time we want to reserve it! ;-)

Sara has a lovely place and my wife and I were very comfortable there. It is a perfect location for anybody in town for a softball tournament at the Wallace Marine Complex. Easy walk if you desire. Sara is a very nice host.

We chose Sara's apartment for the proximity to family we visited.  The area is residential and quiet but not secluded by any means.  It was well equipped to eat in as well as close to restaurants and the highways.  Communication was just what we needed.  Wifi worked great as we watched movies on the iPad at night.  TV was great for the morning - my son watched KQED cartoons while he ate breakfast.  Patio was serene but we didn't get to use it much since our schedule was packed.  Washer and dryer were an appreciated perk as well!

Loved the ambience with great art work all around and a beautiful garden to enjoy, plus a friendly visiting neighbor cat.  The host was wonderfully helpful and receptive to make the stay very comfortable and enjoyable.
Wonderful backyard. Sara had food for us for breakfast. So nice

We chose Sara's place because we were visiting friends in Salem, but wanted to have our own space. We were very happy with the accommodations. My husband and I were traveling with our one year old son and, while the apartment isn't childproof, per se, it was pretty easy with a toddler. There wasn't much he could get into. The apartment was very clean and the bed was firm and comfortable and Sara is very nice. Sara left a selection of breakfast foods--some English muffins, fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, etc which was really nice so we were able to have a light breakfast before heading out for the day, rather than eating out 3 times a day. Overall a great experience.

The garden apartment was just what we needed when visiting Salem. I visited during one of the hottest weeks and this basement apartment kept us cool. The garden creates a quiet retreat but you are close to lots of things to do. Sarah is on site if you have any questions. The apartment is very clean and is stocked with last minute things you might have forgotten.

Sara's garden apartment is beautiful and comfortable, the pictures don't do it justice. Sara was very friendly and helpful, once we were oriented to the space we had complete privacy but Sara was very prompt with answering texts if we had questions. Highly recommended!

We were pleasantly surprised at how large Sara's garden apartment was. It was clean, bright, cozy, and well-kept with a lovely garden outside and a plethora of fascinating books on the shelves. Sara kept in communication with us throughout our stay and responded swiftly when there was a minor issue with the toilet. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the place to friends.

The space was lovely, and Sara was a thoughtful and gracious host who was quick to respond to our messages. We really appreciated the selection of breakfast foods, and the patio/garden area was nice to sit outside and enjoy during the summer evenings. The beds were really comfortable with plenty of space for us to spread out. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

This was our first stay at an Airbnb. We were pleasantly surprised at the very clean and well maintained space. Anything you would need Sara has thought about and provided to make your stay feel like home.

We came down for the eclipse so spent three nights. There was plenty of space, nicely decorated with artwork. The private patio was perfect in the evening for cocktails or to enjoy the beautiful garden. The apartment is a very close drive to restaurants and night life. Sara has also put together a book of restaurant menus and reviews to help you navigate the downtown. There is a small fridge and well maintained kitchen so we were able to put together a few meals.

Sara was a great host who took the time to get to know us. She had many recommendations that added to our enjoyment of the time there based on our conversations. Sara's local knowledge made our eclipse viewing experience unforgettable.

Would definitely book here again if we are ever in Salem.
Sara is an incredibly smart and attentive person. I would recommend to anyone to stay at her place. Thanks Sara!!!

Sara was there to greet us and was very hospitable. The rooms were clean and well provided with items such as shampoo and other odds and ends. The one thing you need to keep in mind is to ensure you notate the security code so that you can use it when needed.

Sara’s place is a very cozy place and the photos did not do the place justice. The living room has a really good fireplace but remember to wear a pair of gloves to move wood. The place is very close to get to from Salem; most stuff you might need is close by too (Roth’s grocery and the Woodburn outlets are only a 30 minute drive away). Sara replies very fast and her place has almost everything you need. The area is safe and residential and very quiet at night. So if you’re in need of a place to stay for a longer period in Salem at a very reasonable price, Sara’s place is an excellent choice.
Peace, quiet, comfort. No hassle. Like staying at an old friend’s place.
Sara was wonderful and provided what was advertised. She made herself available and had a lovely introduction and gave us our privacy. Very good location and near active places in town.
Loved our near month stay in this garden apartment. It's spacious, comfortable with a great private patio.  Our host, Sara was pleasant and easy to contact.  We would stay here again!
Great apartment close to downtown Salem, wineries, cycling routes and birdwatching at the NWR.   Very nicely equiped kitchen, off street parking, private entrance and comfortable living space.
Clean, peaceful, private, and convenient location.

Sara was very easy to communicate with, she is a thoughtful host and provided more than we could ask for. She was very accommodating and seems like a thoughtful human in general.
The space is bigger than described, the bathroom is very spacious as are the sleeping areas. The French doors that open up the garden make for a very serene and peaceful morning. The library area was very comfortable for conversation and perusing a variety of books. The neighborhood felt very safe. This was a perfect end to a busy day.

Sara is a great host.  This is in a quiet neighborhood in an older house. The apartment opens to a patio which would be great to use in the warmer months.  Very roomy and comfortable.  She has everything you need and lots of extras.
Well worth the trip.  We really enjoyed our stay.
Sara is a wonderful host! She is very personable and thoughtful. The space has everything that is needed!
Friendly quick response. Clean roomy space in quiet neighborhood. Bike paths to historic downtown Salem.
Sara is a sweet hostess. This space is quiet, clean and private. There are awesome walking/biking trails close by. Would stay here again if in Salem.

Nice place located near downtown Salem, Oregon. Kitchen is limited in size and cooking options but my daughter and I planned on eating at restaurants mainly so that fit our intentions. Great host that communicated timely and gave us good advice on the area.

Sara's place was just want we needed for our time in Salem. It was clean and so roomy. The patio off the bedroom is so beautiful and calming. We enjoyed browsing her book selection. Sara was very helpful with information about the area. She provided tasty breakfast items for us and had several ways to make your morning cup of coffee. We will be back to stay with Sara again.

Sara's space was beautiful, roomy, and peaceful. My favorite part was the backyard garden and patio. Sara herself is personable and accommodating and even had breakfast food and fresh fruit for us when we arrived. The whole place is sparkling clean and her book collection is fun to peruse. Highly recommend and would stay here again.

The place and the hospitality were superb! The BNB was lovely.  Ericka was a gracious host.  I feel as though I've made a new friend. We appreciated the patio & garden and had our meals out there.  There is a grill for outdoor cooking.  It is a perfect spot for longer stays. Full use kitchen with washer and dryer. Sitting room and two bedrooms. We really appreciated being able to stay there. We will look to stay there again when in Salem.
Wonderful place that it would be a pleasure to stay at again!
Loved Sara's place. She and her daughter were very responsive and helpful! Great suggestions for local spots to check out. Incredibly charming place!!

This place has lovely décor, is immaculate, includes all the necessary amenities,  has a beautiful backyard, and is in a very convenient location.  The host is friendly and gracious. We had a great experience, and we would definitely book a return visit.

Sara’s place is a beautifully decorated little apartment full of vintage touches, and it’s extremely clean. It’s in a convenient location, and Sara is very helpful about the area. The private garden is wonderful. We enjoyed our four days there very much.
Very private and comfortable. Highly recommend.
The garden apartment is cute and quite spacious. It feels homey and is very comfortable. It is perhaps my favorite Airbnb stays to date.

Sara is a fantastic host. She provided for every need and added thoughtful touches above and beyond, like homegrown and homemade breakfast goodies waiting for us upon our arrival. She was responsive to questions and both open and available, but left us to our privacy otherwise, which we appreciated. The Garden Studio Apartment was perfect for our stay in Salem. It has some (very) minor quirks such as a small tv with limited cable, or a small kitchen (but cleverly laid out & well supplied) - nothing that was an issue for us in the least. On the contrary, it suited us perfectly. It was clean and snug, quiet and restful, with a cozy gas fireplace,  comfy plush couch, shelves full of good books and comfortable beds. We could look out upon the private garden sanctuary from the dining table, sitting area or bedroom, or better yet we could just walk out and sit in it. We would definitely stay in it again for a future trip to the Salem area.  Highly recommend!
A very beautiful space, quiet and refreshing.  Calm and soothing atmosphere. Sara is wonderful host and this will be our first choice when we return to Salem. Thank you Sara.

This is probably one of the best AirB&B's in Salem, OR.
Our Host, Sara, is a great lady..makes sure all is taken care of and every detail completed. Cozy garden apt. with gas fireplace, well stocked kitchen, large bedroom w/patio doors to outside patio. Second bedroom and bath
makes up the rest.
So cozy and welcoming...we felt at home for our extended stay.
Many places to go for lunch or dinner and ww were able to take our daily walk in the park close by.
All was such a delightful stay!!!
L & J
Sara was a great host! The apartment was clean and well stocked, and she was very responsive to messages. Sara also was willing to share information about the area and was fun to talk with.

Sara's garden apt is quiet, clean, and delightful! Sara had extra local information, maps, restaurant menus, and walking tours. The apt has a mini fridge and one can access a freezer in the nearby garage. Beds were comfy and temperature was easy to control. Her place is on a pretty hill with easy walking or driving access to everything needed.
I would definitely stay there again; Sara is super!

Sara was absolutely amazing, very accommodating, and great to talk to when our paths crossed.  Very private, and she's very responsive.  A fuse blew during my stay in the bathroom, and she was able to get it fixed really quickly!  I would absolutely recommend her place.  Really great!
The host canceled this reservation 12 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
What a wonderful and cozy place with the most kind and accommodating host!
Sara made us feel very welcome, was great with our 7 year old son, and her place is great!   Thank you!!!
Wonderful place to stay.

I don't know how I found this listing but I am so happy that I did. I left Texas for an 8 week contract in Oregon, first time there. Let me start by saying that the pictures don't do this listing justice. The place is absolutely beautiful, big, clean, quiet and very comfortable. Sara was such an amazing host and the Airbnb exceeded my expectations. She went above and beyond by welcoming me, walking me through every aspect of the beautiful studio, going with me on walks (after I voiced a desire to start exercising), giving me numbers of her family and friends to contact while she was on vacation, giving me information about where to get groceries, where to go for locally made bread, coffee, etc. The studio was fully stocked with breakfast items, toiletries, and so much more. The fireplace in the den was perfect for the rainy days of Oregon. The host offered to pick me up from enterprise when I dropped off my rental car. Also offered to take me grocery shopping in her car. I felt like I was at home, among family, during my time here. Sara is very respectful, friendly, accommodating, quick to resolve issues, and easy to talk to. If work brings me to Salem again, I will definitely book this place again.

We enjoyed this beautiful, clean, peaceful garden apartment this past weekend!  The kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed and many extras.  The bed was very comfortable as were the other seating spots in the apartment.  We used the outdoor space as well with a picnic and BBQ.  Sara has made the apartment and garden spot feel very homey and comfy and we plan to return on our next visit to West Salem!

Sara was such a wonderful host and her apartment is so cozy. We were so glad we decided to stay there while we were in town. We would highly recommend her place to anyone traveling through the Salem area.
We love staying at Sara’s garden apt!  Sara is friendly and the apt is great for us!
Clean, comfortable, and considerate! Would rent again in a heartbeat

The Garden Studio apartment was perfect for me on an almost week-long visit to my elderly father, who lives nearby at Capital Manor.  It was just close enough so that I could go back "home" to eat my lunch and "recharge my batteries", and then head back to Capital Manor for the rest of the afternoon. On chilly mornings it was so pleasant to sit drinking my coffee next to the warm fireplace. Thank you, Sara!
Super clean and cozy space. Had everything we needed for our trip. Thank you Sara and Eryca!

Sara's basement apartment is lovely and clean; a good size for 1-3 people to stay. The fireplace and heat exchanger kept the rooms warm enough, and Sara showed me how to use everything. The kitchen is a little small and haphazard, but it had everything needed if you wanted to cook. You can hear the floor creaking above and the sound of conversation but otherwise it's very quiet.

The neighborhood is clean and safe, a short 7-min walk from some local restaurants and a market. I'd absolutely recommend for someone to stay here for a short trip!
Was a wonderful spot for visiting family. Very convenient location to store, restaurants, etc. Cozy home and beautiful yard! Sara was a wonderful host!
Great, quiet location with everything you need for your stay. Would stay there again when I’m in the area!

Sara’s place is amazing and located in West Salem, but it’s an easy drive to everywhere! Sara made sure to think of everything, and even let us borrow a blanket to visit the park (a must with the rose garden).

I cannot recommend this place enough

This apartment was perfect for the two of us on our visit to Salem. Sara was beyond helpful! I took full advantage of the lush and beautiful garden to sit outside and do a little work. My husband got some kind of pollen in his eye and had a pretty big allergic reaction;  nothing life threatening but super uncomfortable! Sara came to the rescue with an OTC allergy medicine that made him a little drowsy, but did the trick. The location was incredibly convenient to downtown restaurants and on our frequent house hunting excursions. The space is larger than it looks and incredibly clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the fireplace in the evening and we used the kitchen each morning to make breakfast. Sara also had a freezer we could access for our ice cream! This was our first Air BNB experience and Sara made it amazing.

I had a nice and quiet stay here. Its very much like a sublet except homier, which is perfect if your looking for your own space where you dont share amenities. Also, there is a nice backyard space which is packed with nice plants and feel tranquil. A lot sunlight enters the whole place as well.

We were in Salem for a softball tournament and the close proximity to the ball field, restaurants and grocery store was very desirable. The apartment had everything that we needed and it was very peaceful and quite.  We felt as though we were in a country retreat with the view out the french doors to the patio, flowers and trees.  For those who enjoy reading, there is the library OR bring your own and enjoy the atmosphere.  Will absolutely return if we have another tournament in Salem.

This was the perfect secluded space to stay in. The kitchen gave me the opportunity to make my own meals as I have many food allergies. The space was like a cottage in a fairy garden. I loved it! And getting to it was incredibly easy. Sara was very sweet and kind.
Sara’s place is very comfortable and charming. Super clean, plenty of towels and breakfast items. Sara was so friendly and helpful, very responsive. We enjoyed our stay!
The Garden Studio apartment is a perfect place to stay in West Salem.  It is pleasant and quiet, and has everything you will need. Sara is a wonderful host.

Sara’s Airbnb is lovely, spacious, and has everything one could need.  The bedding is super comfy, temperature easy to adjust, kitchen well-equipped and overall- clean and homey.  I was super glad she had a tea kettle and extra tea bags on hand.  Coffees too.  I felt very safe and secure in the sweet, hilltop neighborhood.
Sara provided some extras which made me feel extra welcome  — very yummy coffee and granola that I recognized as being from Trader Joes (which I generally don’t eat because I love it too much).
Wonderful host, cozy place!
Sean was nothing less of a fantastic host. The place was clean, the neighborhood was quiet. It was a real gem of a find
Sean was very responsive and so kind. His place is clean, very quiet and affordable. We spent seven nights here and I would totally book it again.
I very much enjoyed my stay at Sean's.  What a cute house!

Our stay here was absolutely perfect! Julie and Bill were exceptionally gracious hosts. The property is charming, beautiful, clean, quiet, and meticulously maintained. We decided that after our stay here that we preferred this lovely carriage house over our own home. Bill and Julie... Adopt us please!?

The space had been recently remodled/updated and the two crucial facets of a b&b were top notch... the bed was large and oh so comfy, the shower was spacious with plenty of pressure and hot water. Equipped with everything we needed, this room was PERFECT. Bonus points for being walking distance to Bush's pasture park where we were working for the weekend.

All in all we wouldn't change a thing. Highly reccomended!

Julie and Bill's place was my boyfriend and my first ever Air B&B experience and we loved it. The place was extremely clean and well stocked with showering items, dishes, linens and some delicious fruit, granola, and iced tea. We enjoyed the patio after dinner (we ate at the littlest roadhouse) with a bottle of wine and gorgeous wine glasses. We slept so well in such an amazingly comfortable bed. In the morning we enjoyed a walk around the park and checked out some local spots in town which Julie and Bill recommended. We will definitely recommend to friends and hope to come back for more stays! Thank you Julie and Bill for welcoming us to your home and to the state of Oregon.

From the second we arrived Julie made us feel very comfortable. Every day she made sure we had everything we needed. The room was impeccable. It was exactly how it was described. Very clean and well appointed. Julie left drinks and snacks in the refrigerator (yogurt, granola, bagels, fruit). This was our first airbnb experience and we really felt julie went above and beyond to make our stay great. If we are ever in Oregon again, we will absolutely stay with Julie.

What a perfect little getaway nest! The hosts were so thoughtful in the appointment of the apartment and the setting was peaceful, beautiful and convenient. A lovely way to spend a night away from home.

The place was immaculate and inviting. If I had the time I would have enjoyed a longer stay here. The hostess was very kind, worked with my schedule, and has my highest recommendation to any prospective tenants.

This was the perfect Airbnb experience for my husband and me. This is a well-loved, recently renovated home with a wonderful, private mini apartment for rest and relaxation in a beautiful neighborhood. And our host, Julie could not have been more gracious and welcoming. Fesh tomatoes and basil from her garden were waiting for us, together with homemade muffins, scones and granola, and delicious coffee from The Archive. Did I say perfect? Thank you, Julie, and next time, we look forward to meeting Bill.

We ended up adding an additional night to our original 4 night stay. I guess that tells how we felt about Julie and Bill's place. The studio is cozy, but nicely decorated, very clean and just a very nice relaxing place to stay. Great quiet and tree shaded neighborhood and Julie may have the most nicely landscaped house in all of Salem. Did I mention Julie's scones? - To die for. We worried about the apartment getting warm being above a garage without air conditioning on hot summer days and evenings, but it was never an issue and we never even turned on the fan. Comfortable bed. Very private, but Julie and Bill are often up for a glass of wine on the patio, if desired. This will be tops on our list next time we are in Salem.

Our stay at the Chauffeurs Room was exceptional! Julie was friendly and helpful, but also gave us our space. The room was beautiful and very clean. Breakfast goodies were provided for us, even milk for the coffee! Everything was delicious! The neighborhood was very safe and lovely. In my opinion, there's no better place to stay if you're visiting Salem. Thanks Julie!

Julie's listing was perfect.  As I travel the country facilitating cooking workshops, I prefer the quaintness of a place that feel like a cozy home, to mentally prepare for my work.  Julie's accomodations were perfect. From tomatoes and basil from the garden to homesee granola and zucchini muffins for breakfast, these small details accented an otherwise perfect stay. She even let me harvest some fresh herbs from her beautiful garden. It was a beautiful estate that her and her husband have meticulously renovated... an obvious passion project with thoughtful details around every corner.

Staying in the Chauffer's room was my first time at an Airbnb listing and I am sold! I can't imagine ever staying at a hotel again. My arrival time changed by a few hours and Julie waited up for me, left a bowl of pasta in the fridge (it was delicious) and met me with a warm smile when I arrived. The room was fabulous, comfortable, and exceeded my expectations. I hope to return soon!

Our experience with Julie was great from start to finish.  She was friendly and very responsive to our messages when booking and when figuring out arrival times.  We really felt at ease about the process and about what to expect.  She and her husband greeted us warmly when we arrived and let us know the best way to reach them if we needed anything.  The neighborhood, house, and especially the gardens are stunning!  And the room was perfect for my husband and I.  It felt comfortable and spacious - it was so well designed and decorated.  The local goodies for breakfast were delicious!  Our only regret is that we had to leave quite early to meet a friend and didn't get to thank Julie in person for a great stay!

Julie welcomed me to her home with a yummy glass of wine and light snacks.  The room looked exactly as detailed in the listing, and really the amenities anticipated my wants before I knew them myself. Breakfast offering was great.

Really enjoyed my stay in the Chauffeurs room. Clean, comfortable, and welcoming setup. Also in a nice neighborhood that feels safe to walk / jog in. Hosts were lovely - I arrived late and left early and they left some thoughtful notes and a snack for me when I arrived, and a healthy breakfast in the morning. Would love to stay here again.

Julie and Bill were very hospitable and accommodating.  Lovely new studio apartment and a wonderful historic area of town close to everything. The muffins and other treats were  very welcome after a long day of travelling.
The Chauffeur Room was amazing! The room was clean, beautiful, and the amenities were really nice. Loved the muffins!

Julie met me with a glass of wine and a friendly smile after I had driven  three hours at the end of a workday to Salem.  It was much appreciated!  The room was cozy, the shower exceptionally clean and well appointed and the bed super comfortable.  I also was especially impressed with the ample amount of snacks and breakfast items available for guests. Thanks for making my very short stay in Salem enjoyable!

This was my first AirBnB experience, and it's hard to imagine another topping it. Julie is an absolute delight and her Chauffeurs Room is beautiful. My daughter and I stayed here for one night as part of a visit to Willamette University. The apartment is located in a charming, safe neighborhood and is convenient to all that Salem has to offer. The bed is very comfortable and the apartment is incredibly clean. I really do wish we could have stayed longer!

This property is adorable, cozy, safe, centrally located, clean, well priced, and the host is kind and genuine. The home made breakfast treats she leaves in the room upon arrival are delicious. If this room is available to book for your trip, don't hesitate -- you won't be disappointed.

The Chauffeur's Room is a sweet, comfortable place in a wonderful neighborhood!  My daughter and I stayed just one night while on college tours but would have liked to stay longer and explore.  Everything we needed was provided, with special touches like homemade granola, cookies hot from the oven and dining recommendations.  When the Wi-Fi didn't work, Julie responded immediately and restarted it.  It still didn't work for us but that may have been from our end.  We enjoyed the cable TV instead.  Our stay in Salem was made personable and easy with these hosts.

Julie met us when we arrived. She is very welcoming, explained the key system: all very easy. The apartment is lovely as are the gardens and the neighborhood. And Julie provided delicious homemade gluten free granola, homemade gluten free muffins, juice, coffee, tea, bottled water, and almond milk. In addition the bathroom was stocked with shower supplies, hair dryer which was lovely. Highly recommend experiencing this lovely spot.
Julie was very nice considerate and thoughtful. The room set up was great. Everything I needed was there.

Julie and Bill are wonderful hosts, and I have now stayed at the Chauffeurs Room for my 3rd time while staying in Salem. Each time it has been a really warm, thoughtful experience, and they have been very inclusive and considerate. The room is lovely, clean, and in a great neighborhood in Salem. Fridge always is stocked with some great treats.

This was a delightful and cozy place for my partner and I to stay.  We were welcomed very warmly, and the apartment had everything we needed.  The apartment is very tastefully decorated, everything is of a  high quality.  In addition to all of this, the apartment is located in a beautiful, quiet neighborhood and downtown Salem is within walking distance.  Also, this was the perfect location from which we could to explore the wonderful wines of Willamette Valley.
We enjoyed our stay.  The place was immaculate and inviting and our hosts were wonderful...so warm, available and did all they could to make our stay fantastic.
