Great location, comfy digs and an amazing bed!
Cute neighborhood, close to downtown. Perfect for visiting Willamette University.
Squeaky clean. Welcoming. Private. Quiet as can be! Everything you need for one or two people—or in my case—one person and a pup.
Lovely place and very kind folks!! We had an amazing stay
Sweet little place to relax after work. Quiet neighborhood with clever touches to make your stay excellent.

A lovely, well maintained space that was super comfortable and I felt safe as a solo traveler. Leigh was responsive and check-in was a breeze. It's a cute neighborhood close to shopping, dining and the interstate. I would definitely stay here again.

High end tiny home
We enjoyed our one night
Great bed. Beautiful bathroom
Wonderful place to stay! Quite, cozy and just lovely!

We enjoyed our stay here. We were not here for long. We arrived late in the evening and left the next morning. The place is reasonably priced and is very comfortable. The place is in the backyard so it doesnt feel completely private though once inside you cant even tell. I am sure there are amenities we did not utilize due to our short stay. We would stay again!

Leigh was a phenomenal host. She responded quickly to our communications and offered suggestions about what to see and do in the area. She even accommodated a last minute request for an additional person to join us on our stay. The Airbnb itself was very clean and inviting. It had all the comforts you'd need for a pleasant stay. I'd recommend staying here again.
This is a wonderfully comfortable and convenient space to stay in. It is beautifully designed, decorated, and furnished. I really enjoyed my two nights I spent here.
Super cute place and convenient location!
Very nice and comfortable. Would totally stay again, and would recommend to anyone who wants an affordable clean place to stay in Salem!
Loved this place and would stay again! Easy communication and booking. Place was so clean and beautiful. Having a little outdoor space was also very nice.

A wonderful place to stay in Salem. Everything was super dog friendly (fenced yard, provided dog bowls & waste bags, treats, etc.) Leigh was a thoughtful host and introduced herself while we were departing. Great value overall.

2nd visit this year. Wonderful half way stop between Grants Pass & Tacoma.
Cute, clean, cozy.
And as we all know, the rain shower head is so nice but ya better be quick!! 🥰

Leigh could not have been more kind and thoughtful hosting us and our puppy in her wonderful space. Absolutely everything was provided! The space was so comfortable, clean, and welcoming. We would absolutely stay again while passing through Salem!
Very cozy and stylish!  Appreciated all the thoughtful touches and the warm hospitality.  Super comfortable bed and well appointed bathroom.
Check in was a breeze. Location was perfect. Space was nice and clean and very accommodating for my dog and I.

Very friendly and welcoming host. The room was cozy and comfortable and small details made it feel extra fancy. Restful neighborhood with beautiful houses and a short walk away from downtown. Perfect little spot to rest on a trip.

This was such a great and cute place to spend the night while I was in town for work. The bed was comfortable, the checkin was easy, and the amenities in the space made the stay easy.

They are really friendly hosts and, while I didn’t have a pet, you can tell they love their animals as much as they love their guests.

One of my top 5 favorite airbnbs. The mattress was super comfy, host communication was exceptional, and backyard was perfect for our dogs. The hosts seemed to actually like dogs (left out dog treats and wrote house rules that show they understand and care for dogs). It was a huge stress relief to know that Leigh and Robert were welcoming to our pups. I will definitely recommend this spot to friends passing through Salem.
We had a great stay at Leigh’s place. It was a great location, easy to find, and had sweet touches like drinks in the fridge and dog treats!
Great time!
Amazing place to stay & even cozier than the photos looks!

Great find! Highly recommend staying in this lovely, private backyard abode. Frequent, clear communication, explicit instructions, quiet neighborhood close enough to downtown, ample street parking, comfy bed, and super clean, our stay had everything we needed to enjoy this beautiful part of the world. Fantastic value, we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Happy travels!

The place was fantastic. The hosts were there to greet us, along with their well-mannered pup. The accomodations were wonderful, from the beautifully historic house to the renovated barn. The room is spacious and comfortable, and the bed provided a fantastic sleep. We just happened to stu.vle upon the place by accident, surfing AB&B, and what a pleasant surprise it turned out to be.
Cute, affordable, very clean place in a convenient location to downtown.  Host was very responsive to any questions.  What more could you want. Highly recommend.
Leighs place was perfect for our stopover on the way to Seattle. Everything was as described. The bed was extremely comfortable, the shower wonderful, and it was very quiet. A great spot!
So cozy and perfect
Adorable place to stay and the host was terrific.  It  was super clean and the bed is very comfortable.  Definitely recommend!
yes book here, it’s very neat :)
Very comfortable and stylish guesthouse close to downtown Salem. Leigh provided great instructions on checking in and parking. Her attention to detail made the stay wonderful.
Excellent location, clean, private, and beautiful space. Will definitely stay again!
I can not rave about this place enough! Every little detail was perfect! The bed is super comfy, too! Also,  left us a container of treats for our pup and a water bowl.
We loved Leigh’s place.  It was super clean, well appointed in a charming neighbor.  Parking was easy and it’s close to downtown but very quiet.  We would recommend staying and will be back!
Perfect little Salem retreat. Highly recommended.
Such a cute place to stay! Very dog friendly and very clean!
Great location great place to stay.
This space is so welcoming and delightful. Leigh and Robert (and Riley the kindest dog ever) will chat with you and share stories if you'd like! It was the perfect stop on our way through Salem.
Perfect stop for the dog and I for a night. The host was extremely kind and everything was exactly as described.

Loved Leigh’s place! Communication was great and the location was awesome. We enjoyed the privacy of the ADU and the little touches like the local beer in the fridge and the little book sharing about the history of the property. Hope to return again!

I was in Salem for a work conference and stayed at Leigh’s space. It’s impeccably clean and the bed/sheets were extremely comfortable! I felt very safe in the neighborhood and hopped on my bike one night to check out the Oregon state capitol  grounds which is just a mile away. Highly recommend this space!
Cute place with everything you need! Would stay here again.

We cannot say enough nice things! The studio is adorable and modern with lots of little touches to make you feel welcome (our pups got treatos!). Our gracious hosts came out to greet us and we let our dogs meet, but in the end our 2 pups got the whole yard to themselves for shenanigans and we are SO thankful! Check in was easy, all directions were clear inside the studio for ease of use, and they even have a lending library out front! HIGHLY recommend for a weekend getaway or an oasis on a drive up the 5.
Leigh was a wonderful host. The place was super cute, clean, in a great location, and all the check-in instructions were clear. It's a great stay and would come again.
Comfortable and quiet place in a good location.  Has an interesting book concerning the history of the guesthouse.  Leigh was friendly and helpful.  I would highly recommend this guesthouse.
머물렀던 에어비앤비 중 가장 좋았던 숙소였습니다. 호스트와 분리된 공간이라 더욱 편안하게 머물 수 있었습니다. 숙소도 매우 깨끗하고 조용하고 시설도 좋고 아늑하고 그냥 완벽했습니다.. 호텔보다 좋았어요ㅠㅠ 호스트님도 너무 친절하시고 추천해주신 음식점도 너무 맛있었습니다. 덕분에 행복한 추억 많이많이 만들다 갑니다 감사합니다
Outstanding in every respect!

The guest house was fantastic! My dog Laney and I stayed for two nights to escape the heat and enjoy the AC and the place had everything we needed and was very comfortable. We will definitely come back!

Leigh's place is a gem!  Beautiful treelined neighborhood to walk through, a pleasant and welcoming yard to relax in and so many lovely thoughtful details throughout the space that really give it a special touch as a bonus, the sheets and towels are amazingly soft!  This is also very close to many large parks/outdoor spaces that we took advantage of and it was mere minutes to some excellent coffee and food.  We would certainly stay again for longer next time we come through!
A lovely guest house in a quiet neighborhood.
The barn rocks! Truly everything you could hope for in a backyard oasis. Great value, too. Quit screwing around and book it.

We had a lovely stay at Leigh's guest house. Our pup was so happy to be off-leash in the sun for a few minutes!

It was a great location for a quiet night of rest after visiting great nearby vineyards, and close to good dog-friendly restaurants (and gluten-free ones! Don't miss Bigwig bakery nearby).

We'll definitely stay here again next time we swing by Salem.
cozy and clean with a huge backyard and super soft sheets!

Very much enjoyed my stay. The guest house was adorable and had a great mix of modern and rustic and I loved how dog friendly it was (dog treats and bowl when I arrived and the yard is fully fenced in) Leigh was a wonderful host and made a point to check to see if I needed anything. Highly recommended the stay and hope to be able to book it the next time I’m in town.

FIVE STARS! Leigh was SO very accommodating (she even picked up some things for my family while she was at Costco!!). She was also very patient with all of my messaging. What a wonderful host! The way Airbnb is supposed to be! Leigh- THANK YOU!
Leigh is a great host and we had a fantastic time while we were in Salem. Thank you for a great stay!

I was in town for the Oregon State Fair. Leigh's place was a quick drive away from the fairgrounds (4 minutes). It is a quiet a cozy studio, well-appointed, with a lovely shared yard, and situated in a nice neighborhood. Leigh is a responsive and friendly host. Recommend!
A true gem!  Fabulous location, charming setting, superb host.  Will definitely be staying again.
Perfect stay for what we needed! Loved the woodsy touches of the guest house. Would highly recommend!

Wow, this has to be one of the nicest airbnbs we’ve stayed at! Beautifully styled and well appointed. Bed was very comfortable! We rolled into town later than expected and Leigh was easy to communicate with and had the place ready for us. We would love to come back!
Cute little place to stay with the doggies for a one-night trip. Has all the necessary amenities, well designed, great hosts, and an extremely comfortable bed.
This Urban Oasis in Salem, Oregon is a perfect getaway - it was spotless, cozy and relaxing - the host is gracious and welcoming - couldn't have asked for a better spot to hang out for the week!

I can't say enough about how charming and wonderful this place is. Leigh was the ultimate host, offering privacy, but also her generous spirit and she checked to see if I needed anything. Inside and out, her guesthouse is perfect. Clean, comfortable, modern, stylish and quite spacious with a high airy ceiling and handsome dark wood cross beams and furniture. The bed is also divine. So comfortable and cozy. The kitchen area, dressing area, and bathroom were all so well thought out and designed. I also loved the dark concrete floors made cozy with lots of rugs. The guesthouse also has a great heat pump, perfect for cooling or heating the room. Outside there is a firepit and cool chairs and nice garden area. Don't hesitate with this place. Stay here!
If you get a chance check out this spot. It’s cute & comfy!
Leighs place is adorable and perfect for two people.  It was lovely!! Leigh is a great host
Adorable cottage with incredibly thoughtful touches throughout. We’ll absolutely be staying here again!
A lovely place, exactly as I'd hoped. Leigh was very responsive but not at all intrusive. The space was clean and comfortable. Lovely neighborhood to wander around in.
Wonderful place to stay!  We love staying at Leigh's place and she is so easy to communicate with.  Would highly recommend to anyone.  It's our home away from home.
Staying here was relaxing and just want I needed for a good night’s sleep. I was able to study and get some work done in between visiting times with my relatives. Thanks!
Great stay!

I'm not surprised Leigh has been named a super host. She's super friendly, super helpful, super responsive. And the property is . . . . well, just super. Clean, quiet, and cozy but not cramped. The decor is lovely!

Stayed a second time on another one of my drives from Seattle toward the Southwest, and didn’t think twice when I saw Leigh’s place was available! She is such a fantastic host, and has many extra thoughtful touches including for pets coming along for the stay. Additionally I really appreciated some of the eco friendly features—just because you’re traveling doesn’t mean you have to compromise on sustainable practices. Thanks Leigh, looking forward to staying again at your place in the future 💚
Great place to stay! Quick drive from i5 and super dog friendly! The bed was super comfortable and the hosts were very kind and accommodating. Would definitely stay again!
A beautiful little private cottage! We had trouble with the heated mattress topper but the owners came right out and helped us with it. Would stay here again!
Cozy spot for a work sleepover. Near to downtown and Capitol Mall. Love the lunchbox of table supplies and the “fireplace.” Linens and towels are higher quality and very comfy.
Practical for a one night stay driving through Oregon.
Thank you for keeping such a nice place affordable to those who enjoy traveling.
Leigh's place was super comfortable and cozy. I enjoyed my stay there and would highly recommend it.
This AirBnB was very nice and clean. Glad we stayed here.
Perfect cozy and clean spot! We loved the bed :-). Thank you!
We loved our stay here! Leigh was incredibly helpful and friendly, and the place was perfect for our night in Salem. Would definitely recommend!
Great location and fair price! The space was clean and had the necessities!
Great spot, exactly what an Airbnb should be. Nicely decorated space, very clean. Comfortable bed. Coffee ready to go. Does not have a kitchen,  but does have a small fridge and microwave.

The place was VERY clean and just as described, very cute roomy ADU! Easy check-in, responsive host. Bathroom was very clean, comfy bed. Nice little touches with keurig/fridge/microwave/dining table. It was even toasty warm in there in the 30 degree winter weather!

The only thing potentially negative I have to comment on is the lack of blinds on the frosted glass front door (the door is mostly glass) and the 4 probably 0.5x3 foot windows. Unfortunately the room was pretty light without these and especially light early as the sun came up.

Thanks for sharing your cute place!
Really lovely place! Leigh is very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay there again
Lovely place to stay for my work trip in Salem! Quiet, clean and lots of nice thoughtful touches for guests! Hosts were kind and communicative!

This was perfect for my conference stay. Check in was technically at 3 but the host was willing to let me check in earlier so I wouldn’t have to come into an unfamiliar neighborhood after dark.
It didn’t matter. Their host house AND the guest house were well lit. The instructions for check in and access were exactly as described. I felt safe and so comfortable. I wish I could have stayed an extra night just to sleep. There were train tracks nearby but if a train went by in the night, I didn’t hear it at all.
Thank you so much for such a cozy spot. If I ever have to do this trip again, I know where to look first for a place to stay!
The cottage is beautiful and comfy!
Cute little hide away!

Adorable little space perfect for single or couples. Everything was clean with nice amenities and cute touches throughout the space. Check-in was super easy and Leigh was very responsive. The space was quiet and felt private. I would definitely stay here again!
Comfortable and private
Wonderful spot! So clean and had everything you could want in an cozy space!
Really great spot. Super nice hosts. Really clean and comfortable.
10/10 experience! Karen respected our privacy, knew we weren't from around there and showed us things to do! Was a very amazing host!
Karen is such a wonderful host.  The place is beautiful and she makes it very personal and warm with snacks, tea, and even breakfast for the morning.  It was a pleasure staying with her.

Karen was a wonderful host. I could not have asked for a better first time Airbnb experience. The apartment is adorable, well-stocked and close to downtown Salem. It has everything one would need for a short or long stay.

Karen was an absolutely wonderful host! She immediately made us feel welcome and her overall hospitality was so genuine. The accommodations were above and beyond what we expected. We couldn't have been happier with our choice to stay with Karen!
Karen was amazing as always!  She even mailed back my ipad charger.  I am so grateful for all she does when I come stay.

Karen was very easy to communicate with, and everything was ready for us even though Karen was preparing to go out of the country.  The apartment was cozy and homey, and the kitchen was great to cook in, with nice knives, pans, etc.  The only drawback -- and Karen said she'd fix this -- was the lack of a decent reading lamp in either the living room or bedroom.  Otherwise all was as the listing described, we would stay here again.

Karen is the most attentive and caring host. She went above and beyond helping myself and my girlfriend out our last week  b/c of our jobs and can't give enough thanks. She is very informative of the area and if you are looking for something to do she can help. The home is very cute and clean and has everything and more you can ask for. Very quiet neighborhood that is close to everything and on a sunny day a very nice walk to down town. We have booked more time with Karen in her historic home and look forward to it. Highly recommend!

We loved our stay at Karen's place. Though Karen was out of town and we didn't have the chance to meet, she was easily available by text message and let us know everything we needed to have a comfortable stay.  Knowing that we were bringing our sons (two years old and newborn), Karen thoughtfully left a high chair and toddler dishes in the kitchen for our use.  The location was perfect for us.  It's within a mile of Riverfront Park and stops and restaurants downtown.  We spent a lot of time at Riverfront Park, walking on the paths, playing on the playground, and riding the carousel.  We were very comfortable during our stay -- I think we all actually slept better than we do at home!  We'll definitely return if we're in Salem again.

Karen was a great host. She met us and helped us settle in. She lives in an apt upstairs and the kitchen in our apt was fully stocked. Turns out this was great for me since I needed to make a soup for Passover for my step- daughter at Willamette U. We had a great time!

We love staying with Karen and hated to leave. She went above and beyond as a host to make sure we were comfortable and to help with all of our things. She has the kindest spirit and warmest heart. We hope, by chance, that we get to stay with her again before our travels take us else where.

Karen was welcoming, and very professional. She greeted us when we arrived and she also got in contact with me before we arrived so that everything went smooth. She also helped us find a great hiking spot where we had one of the best hikes of our trip. The house was spacious, clean, and honestly felt like a real home, not just somewhere we were staying. It was close to stores and to downtown Salem so the location was perfect.

Karen's home was just the perfect spot for my husband, daughter and myself to stay while attending our son's graduation from Willamette.  The location was convenient, near downtown and the college but in its own quiet neighborhood.  The house was well appointed with everything we might need.  Karen was a welcoming host, available if we needed her, but discreet and non-intrusive.  Her historic home is comfortable and full of interesting antique items.  Highly recommended.

Due to three different flight schedules -- arriving and departing -- and an itinerary devoted to all-day field trips, my party didn't actually spend much time in Karen's very comfortable home.

Clean and tidy, cozy and well-appointed, all was as advertised. The location proved a convenient "home base" for our travels, and we particularly appreciated the peaceful neighborhood at the end of the day.

Karen promptly answered all questions posed prior to our arrival, and provided contact information in case we had questions or concerns once we'd settled in.

I'd re-visit this listing -- two thumbs up!

What a beautiful home and warm welcome!  Thanks so much to Karen for the care she took during our stay. We had strange arrival hours and she was so accommodating and communicative.  We loved her beautiful home and will definitely reach out when we return to Salem!

Karen was such a gracious hostess! Her home is lovely, the photos don't do it justice, and we had a fabulous weekend in Salem! Can't recommend her place highly enough - great location, quiet neighborhood and historic but comfy accommodations.
Karen was great. We had great privacy and very cozy
This is a great location for stores because things were in walking distance. Very quiet at night, and roomy for us. Loved it!
Very spacious and cute. Loved the location.
Great location, very quiet. Karen is all about making your stay easy. Would definitely stay in her home again.

Thank you Karen for a very comfortable stay.  Everyone we needed was there.  Very clean and neat.  We really appreciated you invitation to use the food in your refrigerator.   We used some oatmeal and left you a jar of peanut butter.  We felt right at home.

We had a brief but very lovely stay in Salem. Karen was kind and hospitable and the room was great. We had plenty of space and the home was beautiful and charming. We plan to go back to Oregon for a longer stay. I absolutely recommend staying with Karen!!
Very enjoyable location to enjoy Salem over the July 4th weekend.  Clean, comfortable home in a quiet neighborhood.

Thank you for opening your home to us, Karen. It was comfortable & suited the needs of our traveling group (2 adults, 2 children) well. The kitchen was large & well-appointed and use of the grill outside was a plus! Viewing a deer grazing a short distance from the kitchen window the first morning was delightful. And the grand-kids especially thank you for the delicious cookies and popsicles awaiting them. :) Being so close to all we wanted to see and do in Salem, it was perfect. Thanks, again!

Our stay in Karen's apartment was great, though too short. The apartment was very comfortable and well-supplied. We had a chance to meet Karen when we checked in and she showed us around. She was kind and helpful and even had everything ready for us early since we had a wedding to attend that evening. We were so grateful, and would definitely recommend staying here during a trip to or through Salem.

My stay at Karen's place felt like "home away from home". Many thanks for the thoughtful bouquets of flowers (hydrangea and roses) as well as all the amenities in the kitchen. I highly recommend Karen's home for the Salem traveler.

Karen's place was great. The house was very nice, we had the whole downstairs our selves. the space is separate from the upstairs living area. The decor was nice, the place was very clean and had everything we needed for our stay. The house was located very close to the downtown area and was easy access to were we needed to be. The price was very reasonable, if I need to stay in Salem again I would book Karen's again in heart beat.
We had a wonderful stay in Salem. The place was pretty much as we expected. It was very comfortable with lots of amenities. Thank you!

I can't say enough good things about Karen's place. A big attractive space, well located in Salem, very comfortable. It was perfect for us - just a couple blocks away from Ideabox, the prefab home builder, that we wanted to visit.

Karen was very helpful with directions and information, super sweet. Great hospitality.

Wonderful space in Salem and a super value - will stay here again when in Oregon, definitely.

Of all of my trips, this was the certainly best Airbnb experience I've had so far. Karen was absolutely amazing!  My friends and I came into town just a few hours before a wedding and Karen provided us with everything we needed and more (food, an iron, etc.). She even brought down fresh baked cookies for us. And though we had planned on walking to town the next day (which is very close), she insisted on driving us. I've never had a more generous host. In addition, Karen's home is perfectly placed close to town, but in a quiet neighborhood so you can expect to have a relaxing stay. In all, I would highly recommend staying here if you find yourself visiting Salem. Thanks Karen!

Karen was a great host. She was there to welcome us, and explained everything about the apartment. The apartment was clean and the bed & coach were comfortable. Thanks for everything we had a great time at your place.

We loved everything about Karen's Airbnb. It was clean, large space and felt like home. Great location to downtown Salem. She left goodies in the fridge and around for us to eat which is above and beyond kind. She was very genuine and kind when we bumped into her coming and going! Would tell a friend to stay here!!
See previous comments.

Karen's place was even better than I imagined. ! Loved having a full kitchen with oven plus a big dining table in a seperate area .
Everything felt clean and cosy and like home . Didn't have time to make the most of the big TV and read all the current magazines .
Will have to stay longer next time !

Was in town for a wedding so basically only slept at Karen's place but she was very helpful, and the house was comfortable. Beautiful fresh flowers in several of the rooms was a sweet treat! Didn't do much sightseeing but the location wasn't far from downtown Salem.
Karen was wonderful and very accommodating.  Her place was clean, quiet and perfect for what we needed. I would definitely stay here again.

Karen was great!  My flight was late and landed an hour away, but she was there, warm and welcoming, when I arrived.  The accommodations were lovely, comfortable, and very well taken care of.  My first Airbnb experience made me want to try my next and definitely come back.

Thank you Karen for a wonderful stay!  The house was beautiful and peaceful.  We were able to spread out and eat our own food, thanks to the full kitchen.  We appreciated all the hosting and the amenities.  Would stay again!

The place was exactly as shown. Karen greeted us with keys to get our vacation started. We were there with a planned vacation but she offered any help or ideas if we needed them. It was an easy location in regards to traveling the different wine regions
We really enjoyed our stay at Karen's place! It was clean, quiet, and plenty of space for us and our three year old. She even provided toys to play with which were a huge hit!
Karen has a very cute house and really took care of us.  We had a totally flawless time and would gladly stay again with her.
The house was wonderful and our host was attentive to our needs.
Karen was not in town, but was a great, responsive communicator even in her absence.  Home is comfortable, with great kitchen.

Karen's house was perfect for my needs.  Tidy and well kept house with lots of lounging space, with fully stocked kitchen that I used to make my self meals.  Karen was very kind and allowed me to use basic supplies, and made sure I had everything I needed.  She answered her texts promptly, and accommodated my very late arrival with grace.  Would definitely stay here again.  Thanks, Karen.
The historic home was cozy, warm and comfortable. Karen was a wonderful host and made our stay very enjoyable. It was situated close to downtown shopping and restaurants and The Capital.
Nice home in local neighborhood. Very close to downtown Salem. Host was very accessible and easy to work with. Thank you Karen!

Karen's home is cozy, spic and span! We chose this location for the wonderful access to walking/running along the Willamette River. There is a beautiful pedestrian bridge near by to cross the river into a nice park and West Salem where we could grab a cup of coffee and groceries. We also enjoyed Downtown Salem's shopping. The BEST restaurant for food from scratch: Word of Mouth - 5 star and as good as Grandma's!
Thank you, Karen, for your warm welcome.

Very comfortable, pleasant accommodation! The kitchen was quite well-equipped, and Karen was a gracious host. We liked the out-of-the-way location near the river too! Will stay here again when in Salem.
Karen left everything we needed and made sure we were comfortable! Very private and left us to enjoy our time!  Would definitely stay here again!

Karen is a warm, responsive host and her home is cute and cozy. The kitchen is well stocked, the home contained everything you could want or need, and she even put out toys for our kids to play with! It was a great little location to stay at while visiting family for Christmas. We can't wait to come back when the weather is warm and walk to the park and breakfast place everyone talks about :)

The town of Salem is very fun! I will say you have to look hard for fun stuff to do but it is there! There is a very active night life and a mall just up the street from Karen's house. Karen is truly a kind woman and her house is a great place to stay. My husband and I enjoyed the fireplace in the living room and ordering food in :) I will say that the bed is very squeaky , there is a load bell every time the door is opened and closed, and trains pass by all hours of the day including the night, so if you are a light sleeper keep that in mind.
Karen's cute little home had all we needed for our short stay.
Great home, well-stocked with everything we needed. Easily accessible to downtown Salem. Loved being able to cook at home and relax.

This charming vintage home is in an excellent location for either travel west, or downtown.  It is walking distance from Grocery Outlet and a great thrift store.  Though away traveling, Karen left a couple of delicious carrot cupcakes in the fridge for us, as well as necessities to get us started. We enjoyed a week of quiet, rainy days, many good meals prepared in this well-equipped kitchen, and hours of pleasure reading, naps, etc. while our daughter studied for her teacher certification tests.  It was an excellent choice for us - a home away from home!   Bruce and Katy Peet
Again, Karen's place is great!

We loved this cozy little place! It's very close to the downtown area so that's really convenient. The home is a decent size and is very comfortable, especially with the little fireplace. Karen was a kind hostess and she even had some snacks for us in the kitchen!
Wonderful home, lots of amenities and very cozy
Cozy spot during bad weather!  Karen's place is very charming and warm on a weekend when it rained and snowed!  Very convenient location to downtown.
This was perfect for our trip! Thank you Karen!

Had a great time at karens! She wasn't home when we stayed but check in was super easy and we knew the area (close to downtown Salem) so didn't have a hard time getting around! Great locations close to everything and the house was so cute, large rooms and a cozy feeling! Would defiantly stay again!
Excellent place! Roomy, quiet. and convenient to everything in Salem.
Karen's quaint home was perfect for the purpose of our stay. Clean, well-stocked, and tucked away in a quiet neighborhood.

Great value and nice,quiet neighborhood. There is nothing but positive things to say about this place.the house was very clean and organised no complain. This is one of my one best airbnb and I will definitely recomend this place.
This was perfect. Karen was gracious, informative, and the perfect host.
Karen was a great host and her place is lovely, plus very convenient to downtown. We really enjoyed our stay in Salem and hope we get to visit her again.

Karen provides a great retreat and value.  We loved the river-adjacent location, and we loved everything about the home.  Karen was available for any issues but did not intrude at all - a perfect combo for a host.
Karen's place is in a quite spot just outside the center of Salem. She is a very considerate host and her home offers good value.

Note this is my very first foray into the Airbnb world. I'm so glad we chose this particular listing and host - We loved staying at Karen's! We were here for a three-night weekend and couldn't have been more pleased with this lovely gem. We can't wait to stay here again! Also note that "We" consisted of two brothers + two wives. The only reason I say this is that from prior experience one needs to make sure that when sharing one bathroom you all get along :) The gist of this review is that we loved the house, we loved our hostess, and we would definitely stay again. 10/10 If you would like to read on though, here are some Additional details below. Getting there/Location: Easy enough with the GPS, and made even easier with ample pre-arrival communication from Karen. Roughly 8 minutes to fairgrounds, 10minutes to city center. We loved being close to everything! Oh. And it was a short walk or quick drive to either Grocery Outlet or Fred Meyers for any kind of restocking needs. The hostess: Prior to arrival, I was a bit nervous. Karen was patient enough to answer my questions and she was always relatively quick to respond. We had the pleasure of meeting her in person when we arrived. She is a gracious hostess and had put out some fresh flowers. What a nice touch! She told us a little bit about the house and we enjoyed learning a little backstory of the house prior to her purchasing it. She takes wonderful care of the place. She is always available to assist as she lived on the premises, but always gave us our space too. The home: House was clean, well-stocked, well-appointed. Separate entry to the rented space. Accurately described, homey, and charming. Bonus points for the red accents as I do love red :) Cool/hot on thermostat, fireplace, patio - loved it all. I would stay here any time of the year. Didn't get to use the TV as we were out all day and just cooked and visited with each other at night. Wifi access was quick. Some people mentioned the train. We heard it a couple of times, but it was distant enough to where it wasn't a bother to us, or we were already up. I recommend earplugs for light sleepers. Kitchen/Dining room I loved that Karen has the kitchen stocked with some basic things to get her guests started. We got in late in the evening and we're grateful to be able to make a simple breakfast the next morning - Very important when attending an all-day convention. And Yes it has a coffee maker :) we loved being able to eat in and visit at the dinner table. We hand-washed throughout the weekend but there is also a dishwasher available. Sleeping arrangements: Accurately described. We were comfortable and had lots of room to move around or hang out. For us two couples: there is a wall...

Our family arrived and we're so pleasantly surprised to find the house had so many wonderful things available. Karen was such a wonderful amazing hostess! She greeted us and helped us with any questions we had had. We had two kids and she graciously shared some of her grandkids toys and they loved it. Her house made out trip feel like we were home. I wouldn't just recommend this home I'm booking this again and again. Thanks Karen for being so friendly. And I only gave it 4 stars for accuracy because the pictures don't do this diamond enough justice.

Sehr viel Platz für mich alleine, genug Raum für 4. Ruhig und komfortabel. Toller Service der nicht angeboten war. Sehr sauber und mit allem ausgestattet was selbständiges Wohnen erfordert. Auto empfehlenswert aber zur Not auch für Fußgänger machbar. 20 Minuten Fußweg ins Zentrum oder in den großen Park am Flußufer.

We loved our stay at Karen's!  It was quiet, clean, really comfortable - a true respite for us.  We would come back any time!  Your house is lovely Karen, and we felt so at home thanks to all of your efforts.

Karen is fantastic. She has a lovely home and has everything you'll need for your stay. I had forgotten about the train nearby and had a rude awakening at 1 am but it was my own fault for forgetting. Regardless, the home is worth the value.

Staying at Karen's place was an absolute joy and was very comfortable. I was in town for a wedding and Karen helped me get acquainted with the area and also was flexible when I had an extra guest join at the last minute. She also provided coffee, tea, and anything I needed in her spacious and beautiful kitchen with garden views. My only regret is not being able to spend more time relaxing in her beautiful home. I would definitely recommend her place to families or couples looking for a lovely and quiet place to relax in Salem.

Karen's house could not have been more ideal for our needs. There is a nice private bedroom and room for a friend to sleep in the spacious living room. The large kitchen and dining area became our common space. It is close to downtown and the park where the Salem Art Festival is held. Karen was welcoming and a great communicator. We hope to stay with her again next year.

Karen's place is so lovely. It was the perfect house for out-of-town guests here for our wedding and provided me a quiet place to sleep before my wedding day! I love the open kitchen and super cute art throughout the home.

Karen's place is an older Northwest cottage in a quiet and shady little neighborhood about a mile north of downtown Salem.  The furnishings are basic but comfortable.  Nice kitchen, quiet bedroom, the bathroom is a bit cramped.  Karen is an easygoing and generous hostess.  She made us feel very comfortable, responded promptly to communications and let us keep our gear in the house all day on the day we departed.  Her consideration and flexibility enhanced the experience for us.

Karen's home is lovely.   It's clean, cozy and has many amenities.  Tucked away across from the Willamette River, we were able to enjoy quiet early morning walks.  Just minutes from downtown and Riverfront park.   Karen was warm and thoughtful.   We really felt like this was a home away from home.

We had a lovely stay at Karens B&B during the Solar Eclips. Our children were provided with fresh tomatoes from her garden, some games and Lego to play with. For our kids and ourselves, it was a pleasure staying at a B&B in stead of all the Hotels we stayed before.

Comfortable hotels in Salem can be quite expensive for what they offer. Karen's place is clean, roomy and is a great value for the area. She is a great host, communicates clearly and in a timely manner. We would be happy to stay here again the next time we visit Salem.
We loved staying at Karens beautiful place.

Karen's place was a perfect home base for our weekend adventures in Salem.  It was clean, comfortable, conveniently located, and had everything we needed.  Karen was away during our stay and she let us know we could call if we needed, but the communication was so great beforehand that everything went as smoothly as could be.  Even without meeting her, we could tell that she takes pride in her home and enjoys hosting travelers.  We appreciated that she thoughtfully put out some toys, which made our 3-year-old daughter feel so special!

We had a comfortable 4 night stay here. Communication was great and instructions provided for easy access. Karen greeted us and made us feel welcome. The space is generously sized and parking very convenient. The house is located in more of a light industrial than residential area. Downtown is walkable (although a little further than expected) and very convenient if you have access to a vehicle. Overall, a good-value stay in Salem.
Karen had good communication.

Similar feedback to other guests.

Cons are the noisy train (didn't bother me except the last night when it went by at least 6 times and blew its horn every 2 seconds) and the neighborhood doesn't feel as walkable as I had hoped. (Industrial without sidewalks was a little intimidating for traveling.)

BUT, it was a great stay in Karen's home. Everything I needed (and more) for a pleasant stay.

Her communication with me prior to the stay was good. Not too early so the email got buried and not so late that I worried that I wouldn't know how to get in or where to go.

Karen greeted me and helped me carry my stuff in from the car. I know she was available if I needed anything. (I didn't because it was all there.) There was a welcome book with intro to the house, instructions for use and how to leave things when I left, and tips on local points of interest (as well as a whole basket of brochures of same). Decent channel selection and on-demand for when I felt like staying in. Centrally located to everything worth seeing (IMO) in Salem.
The house was comfy and very clean. We had the 1st floor to ourselves. We also enjoyed the terrace and garden. Karen offered us some tomatoes from her garden. We had a lovely time in Salem.

This was a charming place to stay, with great parking and a nice location close to downtown Salem. Karen was nice enough to even make up the couch bed for us. This was an old house with its quirks, but all in all a lovely place to stay for a weekend wedding. Thanks!
Karen made everything so easy. The house was clean, comfortable and in a good location for our daily activities.
Felt like home wonderful hospitality enjoyed the river walks
This house has a old world, historic, warm fill. It was stocked with everything we needed and we enjoyed our stay.

I was in town to run a race at Silver Falls State Park and decided to say in Salem. Karen's place was perfect. It's comfortable, spacious and has everything you need and then some. It was close to everything in Salem including some great local coffee spots and places to eat. Can't say enough about Karen as a host either. The space was available early and she also gave me the flexibility to check out a little late, much appreciated as I was moving a little slowly after running a 50k. Highly recommend Karen's great apartment if you are staying in Salem!

Karen has created a wonderful, homey place to stay in this historic Salem house. It’s very comfortable with a well-equipped kitchen and cozy living room and bedroom. Super grateful that there was a washer and dryer, as well!!

Karen’s house is very conveniently located. My sister and I️ had such a great time staying here and I️ hope we’ll have another chance to stay here in the future!

Karen was an amazing host, and she obviously puts a lot of thought into her place and guests. She was super friendly and always quick to respond to messages. She left helpful tips about the place and local attractions. She even shared a great story about the history of her house. Karen's place is to die for. It felt like home. It's within walking distance to the Gilbert children's museum and Salem indoor carousel. She had games available for us to play with our kiddos. There was breakfast, and good coffee. The place is bigger than I expected, and the neighborhood quiet and seemed secure. It's right down the street from the Oregon School of Massage, which was where my husband needed to be for the weekend. It couldn't have been more perfect. My five-year old even insisted we move in!
Karen's place is absolutely lovely. Very comfy and cozy. Close enough to walk to downtown Salem and close also to Willamette which is why we were there. Will stay there again for sure!
Karen's place is very cozy, and comfortable. The cottage has everything you need,  is very clean, and has many thoughtful touches.  For us it was the perfect get away.

Had a lovely, relaxing stay at Karen's  - she had everything we needed and more to ensure that we had a great time. The place was spotlessly clean, fast internet, large kitchen with everything you could need. Lovely and warm. Many thanks!
Great Space!  Will stay again! Thanks Karen!

We especially appreciated the large, well-stocked kitchen and complete laundry facilities. The house is centrally located, convenient to downtown Salem. The neighborhood is zoned commercial, and there are small businesses nearby as well as other residences along the river. It was a comfortable mix for us and a comfortable, enjoyable stay.
Comfortable and spacious space. Quiet, warm and welcoming.

Perfect home away from home. Quiet. Exceptionally clean and user friendly. Centrally located and easy access to downtown Salem and the government offices. I highly recommend you consider this property if you are going to Salem.
If your looking for a stylish, clean, and affordable place to call home for a little Karen’s is your place.

My husband and I spent two nights at Karen's place. The space fit our needs well and was more spacious than I expected. The location was a mix of industrial, apartments, and cute neighborhood very close to the river. This was our first visit to Salem. It would easily accommodate an additional couple with plenty of privacy for everyone. The coffee she provided was great and directions were very clear and organized. Overall we enjoyed the space.

I have stayed at Karen’s place many times. The apartment is very spacious, comfortable and clean. The full use of the well stocked kitchen makes it my first choice when working in Salem. Karen is super responsive and accommodating.

Karen was a thoughtful host and provided everything we needed for a comfortable stay! The location was very convenient for our frequent back and forth visits to Willamette University. A great place for WU parents!
Karen was helpful and welcoming. The place was perfect for our needs.
Great value, clean and comfortable
We had a great time at Karen's. The house was clean, Karen was so sweet. If we ever make it back to Salem, we will definitely be coming here again.

Great hospitality from Karen. She made my family and I feel welcome and even brought out some toys for our kiddos. Her home was charming and conveniently located near the AC Gilbert museum and not too far from downtown Salem. Definitely recommend staying here if you bring the family or some friends. Thanks Karen for opening your home to us.

Karen is a great host, and her place is spacious and well-equipped, especially the kitchen.  It's a quick drive to downtown and Willamette Univ.  And we really enjoy all the charming touches throughout the home.

Lovely little cottage close to Downtown Salem. It was perfect for our short stay to visit my son. We had a medical emergency in the middle of the night and it was only 8 minutes from the most amazing hospital. Karen greeted us on our arrival and check in was super easy.
Perfectly hospitable, nicely decorated and very clean, incredibly gracious and thoughtful host.

Karen's home is simply charming! We loved our stay there. Karen greeted us warmly and gave us plenty of privacy. Take the time to read the few notes in the guest book and learn the history of the house and the fun quirks of the home. A great place to stay for our family of four!
Karen is a very sweet host and went out of her way to make our stay as comfortable and smooth as possible. Highly recommend!

Interesting space with great touches that was like a scavenger hunt for the neat things.
Well appointed.
Quiet neighborhood right off the main roads.

Great location and lovely space.  Just be aware that the plugs in the bedroom don't work once you turn off the lights for the night--you have to charge your devices accordingly (or in another room).  This is a complete house for someone who wants to cook, entertain a small group, or have an extended stay, but it's also great for a short visit.
The place was wonderful. Exactly what we needed. The host was really attentive to some needs and was happy to help. Can't say enough good things.
A comfortable home. A warm and kind host. Great location.

It was our second time staying at Karen’s, and it’s still one of our favorite places to stay in Salem! So close to everything, about a mile to most spots we needed to be, but away enough to be quiet and relaxing.
Great place to stay. A hop, skip and jump from downtown Salem.  A++
Karen's place is welcoming and inviting. Interesting history on the house. Everything needed was provided.

Wow. A beautiful home in a beautiful setting. I was lucky enough to be present on a day where the lawn had been freshly mowed. I say this because there is an abundance of mint in the yard and it made the outside (and inside if the window was open) smell so lovely like fresh mint. Karen was a delightful host and gave me the privacy I needed as I was on a work trip. It is a historic house that has an interesting story and a couple quirks (hence the less than 5 stars on the amenities). Other than that I highly recommend this home to anyone who stays in Salem for business or for pleasure. Thank you for hosting me and sharing the beautiful space with me!
Had a great stay. Everything as described. Will definitely book again.

It was a lovely stay. we weren't sure about the neighborhood at first but we ended up just loving it! it really felt like home. The minty smell to the lawn, the rogue rabbits eating clover in the yard, the guy walking his cats down Water street, the river, the moss....it was truly magical. Thoughtful touches and helpful brochures plus extras at every turn made this a wonderful place to stay!

Karen's place was clean and spacious and had everything we needed, including breakfast snacks and coffee. Sitting on the back deck and checking out the gorgeous view of the river was the perfect start to our 2 mornings there. We would definitely stay again!

Our stay at Karen’s cozy home was perfect! We had a couple accommodations that she worked with, and we were so grateful! She goes out of her way to make sure your stay with her is as perfect as she can get it! Definitely recommend her and will be staying there again! Thanks Karen!
Dayna

Really nice space. Clean/ well maintained.  Two beautiful decks and the river is a half-block away. Salem is charming and the downtown is a really short drive/ 15 minute walk to the Broadway district/ 25 minutes to downtown. There is some warehouse district feel just a 2 block from her place, so you may not want to walk at night, but the location was great for getting around Salem.
Close to the river, nice place to stay.

Karen's home is warm and welcoming. She is absolutely the same.

There is everything you could hope for there. It is a delight to stay there.
Good location and comfortable place to stay.
Karen was a great host.  The house was cute and clean.
Very nice house, lots of space for a family. Karen is a great host. It is a very nice place to stap in Salem.

Sparkling clean, spacious historic home, warm and welcoming host!  Karen met us upon arrival and welcomed us into her home.  She also wished us farewell upon our departure.  Full amenities and all the comforts of home. Very spacious private apartment home and more than enough space for a small family!  Would highly recommend staying here!
Very lovely home.
Wonderful location, wonderful to have an entire floor to ourselves.

Charmante maison remplie d’histoires. Tout confort, propre et au calme même si elle se situe dans une d’activité. Karen a été accueillante et discrète ( elle vit a l’étage ) . Super séjour pour visiter Silver Falls state park .
Karen was an excellent host and her house was super comfy, coat, and well stocked for my stay.

We could not have asked for a cozier homebase in Salem. Karen‘s apartment is clean, spacious and comfortable. We easily walked to the Capitol and Riverfront Park. Fully-equipped kitchen, washer and dryer as well as free parking spot right outside the house were much appreciated.
Karen’s place was the perfect location to stay while we were in town for a wedding. She was such a wonderful host and the amenities were exactly what we needed. I would recommend to anyone!
Karen's place is great. Lots of room and cozy. We try and book this particular spot when we visit Salem. Good location for Willamette University parents.
Karen is very personable and responded really quickly. Her space is super comfy and roomy. She thoughtfully provided coffee, tea, cocoa as well as oatmeal and yogurt. She was a great host!
Great home. Everything you need to be comfortable during your stay. Karen is lovely and works hard to make sure your stay is perfect.

Karen is a great communicator; she always kept us in the loop with information, answered all our questions, and was so willing to accomodate our extra children and later check-in.  Her home is a great little space, and what a funny backstory! She even had snacks on hand for us, which was perfect, as we had evening meetings and a very late dinner! Highly recommended, for ease of communication and comfort -- thanks, Karen!
As always, staying at Karen's place was outstanding.  I love everything about it and stay here each time I'm in Salem when it's available.

Karen is a fantastic host, fantastic attention to details and comunication. The place is clean and tidie and combiniently located near grocerie shops and the city centre.

We stayed a few weeks in the apartment and has everything you will need to stay comfortable. Great wifi and cable tv also.
Karen is a lovely host. I needed a place that felt like home where I could relax and make my own meals. Karen's home was perfect for me!

Karen’s place was delightful. We really loved it there. I wish I could pick it up and bring it with me to everywhere in the world that I need an Airbnb. It’s comfy, peaceful, spacious, and has everything one could need on a trip away from home.
An unexpected delight.
Beautiful view off back patio of Willamette River, darling place, fabulous host. I stay here every time I visit Salem. It’s like our home away from home.
Karen’s home is very comfortable and centrally located. I only wish I would have discovered it years ago.
Very nice comfortable place in convenient location with friendly helpful host.
Cute little place with everything we needed. We look forward to staying here again.

Karen was an awesome host who met us when we first arrived. The space provided was comfortable, clean and just as described.

Thank you for an awesome stay!

Karen’s place is in an older part of town with rail lines and warehouses nearby. But her house is charming, and the neighborhood is quiet. The kitchen, dining room, and living room are spacious. The bedroom and bathroom are snug but adequate. The location is central and convenient for getting to any part of Salem. Karen welcomed us upon our arrival, then respected our privacy the rest of our stay. She made sure we had everything we needed. It’s a great place to stay!
Karen is a great host with a beautiful home to share. Quiet, clean, comfortable, and easily accessible to Salem sites.
We enjoyed our stay at Karen’s. The apartment was immaculate and well equipped. Karen was very thoughtful with any of our questions or needs. The location was great!
We really enjoyed our brief stay at Karen’s lovely home. She was a great host and was able to show us around once we got there.
Good value
Very comfortable.
Karen's home is tidy and very inviting. I slept great, and enjoyed my visit very much.
Cozy space in quiet area, perfect for visiting home
A stunning home in a great area. Karen is an amazing host and was so helpful!
Beautiful home that is close to downtown Salem. Karen was an amazing host and helpful with anything.
Karen is kind and thoughtful. She even offers breakfast snacks! Thanks for letting us share your space 🙏🏾
This is a wonderful place to stay and a great location!
Karen's place is exactly as described. Karen responded quickly every time. She gave us some great food suggestions and was extremely generous to us when our flight was delayed!

Karen was an awesome host, and this was our second time staying here, no doubt it will not be the last time.  Everything was great.  The home is clean and tidy, and the location is very quite.  Thanks for an awesome stay!
We had an amazing time at Karen's place it's just perfect. Grandkids were able to come over and spend time with us. Thanks again!!!
Great location, close to downtown Salem and the Willamette U. campus. Very centrally located. Very spacious living room, in a charming, remodeled home. Very responsive host.

Excellent stay in Salem! Comfy bed with extra pillows and bedding, close to everything, easy check in and out, quiet area, very nice living room, dining room, and kitchen with everything I needed. Will definitely stay here again.
A cute and cozy house, close to downtown, with all the amenities you might need. Karen was easy to reach and helpful. Overall, a great AirBnB experience! Highly recommended.
Karen’s place is awesome. Comes with a washer and dryer and check in was super easy. Karen was really responsive to messages and super thoughtful when it came to extra amenities.
Great experience and so comfortable.
You will be welcome and at home at Karen’s place. All the comforts of home. Like visiting your favorite auntie.
This is a charming home. It has everything you will need for your stay.

I had the pleasure of staying at Karen’s home for almost a month. Her home is very spacious and has everything you can possibly need. My original stay was planned for 2 months, but my time had to be cut short due to coronavirus as my internship ended much sooner than I anticipated. Karen was very understanding of my difficult situation and communicated with me & provided me with a refund for the nights I did not stay at her place. I’m so grateful to have met Karen and I hope to reconnect with her in the future once coronavirus goes away! Thank you, Karen!
Nice and cozy.

The house is located near the downtown and it’s clean and have everything you need.
Karen is so nice and reply very soon.

Kind hostess who made us feel at home - thanks Karen...
Dale and Sarah Shaw
Nice place to stay and super affordable!!
This home was perfect and quiet. Exactly what I needed this week in Salem.
Nice place. Wonderful host.
Great place, Old home charm, close to everything.

1927 first floor house with wood floors, full kitchen, dining area, living room and a separate bedroom made for a wonderful stay.  Karen, the host, lives upstairs and is readily available if you need help.  She also gives "space" to her guests so it is a perfect combination.  Located a block off the river, there are plenty of birds to occupy your time when sitting on the back deck.  As with all older homes, it provides plenty of charm and character.  We will definitely come back.
Karen is a friendly and accommodating host with a comfortable and roomy place with everything needed for a short or a long stay.

This property was clean and located in a quiet
neighborhood. Location is close to downtown, shopping and great restaurants with outdoor dining.

Karen is a wonderful host.  The location was great for us and having access to a full kitchen was perfect. The dishwasher is a bonus! Thoughtful touches included a fan in the bedroom, breakfast provisions and easy parking.  Would stay again!
Nice older home with character and stories! Very clean and close to downtown and water front. Karen is wonderful host.
A comfy stay in a quaint home. The accommodations were great! The kitchen has all necessary supplies and a few extras. The patio has a great view of Karen's garden and the nearby river.

Karen’s home is a lovely home away from home. It has everything you need and it is very comfortable. It is close to the Willamette River, near a wonderful park, but having a car or plan on using Uber is to get around.

Karen has a beautiful home that is clean and cozy! The downstairs was just for us and it was perfect. We loved being able to sit out on the back porch and the area has some nice streets for walks! Karen wasn’t home for most of our short stay, but was so kind to give us great tips about the area! When she did come home she was very friendly but also gave us our space (we had just gotten back from a long day of exploring). I would highly recommend staying here, beautiful home and kind host!

Karen was a great host - quick to respond and very sweet. We needed a long-term place to stay for a seasonal job and this was an excellent option. Great kitchen and living space. I also loved having an outdoor patio to sip coffee in the morning. I’d recommend having a car or expecting to use public transportation in this neighborhood. Overall great spot!
Cute quaint little place close to downtown.

My kids and I were in Salem for a few days to take my son to college. We felt very welcomed and very comfortable in Karen’s home. We appreciated having access to a full kitchen and the washer/dryer. Karen is a very gracious host and was accommodating with some last minute changes to our schedule. Although we were not able to take advantage of the outdoor patio, sitting at her dining room table in the mornings with the sunlight shining in was a real treat!

I came here to recover from shoulder surgery could not be at home because of fire damage in my community. Karen and Rocky have been kind and gracious this last month. Her home is in a quiet neighborhood by the river close to shopping.  Thank you Karen
Great house for me as I was recovering from shoulder surgery.  Quiet location by the river. Karen and Rocky were awesome hosts

This was a wonderful little house. It's got the charm of a 1920s house and also a very cozy feeling.  It reminded me of all the time I spent with my grandmother and great aunt.  The location is quiet with a great view of the Willamette River.  So centrally located we were not more than 10 minutes from anything in Salem.  We will definitely stay again.

This is a lovely house.  Karen is very good at providing a homey feeling.  The accommodations are superb from the spacious kitchen, comfortable dining and living area,  to the luxurious bed which for this old body (age 72) was a treat.  The location was also great in that it is about a mile and one-half from the downtown area.  It is also quiet.
A charming, comfortable home with nice views of the Willamette River and a lovely host.

Karen’s home was a wonderful place filled with charming touches throughout.
It was excellent to stay here and keep a somewhat normal routine while visiting Oregon from out of state.
The stay was quite and calm.
Karen was a delight and I felt that our interactions were pleasant.
When I unavoidably come back to Salem, OR I will stay here again.
Great place to stay! Near the river, super close to downtown, quiet neighborhood. Loved it

If you're looking for a peaceful, quiet environment that is located within walking distance to the Salem downtown area, this is the place to be. The host is kind and offers a super-clean dwelling with plenty of privacy and plenty of supplies for cooking. Washer/dryer on site.
Fresh flowers, comfortable bed, relaxing back porch where you can see the river.  Great way to start my vacation!
Very tidy, communicated well, and Karen was also very accommodating for special request. Enjoyed our quick stay in Salem.
thanks Karen.  lovely place. perfect.
Awesome little place that is near everything especially if you are going to explore the greater area.
Cozy, clean and close to everything Salem has to offer. A very quiet neighborhood that offers some great views of the river. Definitely would stay here again.
What a lovely landing pad for it trip! Thoroughly enjoyed our time here!

A fine place to stay for one night, but I wouldn’t call it cozy or clean. An old house that’s split with the host living above you. (10pm quiet time).
Karen was very nice and we appreciated her hosting, but the house wasn’t in a walking neighborhood or near anything particularly nice to be near. Bees outside made the outside porches not useable and the half eaten food in the fridge and on the shelves was uncomfortable with covid being on the rise in the area.

Overall, like I said, not for cooking or getting comfortable, fine as a one night on the road kind of place.

Karen was a great host! Awesome communication throughout the whole stay, very welcoming, the place was exactly as described and pictured! Clean and homey! If we come back to Portland will definitely try to book here again. :)
Great space and amenities, with a wonderful hostess who was very welcoming. Once of the most comfortable beds that I've slept in while on vacation. Thanks for everything!

This home is so private, the guest has the whole downstairs, while the owner/host lives upstairs. Since I am a single woman traveling along, safety was a major concern & I felt very safe here. The home is “vintage” which I like, yet had all the modern conveniences. It was a very comfortable place to stay for 4 nights. Host Karen is very friendly and helpful. The location is also excellent. Would definitely stay here again.
Karen's home is spacious, clean and comfortable.  Everything is as stated. and more.  I would be pleased to stay there if I ever get the chance to come visit again.

Karen”s home is very spacious and well stocked with more than just the essentials.  Check in/out and communication was excellent.  I stayed for a week and would definitely stay again when I come back.

We enjoyed our stay at Karen’s charming house during the Christmas holiday. The home was lovingly decorated too. We felt very at home and appreciated the cleanliness and coziness. During our stay there was a snow storm and Karen thoughtfully checked in on us to make sure we had electricity and were ok. I would highly recommend this stay; you’ll feel right at home!
Charming idyllic little cottage with all the essentials host was always available
Very cozy pleasant place. Karen was great

This is a great place to stay.  The host is great and the accommodations are nice and cozy.  The location is close to pretty much everything in Salem.  This was the second time we stayed and we chose it because we liked it so well the first time.

Delightful stay in an a beautiful home by the River very near downtown. Spacious and comfortable living room, well-equipped kitchen, large bedroom, and two decks to enjoy morning coffee or a meal (if it doesn’t rain continuously during your time). Karen is kind and generous - we wanted to host a dinner party which she was delighted to allow.

This is a find - grab it.

The house is very comfortable in feel and well equipped with everything you need to enjoy your stay and vacation.
Karen is easy to communicate with and personable.
We had to extend our stay by a day and Karen was accommodating and understanding.
Location is convenient to stores and freeways.
This is just like staying with one of your relatives - nice and homey.  Very nice location for everything in the Salem area.

We stayed during the Ironman and the location was great. The unit is very spacious and feels private. Very comfortable bed! The shower is a bit small, so probably would not work for a large person.

It was hot out but the AC was always at a comfortable temperature. We were very happy with this stay. Would recommend.

Thank you Karen!
Beautiful home and wonderful host … she was always available and accommodating when needed. Would definitely recommend and come back here!!
Our stay was good, freeway access was easy which help us travel between Portland and Salem.  Local eating restaurants were close and had great food.
This place was fantastic! Right in town; I would definitely stay here again.

This was a perfect place for us to stay for the week while my daughter was settling in for college. Great location for getting around town as well as getting on the highway to venture to other destinations. Would definitely consider staying again in the near future.
Thank you Karen!
Great little house in a quiet neighborhood. The space was pretty large for our family and we were comfortable during our stay. The price was right and we'd gladly go back!

Had to cancel last minute due to wild fires and Salem being under a level 2-3 fire watch/evacuation. I was keeping an eye on the news, asked the host for more details on the fire with no response.
I decided to cancel because the news reports were not getting any better and asked host for a full refund, except for the first night/cleaning fees, etc., because I canceled the day of.
Despite explaining why I felt unsafe staying in Salem, the host did not acknowledge my concerns, and told me to seek cancelation through airbnb which would only refund me half of the total price.
Overall, I am very dissatisfied with the hosts professionalism. I did not even check in to the AirBnB, I was willing to pay for part of the stay and the cleaning, and they were unwilling to even talk about giving us a refund.
The wildfires are obviously out of everyone's control, but I would have appreciated a bit of understanding and empathy from the host considering how far I was traveling to just have a nice vacation.
I would not advise any one to stay with this host.
This is a charming, quirky and comfortable place and Karen is a great host.  I hope I find an excuse to return.
Karen was a great host! The place was clean and exactly as advertised. Highly recommend.

Karen is as lovely and engaging as her warm and comfy living room and bedroom. Sitting by the gas fireplace on a typical Oregon fall evening was cozy. The bedroom was nicely appointed and the bath and kitchen (and office) were as well. Thank you for the delicious coffee and cream.
I appreciated Karen’s explicit description of the stairs and the shower. Although I had no issues, as a”person of age” it was important to know in advance.
Thank you for sharing your lovely space and for making me feel so welcome.
It was a very comfortable and cozy place. The kitchen was surprisingly easy to cooking. Some of the furniture could use updating.
My flight got delayed so I didn’t arrive until 1:30 in the morning and I was exhausted. I had no problems getting in and the place just like the pictures, clean and ready. Karen was a helpful host.

This location was nearly perfect for my needs while visiting Salem. Very quiet street near the Willamette River on the NE side of town, short drive to downtown Salem. The upstairs suite is a great intro to old historic homes. Living area with a full size firm sofa bed. Bedroom with a queen-size memory-foam mattress, a small kitchen and a bathroom with 2 sinks. The kitchen has everything you need for food prep. The living room has a cozy gas fireplace. The suite is full of eclectic decorative touches, plus many books, tourist info, some games. I didn’t get to spend time with host Karen, but when we met she was very nice. A few things to note: as is common in very old houses, the entrance to the upstairs suite is a narrow staircase, with stair treads that are narrower than those we are used to in new homes. Bathroom shower is set up in a small claw-foot tub, the somewhat confined space may be challenging to guests who are larger or with mobility limitations. I really enjoyed my stay!
Beautiful home! I would highly recommend! Thank you so much for your Kindness Karen! We are in Japan now

Nick was responsive, inviting and professional. The pictures don't do the place justice. It's actually nicer in real life. How many times does that happen!? The bedroom, as well as the entire house, is extremely clean and quiet. The neighborhood is charming and a nice walk to the heart of Salem. I would stay here again anytime. In fact, I have decided to stay an extra night.

-Brent Wallis
Nick was great to communicate with. He lives out of town so I didn't get to meet him but he walked me through everything I needed to know. The security lighting outside is very comforting.
The room was very pleasant to stay in along with the house. Nick was easy to communicate with. Great stay.
Not sure how you could do better for the money. Quick communication, simple instructions and a quiet night's sleep. Excellent AirB&B experience. Thanks!

Nick was a great host and was awesome at communicating!  Every time I had a question he was very responsive.  Neighborhood was quiet and quaint and the house matched that well.  We did not spend much time there, but it was all convenient and worked very well for us.

Nick was pleasant and welcoming in his communications, the house is lovely, and the neighborhood seems quiet, pleasant and safe. We had some challenges with the scented products used in the room (finally discovered the nightlight was a diffuser and un-plugged it) and the fact that there were multiple guests there, more like a boarding house, not someone's personal home. The bed was too soft for our taste as well. I'm sure it would be fine for some, but not for us.
The house was in a great location away from the hustle of busy streets. The pictures don't do the house or room justice. Clean and very inviting. I would most definitely plan to stay here again.
Everything was clean, the house was beautiful, and the neighborhood was quiet. It was great to be within easy biking distance from downtown Salem without having to stay there!
Ended up extending my stay a second night and Nick was super accommodating with an early check-in
This place was great for a brief stay - big rooms, clean, super comfy bed, and the price was perfect.
Accurate

Nick was a great host.  He was super responsive and made me feel welcome at every  turn.  The property was just as advertised and perfectly suited my needs and expectations.  I won't hesitate to return the next time my travels bring me to Salem, OR.
Everything was as mentioned in the description. Nick was very responsive to my questions and accommodating for my late arrival. I would  recommend the place to anyone! :)

Nick was a fantastic host. Whole set up is easy and the house is beautiful as mentioned. Quiet roommates and everything you would need for a peaceful night. The museum of mental health nearby is fun if you have time. The word of mouth bistro recommended is one of the best breakfasts I've had. Go super early as it crowds up or if you're alone it should be fine. Such a comfy bed along with easy in and out makes this a great trip.
As with all of the reviews that I saw, Nick and the place are great. Great old-charm house with beautiful wood accents throughout. Quiet, clean, and just as he described it. Two thumbs up!

The room was clean and spacious. Nick was a very responsive and easy to reach. The only downfall was that the doorknob was broken and we couldnt/ didn't feel safe leaving our things in the room unmonitored with other guests and we almost got locked in our room and couldn't get out from the broken doorknob.

This space is charming and a great space for a quick trip or maybe a week. I plan to stay here again. It was quiet and very clean. Nick was very helpful at making me feel like I had everything for my stay.
Mahalo for the hospitality.

Nick's house in Salem is spacious and clean and in a quiet, nice neighborhood. It has a great shared kitchen and dining area, and our room (#1) was roomy and we could not hear the other residents at all. We had a great stay.

Booked this place for my parents. They had some issues with the cleaning, so I immediately texted Nick, who took care of if it right away. Other than that the house had a perfect location and brand new appliances!

The host was very responsive and very prompt with messages. He messaged me with all the details needed to access the home. He also checked in with me frequently to make sure that all the needs of my party was met.
The room and bathroom was beautiful! The rooms were clean and the decor was very nice. Both my mom and brother said it was their favorite place to stay out of all the places that we stayed during our Washington and Seattle trip. The house was also in a nice and safe neighborhood.
I would definitely recommend this place to others and intend on coming back when I visit Oregon again.
Nick was great! Everything in the house was accurate from the listing description. House is very lovey in a pleasant neighborhood. Beautiful home.

Nick is great about getting back to potential guests, he was easy to communicate with and answered my emails within hours. I went for a nice run, the neighborhood has a few parks and wide streets that are perfect for running.

This was the first time I've used Airbnb myself but a friend works for corporate Airbnb and I've booked them for my mother so I'm familiar with the idea. It doesn't appear that Nick lives here, which he says in the listing; there are multiple Airbnb guests staying in all the rooms. I was alone with two other men and as a single female, I didn't feel very comfortable, especially when one came home at 2:30am. I think I would have felt better if Nick had been there just in case there was a problem. I reread the reviews and noticed that a lot of the women who stayed here were with a significant other, which would have made me feel safer. So this doesn't really reflect on the place, which I would say is as described, but is good to take into consideration in case it might be an issue for you.
Great value for late reservations
Nick is kind man and father.  He  will take care of any problems right away!

I did not want to leave when my reservation was over! Nick's older home has been beautifully remodeled, but without losing the feeling of going back in time. It was nice and quiet and the gourmet kitchen was a huge plus along with the enormous outdoor space and porch swing! The room was bright and full of windows and with a great view of the trees. There were plenty of extra linens and blankets and lots of small touches.  I hope that I will have the opportunity to return or for family members to be able to stay !

Nick was a great host and answered any question I had during my stay right away.

The room was exactly as described and shown on the pictures: Large and with easy access to a nice bathroom. The shared kitchen facilities worked out great as well.

The room will be perfect if you have business to do in Salem and need a place to stay.
The listing was very accurate and the house is just beautiful! So much space and has everything you would need.

The room was exactly as described. Safe neighborhood.  Charming front porch swing. We only spent one night. And was just me and teen daughter. We felt comfortable even with other roommates in house.  Very clean spacious home with nice furnishings. Nick even offered that we could use laundry room which was great since we had been on the road for 4 days. Nick is very organized and accommodating as a host. Very appreciative for his flexibility and great communication. Would stay again and recommend.
