I highly recommend this place, would go back again! Beautiful back yard, spacious in the downstairs area, quiet, private. Thank you Casey & Family for your welcome and relaxed environment!

The cutest cozy cottage you'll ever stay in! Casey & Fam were amazing and so kind! Kitties are so adorable! They will send you to the best places and have the best food reccomendations! If you book with anyone else, you'll be really missing out! Great people and a great trip!!
Casey’s place was very clean, private, and stylish. Had a nice large area in the basement to lounge. Great stay in Salem!
Good location and hosts were friendly. We had family business, so were not able to spend much time at the apartment. Only drawback was bathroom was upstairs. But location is very convenient.

This place is great place!  Five stars. No complaints. It is a unique, lovely 2nd floor art gallery space in a very nice neighborhood. Hosts were appropriately engaged, friendly, while respecting our privacy. Hosts were givers not takers who seemed to take pride in offering outstanding hospitality and facilities. Their genuine motivation seemed to be for us to have a good time. We enjoyed the many small yet useful kindnesses such as fresh cream and almond milk waiting in the fridge for our coffee, along with a plate of freshly baked scones and homemade jam. It is as clean as an art gallery. The courtyard outside is gorgeous, landscaped, with sculptures and mature trees.

Mary Lou is a dream! Her passion for art and all that Salem has to offer enhance her natural gift as a hostess. The space is incredible...bright and inviting inside and out. We were in town for our son's wedding (4 days) and busy from morning to night. We couldn't have asked for a more welcoming or peaceful space to come home to each night. Mornings in the garden, warm scones and raspberry preserves, what more could you ask for? It's our new home away from home!❤️

Our stay started with a welcoming glass of wine and a great discussion of art, travels and sights to be seen in Oregon. Our hosts have created a delightful art focused getaway that honors their proposition "Art Makes Friends". Located in the carriage house of their English Tudor home, the apartment is set in a wonderfully whimsical backyard art garden. It's a small comfortable bright studio apartment filled with art. Perfect for us. Our hosts were completely prepared with information on what to see and do. Mary Lou always checked in via text to see if we needed anything or had questions. She also provided a wonderful breakfast featuring fruit, granola and delicious home-made scones and/or banana bread.
Our expectations were exceeded at every turn. We arrived as strangers and left with new friends!

The loft itself is lovely: clean, spacious, and bright. It's filled with intriguing art and located in a quiet neighborhood with established homes and gardens, yet still close to restaurants.

What stands out most, though, is the warmth of Mary Lou and Alan's welcome -- we wished we could have stayed longer! The amenities (food, beverages, and toiletries) were also better than any AirBnB we've used.
Beautiful loft with many extra amenities such as beverages, assorted snacks and toiletries if needed. The art is beautiful as well as the interior design. Host was lovely and helpful.

From the moment I met Mary Lou and Alan, I knew that I picked the right place to stay in Salem. To simply say they are polite and welcoming would be an understatement. Their kindness and warmth is electric. The art space loft was perfect. The linens smelled fresh, the space was inviting and clean, and the art showcased throughout the studio was done well. There is no television and we didn't miss it. Who needs television when you have all this art to enjoy? The studio has a very well working air conditioning unit and so many windows to open for fresh air if the weather permits. On our second night, our gracious hosts invited us into the home for homemade pie and ice cream and to chat and share travel stories. Incredible. I can't say enough great things about this Airbnb. I've used Airbnb about five times now and this is by far the best experience I've ever had. I literally can't think of one bad thing about this unit. Thank you to Mary Lou and Alan for a great Salem trip.

I have stayed in Airbnb's all over the world, from SF to Boston to London to Berlin to Waikiki.  Our experience with Mary Lou and Alan was unparalleled magic.  My wife and I are hesitant to let others know.  This is the best kept secret of Salem!

We could not possibly have had a more pleasant experience, in every way, than the one we had at Mary Lou's art loft. The well-designed and beautifully crafted space is a perfect accommodation. It's stocked with plenty of snacks, drinks, even toiletries. The fact that it is in a lovely, friendly neighborhood close to everything and filled with quality art is a tremendous bonus.  Mary Lou and Allen are delightful hosts, very friendly, knowledgeable, and responsive to our every need. Whatever you are doing in Salem, a stay at Mary Lou's art loft will enrich your experience!

Mary Lou and her husband were a joy and we'll feel like we made new friends.  Showing me around your lovely city was above and beyond and I am so grateful.  The loft was secluded and romantic yet open, bright and a feast for the eyes.  We look forward to staying with you again soon!

The Art Loft had everything you could possibly need-snacks, toiletries, music- and was located in a very beautiful, quiet, and private setting. Mary Lou was an excellent host, very approachable and welcoming. I would highly recommend staying at this creative haven to anyone.
Mary Lou was amazing! We arrived to fresh baked cookies, and were given a book full of local recommendations.  The house was perfect and they were lovely people! Thank you so much!

This was a lovely place to stay in a beautiful neighborhood.  Our travel was delayed resulting in a very late arrival but Mary Lou and her husband were available and made sure we were comfortable.  A lot of small touches that really made traveling easier: a keurig for coffee; half & half in the refrigerator; etc.  The space was very clean, private, and well laid out.  We plan to return to have more time to explore the neighborhood.

I loved my stay at this artistic and peaceful studio! Every detail was top notch, and the hosts are charming, welcoming and really have put a lot of care into creating a great space. I can't wait until my next opportunity to visit the ol' hometown!

Wow -- I'm a frequent AirBnB traveler and this is the best experience I've had yet in an AirBnB.

The host is absolutely accommodating and thoughtful. We had coffee, snacks, water, tea, bagels, yogurt set up for us. We arrived very late after a day spent with friends in the valley -- and she didn't bat an eye.

The space is gorgeous, inspired, inspiring, and immaculate. The gallery aspect is so cool. The collection is stunning and creative b

I'm writing a book and am thinking returning to use the loft as my writing space.

This is a great place to stay, one of the nicest neighborhoods I'm aware of in Salem.
Mary Lou went above and beyond to make sure my arrival and comfort level with their space was immediate. Very nice people!

Mary Lou and Alan were helpful in every way, from picking us up at the train station, offering great recommendations, baking us scones and even dropping off a picnic basket. The loft itself is beautiful, quiet, spacious, well appointed.  Note the bed is a full/double, so if you are used to more room it may be an adjustment.  We very much enjoyed our stay.

Mary Lou and her husband made me feel right at home. The accommodations were first class. I can't imagine a better experience than the one I had.  My hosts were kind, knowledgeable, and wonderful to be with. They gave me the space I needed to rest, and were there for me if I had questions. Stay here, you won't regret it!!

Mary Lou is a warm, generous and wonderful host. The loft is delightful in every way. The art work and overall lay out of the space are lovely. We really appreciated all of the special touches...warm scones for breakfast, coffee & tea, passes for the museum, etc. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Salem!

Very easy and fast communication.  Received a lovely welcome from very nice and warm people (and dog).  Charming spot in an easygoing neighborhood.  Comfortable stay with complete amenities.  Overall an amazing stay and is a great example of why I love Airbnb

What a place!!!  We didn't want to leave.  We wish we had been able to spend more time in this beautiful art loft.  Mary Lou and Alan couldn't have been nicer.  Homemade chocolate chip cookies upon arrival and a lovely bottle of wine left at our door to celebrate the beginning of our honeymoon.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit with Mary Lou and Alan, hope to see them again.  Thank you for sharing your beautiful home.

If there were more stars available to describe our stay at the Artist's Loft, we'd grab them. Being surrounded by museum quality art is pure enchantment. The loft has every amenity with unexpected touches that surprised and delighted us. Hosts Mary Lou and Alan go the extra mile with exuberant suggestions(all spot on). They've taken the Airbandb experience to new heights for us. We hated to leave and can't wait to return.
The hosts went above and beyond to be welcoming and personable and gracious. The loft was WONDERFUL! Comfortable and exactly what was described and needed! The visit was AMAZING,in all ways!

The hosts were  very welcoming and remained available for tips or any help I might need throughout my stay. I walked around this lovely neighborhood and loved the views, the homes, the whole feel of the area. I felt safe and well cared for.  I hope to be back!

I had a wonderful and restful stay at Mary Lou's place.  Even though I arrived late, she and her husband gave me tour to make sure I had everything I needed.  The space was fantastic and I appreciated all the little things that Mary Lou provided (including baked goods).

This was my very first Airbnb experience and all I have to say is WOW! Mary Lou and Alan were warm, relaxed,and always available. The loft is bright, cheerful, whimsical and very cleverly furnished and set up to provide efficient functionality. The personal touches and consideration by Mary Lou were found in all the unexpected amentities that were provided...natural body wash, shampoo, q-tips, toothpaste, shaving cream, hair dryer, iron/ironing board, UMBRELLA, and I can't even remember what else. Kitchen was graciously stocked with fantastically fun plates,bowls, cutlery, toaster, coffee, tea, snacks, granola,fruit, variety of 1/2 and 1/2 and almond milk for the coffee, and a great bottle of Chardonnay!
I didn't want to leave after 5 days of being in a safe,cozy, beautiful environment. Truly was a home away from home:)

This is a secret little place in Salem!  Everything was perfect.  I felt like I was staying in artists home... all the original art on the walls is stunning!The neighborhood is delightful .  Mary Lou was a wonderful host.  If I have an opportunity to come back to Salem this is the place I will want to stay again and again!
Loved the quite and comfortable space. Very friendly hosts.  We even enjoyed homemade cookies, lemonade, water, fruit and bagels. Can't wait to come back. Julie and Charles

This is a unique, lovely and cozy space in a beautiful neighborhood, perfect for one or two adults. A special and well appointed art space, with lots of unexpected and gracious extras (a welcoming bottle of wine, coffee, breakfast and snack items). No TV (a plus), easy off street parking, with a partial (no range/oven) kitchen. Exceptionally friendly and helpful hosts Matt Lou and Alan. Delightful.

The entire experience was great! You can tell Mary Lou put a lot of thought into how the unit is laid out and eclectically decorated, with plenty of info about all of the art and local artists and galleries.

The location is perfect. Not far at all from the Salem city center, and easy access via Commercial to south Salem, or via Mission to the freeway.

I arrived to Salem late in the evening, but my hosts were ready and waiting to greet me and show me around. Mary Lou had even made cookies for my arrival! I also was able to meet their adorable dog, which was a highlight for me ;-).

The loft was extremely clean and the artwork was stunning and interesting. I wish I had a little more time to read up on a few pieces that spoke to me.

I require a heavy comforter to sleep comfortably, and they had one as an extra option on the bed. The mattress was extremely comfortable as well.

For breakfast, I had tea with honey, yogurt and granola, which was all right in the room. Very convienient and appreciated.

My only problem was that I had to scoot out early the next morning for work appointments, when all I really wanted to do was to stay in the loft and relax for the morning!

Thank you for such a lovely experience.
Second time here - felt just like home! So so nice - I'll be back!

Our host was most charming actually getting my husband something he loves for breakfast. Very nice.

The description of the unit was accurate. It was a lovely artsy lift over the garage that was quite wonderful. Being a painter myself, I often fell asleep admiring the art around us. And the neighborhood was quite nice.

Both hosts were very friendly and inviting. We would have loved to spend a little more time with them (as they suggested) but everyone was so busy with seeing family during the holidays that time ran out. Great visit.
My second time at Mary Lou's place. It was warm and comfy during the winter weather.
Mary Lou was very helpful and quick to communicate. The art-filled loft was comfortable, pleasant, and had everything I could have needed. Thanks again!

I was in Salem for two nights on a work trip and found the Art Loft to be a wonderful place to stay. There is plenty of space to lounge, the kitchenette is wonderful for fixing breakfast in the morning, and I really enjoyed being surrounded by all the art work. Mary Lou and Alan are wonderful hosts and have great recommendations for places to eat and drink in town. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend to others.
As always, enjoyed my stay at Mary Lou's place.
Great and comfortable space. Nuce, quiet location. Mary Lou and Alan were very responsive and nice to work with.

We loved our stay in Mary Lou's beautiful, bright loft. The bed was very comfortable, and we had a cozy morning enjoying the array of snacks and fruit provided for us and looking at all of the art included in the space. If we had had more time in town, we would have loved to take advantage of the complimentary passes to the Hallie Ford art museum that Mary Lou graciously provided. A wonderful find!

We loved our stay at this well equipped  art filled loft.  The historical location is the best in Salem.   Mary Lou and Allen's attention to detail was amazing and so helpful.  Even better than the description.  Looking forward to returning.
Mary Lou's place is beautiful, well appointed, comfortable, interesting - everything I could have wanted.  They were so thoughtful as hosts and yet, I had all the privacy I wanted.
Mary Lou was awesome, she met us and showed us the apartment (which was amazing). Her and Alan were very nice and made us feel really lucky to have stayed in their place.

If i could give Mary Lou and Alans loft 100 stars i would. It is everything an airbnb should be. Clean comfortable homey, beautifully decorated, fully equipped right down to the coffee and cream (very impt) they are hosts that make you feel like so much more than a paying guest. They are all the reasons to stay in an airbnb rather than a hotel. It was a perfect stay. We will be back for sure!
Mary's place was so welcoming - clean, beautiful, full of art, and very comfortable. I had a wonderful stay at her loft and highly recommend it.
Amazing place and the best hosts in the biz!!!
The space was perfect. Comfortable, clean, well equipped, and easy to get to. Mary Lou had some awesome suggestions for spots to check out. Definitely will be staying here my next trip.

Mary Lou's loft is absolutely lovely!  I slept soundly and well there, and thoroughly enjoyed myself.  It was an unexpected benefit to get to walk in such a beautiful neighborhood, and also to run to and around Bush Park, which is very close!  I was warmly welcomed at Mary Lou's home.  It made me appreciate kindness, and remember that there are many good people in the world.

Great location for downtown activities. Quiet and clean. Mary Lou and Alan were very welcoming and provided plenty of information on things to do and see while in Salem.

Will stay there again when visiting Salem.

Let's just say for our first experience with Airbnb, we couldn't have been more happy!!  Mary Lou has thought of every detail to make your stay one to remember, the art Loft is cozy, quiet, and really did go beyond our expectations.  Im already counting down till the next time we can stay here again✓
Great place and people. Would definitly stay there again.
Amazing location and hosts. We loved our stay! Definitely coming back. Great art and amenities.
I love staying at Mary Lou's place. It is lovely, light filled, clean and private. It's my favorite when I am in Salem!

This was our first experience in an Air B and B. The reviews were excellent but did not prepare us totally. Our hosts were great and made our stay excellent. Many extra touches that enhanced our stay. Comfortable, cozy, private, and just perfect. Can't wait to stay again.

Such a great experience at Mary Lou's loft. Mary Lou was a wonderful, warm host with great communication the entire time.

The space is lovely and very private. It felt like staying in a bright and airy tree house. And the art everywhere really adds to the place. Plus, most pieces are for sale, so you can bring a memory home with you.

Definitely will be back!

Mary Lou and Alan are great hosts and the Art Loft is a cozy comfortable place to stay. The location was perfect for us. We loved the art and bought a piece as a souvenir of a wonderful trip. This was our first Air BNB experience and couldn't have been better!

Mary Lou and Alan are gracious hosts! The studio is such a special place! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this funky, colorful, cozy, fun, welcoming environment. If I ever find myself back in Salem, I would definitely stay again! Thank you!!!

Such a beautiful place and such good hosts!  The apartment is private, spotless, and filled with amazing art. Mary Lou was the consummate host, helpful, fun, and very friendly. This is the place to stay in Salem!

the first moment we arrived, we felt like home and so welcome! Mary Lou gave us such a warm welcome and pampered us all around with everything! She even surprised us with little treats...beside all the comfort the studio gives you it definitely also inspires you! Just wonderful! We have to say a big big thank you and we'll definitely come again!
Magnificent. Comfort, peace, beauty, kindness and art all wrapped in a big ol ball of fabulous. You need to experience this spot and these people!

This is a lovely spot, in a gorgeous quiet neighborhood. Quality furnishing, bedding, beautiful views of the tree tops, and the art in the studio was a real treat. I didn't want to leave in the mornings!

Exceeded our expectations, perfection, highly recommend and will stay again. Host, Mary Lou, is very friendly and was quick to respond from initial communication and throughout our stay. The Art Loft is in a lovely historic neighborhood and is very quiet, we slept well. Our parking space was conveniently at the bottom of the stairs. We were very pleased with the Art Loft, the vibe, layout, size, decor and amenities, all were wonderful. Cleanliness was great, bed was very comfortable, bed and bath linens were good quality. The bathroom and kitchen were thoughtfully stocked. We enjoyed  our coffee, yogurt and granola, while sitting surrounded by all the wonderful art, reading about the artists / artwork and the host's local recommendations. We were in Salem for a relative's graduation. The Art Loft was our peaceful oasis. In between family celebrations we found time to visit Willamette Winery for a bite and a glass of wine. Archive Coffee Bar, a short drive away, was great. After a walk around downtown, we took a short drive to Minto Island Growers, for a delicious lunch, on the edge of the garden, prepared in a food truck type trailer, by friendly folks... We were thrilled with the suggestions in the Art Loft's notebook. Our son was also pleased with his special accommodations ("camp-out") on the mattress and bedding provided and we could easily fold it all up and tuck it out of the way. Mary Lou even had some small toys and an artist board for our son. He loved borrowing these cool new toys. Mary Lou's husband is just as nice, we met him when dropping off the key. Our stay couldn't have been better and I highly recommend the Art Loft. We'll be back!
This loft is a wonderful place to be. Mary Lou was a fantastic host and our experience was nothing short of perfect.

OK, so I'm a little reluctant to write an excellent review, because, well, I want the place to be available next time I'm in Salem. Selfish; I know.

SO, in the spirit of altruism: what a wonderful place to stay, and what incredibly good hosts. Off-street parking was convenient. The loft is private and spacious. And eclectic. I love art. If you do, this unique loft is a fun place to stay.

If that doesn't matter to you, well; I'm sorry. HOWEVER, you won't find a better hostess in Mary Lou, who is there to accommodate. She has a true, caring spirit, and wants you to enjoy your stay.

For business, the location was perfect for me: close to brew pubs AND my meeting location; featuring decent (though not blinding) WiFi speeds -- while quiet and comfortable. If the pictures of the place entice you, don't think twice. Mary Lou, I hope I have an opportunity to come back. Thanks!
Thank you.
We loved Mary Lou's place.  We will be back and tell our friends and family about this great hide away

Mary Lou's place was beautiful.  They welcomed us warmly and we had an instant connection.   We loved looking at the artwork in the loft space.  When can you just sit and appreciate art?  Mary Lou thought of everything from fresh scones to breakfast treats.  We will be back!

Really great place. The best thing about the place was the treehouse effect, a lot of windows, a lot of light, and looking at the light on the trees. The decor in the studio showed a level of sophistication I haven't seen in (stodgy) Salem. I felt a little touch of Manhattan about it. Great fridge, the freezer is separate compartment so frozen food stays frozen. (I must admit to gobbling up some ice cream and herb cream cheese left in there.)
Mary Lou went out of her way to explain everything and to be communicative when she wasn't there. She was a good hostess. Treat yourself to this studio on Fairmont Hill. It's unique in Salem and better than the Grand Hotel.

We were looking for a centrally located place to stay while we were in town for a friend's wedding last weekend.  After comparing this to the prices/amenities for area hotels, it was a no-brainer to pick Mary Lou's airbnb.  The loft is gorgeous, light-filled, and beautifully appointed with art from local artists.  Mary Lou, Alan, and Gramps are excellent, warm, and welcoming hosts who truly understand the meaning of hospitality--from restaurant recommendations, to the complimentary snacks and bottle of wine that greeted us upon arrival, to the conversation we shared while relaxing on the back patio--their accommodations were some of the best we've experienced.
Great place very visually appealing and the hosts are beyond accommodating

Mary Lou and Alan's art loft was delightful--beautifully decorated with original art and conveniently located within a short drive of Salem's downtown restaurants and bars. They had lots of great recommendations as well.
Nice small studio, Mary Lou provides snacks, granola, and coffee to allow for quiet mornings. I would stay here again.

Fabulous first experience with AirBNB--  the location is walking or an UBER distance to the capitol, downtown shopping, Willamette or the Salem Hospital.  Private parking right at the steps of the loft. The hosts are the perfect balance of charming and non-intrusive. The Art Loft is tasteful, pristine (not for dirty boots ) and an end of day oasis!

My husband and I had our BEST AirBnB experience staying with Mary Lou and Alan! The loft was clean, comfortable, airy, and had everything we needed. Mary Lou left us little snacks, which were especially helpful for our day trip hiking. The bed was very comfortable so had restful sleep the entire time. While the loft is equipped with AC, it was breezy with the window open so we just slept with the fan on. The artwork throughout the loft and sculptures in the garden kept it colorful and fun!

The neighborhood was a beautiful and quiet residential neighborhood with friendly neighbors. Walking distance to a big park (Busch Park) for a morning run or stroll. Also under 10 minutes drive to downtown Salem. We found the loft location very convenient for driving to nearby towns (e.g., Dayton, Mcminneville, Newburg, Dundee) and vineyards - all about 30-45 minutes drive away.

The highlight of our stay was getting to know Mary Lou, Alan, and their adorable dog, Gramps. We had a great time chatting with them each day and enjoyed the tour they gave us of the neighborhood. They gave us tips for places to check out and were so warm and thoughtful - I wish they were our neighbors back home!

Mary Lou, Alan, and Gramps - thanks again for an awesome stay and please do keep in touch!!

This property is AMAZING. The listing and pictures don't do it justice. We wanted to stay so much longer. Beautiful property, neighborhood and hosts. Lots of amenities including snacks, tons of towels, and recommendations for local hot spots. Don't pass this place up!

This review echoes the previous glowing reviews! Comfortable, quiet, clean, thoughtfully put-together. Tucked away in a beautiful, peaceful neighborhood with easy access to both downtown dining and scenic wine country. I'm so delighted we opted for Mary Lou and Alan's place over a local hotel. Wonderful hospitality and very warm welcome. They have a knack for hosting!

We really enjoyed Mary Lou's art loft in Salem. It is so unique and charming... also very clean and comfortable with plenty of space for 2 adults. They live in a beautiful area of town, perfect for a leisurely stroll or a jog. We enjoyed chatting with Mary Lou and Allen in their lovely patio and garden area. They are very friendly, interesting, and genuine people, and we would no doubt stay here again if traveling through Salem.
Exactly as described, we received such a warm welcome from Mary Lou (and Gramps). Would absolutely visit again!
Great place to stay, would recommend to anyone!

This was a real find. Mary Lou and Alan were terrific hosts, and theirs is a beautiful and peaceful property south of downtown Salem in a wonderful and quiet residential area. The loft was very private and comfortable. I slept better than in any of my business trips to Salem in a long time. The kitchenette with a small fridge, microwave, and Keurig was perfect. Very easy to relax here after a busy day...just what I needed!
Great Place!!!

Mary Lou, Alan and Gramps are fantastic hosts! The loft is beautiful and as previous comments have mentioned, the photos do not do it justice. If you love art, this is your place. The neighborhood is quiet and relaxing as well.

Mary Lou is an amazing host.  They have a beautiful place to stay and in a beautiful safe neighborhood.  I would recommend to stay here to anyone.  Very good trip and great hosts.  Salem is an amazing place.  So peaceful!  Thank you Mary Lou for everything.

Beautiful loft space in a lovely, quiet neighborhood. Very walkable area. Convenient to downtown. Mary Lou and Alan were wonderful hosts. Easy to communicate with and provided great recommendations for food, drink, and fun.

Darling guest house decorated with class!  What a wonderful place!  First, the neighborhood is gorgeous with stunning houses and mature trees and lush landscaping.  Its quiet and simply serene.  Second, Mary Lou and Alan are consummate hosts.  They were communicative, super friendly and make you feel right at home.  Finally, the guest house is a special place decorated with gorgeous artwork and all sorts of things to make a guest comfortable.  It's a spacious loft with views of the surrounding trees, windows everywhere and tons of light.  It's quiet and relaxing.  You just unwind by spending time in the loft.  There's a kitchenette that they have stocked thoughtfully with all sorts of delicious treats.  I particularly loved the reclaimed wood floor made from a racquet ball court.  An utterly delightful place to stay.  I highly recommend it!

Lovely art loft ~ really wonderful space & Salem experience. Alan & Mary Lou go out of their way to make this a great experience; providing location suggestions, access to local art, & even having some local magazines out. Additionally, they were wonderful hosts willing to help in a timely and efficient manner. Hope to stay with them again.
Really beautiful situation with a lake and activities to enjoy. We weren't able to stay very long but had a good nights sleep and a peaceful morning while watching the deer.
I want to live here!  Mary Lou and Alan are outstanding hosts and this amazing space is filled with wonderful treasures.  Treat yourself and book a stay here if you're in Salem.

My boyfriend and I had the most amazing stay at the Zeek's residence. Starting with excellent communication, a tour of their beautiful loft and home for us, we've enjoyed every moment and even came back for a welcomed invitation to see the Solar Eclipse. We traveled from California but the Zeeks made Salem truly feel like home. Expect great recommendations of delicious restaurants, a artsy loft that will wow you, a warm and lovely neighborhood, and the company of excellent hosts. If we ever find ourselves back in Salem we will be back, truly genuine people.

This was our second visit to the Art Loft with Mary Lou and Alan. We went this year to view the eclipse and we're invited to a pancake block party to celebrate TOTALITY.
This location is fantastic for everyone. Extremely clean. Your own private parking space. Soft bed. Comfortable sheets. A fantastic sofa to read, relax, and look at the art adorning the walls. The sliding art walls move to display a swivel television and a fantastic kitchenette. Air conditioner works great, but we found sleeping with the fan and open windows were sufficient. Within walking distance to downtown and our favorite taproom, Venti, which is only a few miles from the loft. The Art Loft is the perfect space for you to unwind and chill. Thank you again, Mary Lou & Alan, you are one in a billion.

Lovely art filled space. Comfy and peaceful. Mary Lou and Alan are wonderful hosts. The garden was filled with whimsy....my favorite!
Thank you for everything and the yummy scones!

Hope to see you soon!

Todd and Suzan

I can't say enough wonderful things about this darling gem! The beautifully designed room was perfect for us two. The loft was airy and light and colorful. It is such a unique place and we loved being surrounded by phenomenal art. They even had a notebook where you could read about the artists as well as helpful recommendations for places to eat and visit around the area. Mary Lou and Alan were just fantastic and so sweet and accommodating. We felt so welcomed. We would definitely come back to stay here the next time we are in Salem. So lovely!

A gorgeous place to stay. Full of art, so beautiful. Friendly hosts. They let us feel like home.
Highly recommended.
Get to Mary Lou's ASAP when you are in Salem, Oregon!!!

If you need a place in Salem, do not pass up your chance to stay at this amazing location. Mary Lou and Allen are so sweet and hospitable. You will not want to leave. Our entire stay was perfect. Being surrounded by the art made me feel like I was sleeping in an art museum. Book it!
As usual loved my stay at Mary Lou's place!

Mary Lou has really done a good job with her space. It is light filled and charming. There's good art everywhere and it's a comfortable place to stay. Mary Lou told us she and Alan wanted to offer a place that they themselves would like to stay in. We will certainly stay there again when in Salem!

Mary Lou's artist loft is like the most perfect adult tree house. Compact, bright, and airy, it is perfect for one or two people. The furnishings are comfortable and  there's plenty of space for lounging. Windows on all sides mean you get all the light possible. Mary Lou was a warm and welcoming host and I truly enjoyed my stay.
If you enjoy nice things you will love this spot. Mary Lou and Alan are doing it right: the bed is super comfortable, the shower is luxurious, and the art will make you feel alive. Stay here!
As always had a great stay at Mary Lou’s place.

So when I can accomplish business trip objectives, be surrounded by art in a cozy loft with all the essentials and then some, get to meet great hosts like Mary Lou and Alan, well then it just doesn't seem like work. Look forward to my next trip.

Gorgeous as they are, the pictures don’t do this place justice. It’s just lovely: full of natural light and artistic color. All appointments are comfortable and good quality. The host couldn’t have been more gracious. I wish I hadn’t been at a convention the whole time; this is a place to retreat to!
Fabulous place! Amazing art and furnishings. Tons of windows and incredible craftmanship everywhere you look.  Great hospitality.  Expect an unforgettable stay!
Everything was perfect. I loved the space and Mary Lou was very hospitable. Thank you!
Mary Lou’s is a incredible nice host, very friendly, everything went just perfect, I highly recommend Mary Lou’s place.
Another great stay at Mary Lou’s!

Mary Lou’s loft is hands down my favorite Airbnb experience so far!  She and Alan were friendly and welcoming, and the space was just perfection:  creative, warm, lively.  Very clean, beautiful light.  A very inspiring and charming experience; I️ didn’t want to leave.  I’ll be back!
Loved the Art Loft! I highly recommend it and hope to stay there again.
A beautiful spacious place in a quiet neighbor that is still close to everything. I will stay here again!

Perfect stay!
Such great hosts. We look forward to staying here again.
Lovely place. Will definitely be back to stay here again!

A unique, cozy accommodation with everything you need for a comfortable stay. Great hospitality, a beautiful neighborhood, and central location with easy access to restaurants and shopping. We enjoyed the art work, decor, and vibe. Our first Air BNB expérience and it won’t be our last!

Absolutely LOVE Mary Lou and Alans place. Our second visit and the only place to stay when in Salem  Everything you have read by previous guests is true. They are wonderful hosts and the space is beautiful!!

I was obsessed with this space. It was clean, had everything needed... the neighborhood was quiet and beautiful. Mary Lou and Alan were so friendly and welcoming... I literally wish I could live in this loft. I hope to be able to stay here again in the future! Perfect!

What a perfect space for us! Wouldn’t have done anything different. Mary Lou and her Husband were very welcoming and the loft was so beautifully put together. Nice touches throughout that make it just that much better.

Mary Lou’s place is so cute, comfortable, and in a great quiet neighborhood. I was able to get a nice meal at the local organic grocery store up the road and in the morning there was coffee and yummy granola in the kitchen that let me stay in and relax before I had to begin my day working. This studio of art was very fun and relaxing environment and the bed was comfy too!

I love staying in Airbnbs and this is definitely one of the best!  It is as beautiful as the oictures and has everything you might need or want.   The bed was really comfortable and  There was a desk where I could work and a well stocked kitchenette with snacks, coffee, fresh fruit and breakfast items.  It was very quiet and parking was easy.  Mary Lou and Alan were gracious hosts and made everything easy.  The neighborhood is quiet but was close to everything I needed in downtown Salem.  I've already made a reservation for another stay next monthand hope to always be able to stay here when I'm visiting Salem!
Quiet loft with amazing art everywhere.  Comfortable and just the spot for a couple or single to settle in for a  cozy stay.
We loved Mary lou’s Place in all respects

This is a beautiful loft and the hosts created special touches for the stay including a bottle of wine for the guests, breakfast food, and beautiful art on the walls. As an example of the hosts' attention to detail, they include a fan in the room in case a guest would like white noise in the background as they sleep. I appreciated that the hosts were also fine with me having my sister stay with me throughout my stay. The only thing that could be improved is the wifi - it was spotty in various places in the loft. I imagine this is because the loft is streaming from the house. That said, the still worked fairly well and the art on the walls and beauty of the loft itself made up for spotty wifi. I'd highly recommend this spot to other folks.

Allan and Mary Lou were the best hosts! Parking space right next to the unit. Check in was easy and smooth and Allan pointed out everything we needed to know about the apartment and the area which was helpful for us to find places to eat. The apartment itself was super clean and stylish with the beautiful artwork surrounding us. Everything in the apartment was easy to find and self explanatory to use. We will definitely stay here again.
Mary Lou's stylist studio was an amazing place to stay. I would recommend anyone visiting the area to try and stay here
A beautiful comfortable private place to stay close to downtown Salem. Hosted by a great couple. There are not enough words to describe the charm of this place so stop looking and just book it!
Fantastic hospitality from these hosts, the space was well designed and included lots of appreciated amenities.

Another amazing stay at Mary Lou’s place. I am able to bring my own food to prep or go to the local organic grocery store up the road. The bed was extra cozy with winter blankets and sheets. I love staying here!!
Mary Lou and Allan are excellent hosts. Their space is stylish and clean, with adjacent parking.  The artwork is amazing!
Mary Lou was wonderfully hospitable and warm. The place was comfortable, cozy, inviting, and so much more interesting than boring business hotels! It was a lovely respite after busy workdays.

Mary Lou and Alan are wonderful hosts and their place is beautiful and very comfortable.  This time there were cozy flannel sheets on the bed and fresh raisin English muffins and fruit waiting for breakfast.  Of all the Airbnb places I've stayed, this is, by far, my favorite.  The bed is comfortable and there is a nice desk and sitting area in addition to a well stocked kitchenette. I'm looking forward to my next stay here when I'm in Salem.
Super host, great communication, awesome artsy abode, and a comfortable bed in a quiet residential neighborhood. I didn’t stay long enough to enjoy it all but I will be back.

Bottom line is a lot of the airbnb experience is the hosts, and Mary Lou and Alan are the best. They made themselves available anytime we might need them, but also allowed us as much privacy as we wanted. They've taken a lot of time to make the loft unique, and it certainly was. If we travel again to Salem and need to be in the particular area, this place will be the first on our list.

Great spot! Nice natural light, beautiful artwork and loved the granola yogurt breakfast and coffee!
Enjoyed walking in the neighborhood.

The art loft was incredible! We were visiting to compete at a local running race and could not have asked for a better place to stay. Mary Lou was a welcoming and responsive host and was willing to let us check in early.

As always, another good stay at the artist's loft in what turned out to be one of the coldest couple of days I've experienced in Salem. All was cozy and warm, however, and the atmosphere more than made up for the weather!
This space is absolutely incredible!  Comfy and cozy and everything that you could ever need - every detail covered.  Would highly recommend.
The art loft was in the perfect location for my quick stay in Salem. Mary Lou was so helpful and kind, and communicated well. The space is gorgeous too!

Mary Lou's place is truly amazing. Adorned with amazing art from local artists, and stylishly furnished. The bed was cozy and comfortable and I slept like a baby, ensconced in cozy sheets and fluffy bedding. Mary Lou is a wonderful host and has a flare for creating an inviting environment. I hope to be able to stay again!!

Mary Lou and Allen were both delightful and extremely artistic, which reflected in their beautiful apartment. The design and colors were very enjoyable, the communication with Mary Lou was prompt and concise, and her/their attention to details was beyond what I expected. I would recommend staying at their apartment, particularly if you desire a lovely, quiet location near downtown Salem and a stay that is free from stress or concerns.
We enjoyed the inspiring, art filled space and the beautiful neighborhood. Mary Lou was a wonderful, helpful host who provided delicious breakfast food, coffee pods and local magazines.
Another stellar stay at the Art Loft!

The Artist’s Loft is gorgeous space in a lovely neighborhood, and the property has an amazing, beautiful garden.   Everything we needed was provided and much more! It was very comfortable, and the hosts made sure that we were well taken care of. The many extra touches like wine and chocolate treats made us feel welcomed and they were much appreciated.   We hope to have the opportunity to visit again soon.  It is a very special place.

What an amazing find! Mary Lou and Alan are genuinely warm hosts. If you love art and creativity, you will absolutely love this place. The backyard is beautifully landscaped with a sprinkling of fun, eclectic art. Besides lovely hosts and wonderful art, you will have a comfortable bed and a very clean place. Unfortunately, this was a very rushed trip so we didn’t have nearly enough time to enjoy this beautiful, artsy space. We plan to book here our next trip!
Amazing space, with great light, close to everything I needed.
I wish I could move in!

This is a beautiful space, with original artwork and lots of windows to let in the sun. It is very comfortably appointed, and the hosts went above and beyond by providing excellent coffee, granola, yogurt and snacks. We hung out for hours in this lovely space, reading and relaxing in the rain. Lots to do in Salem and surrounding country as well, Silver Falls state park was especially nice.

This place was all the things that make AirBNB superior to hotels: gracious hosts interested in meeting new people, unique accommodations, privacy, gorgeous setting, delicious breakfast and snacks and great value. The spring flowers were in bloom and put on a magnificent show. The art was lovely and there was a binder where the artist explains their approach which I found helpful. One of the best places we have stayed with AirBNB.

Mary Lou and Alan greeted and welcomed us. They steered us too. Their Art Loft is a unique treat in every way. Don’t miss it!

As a lover of beautiful things, this loft will sweep you in. We stayed two nights and were still admiring/noticing new touches. ML & A are a terrific team - she’s an artist and he’s an articulate carpenter/builder/teacher.

If we lived near, we’d probably be friends.

Cheers to this beautiful area from the East Coast!!!


Enjoy,

MB & Allan

Mary Lou was such a great host! She made sure that we had all the details we needed when traveling to the house and she had tons of information about local sights.

The space is clean and very fun. We would definitely stay here again.

Mary Lou’s space was stunning, so cozy and interesting. We loved all the local art work in the studio and in the back yard. Mary Lou recommended a restaurant that was a highlight of our fast work trip with awesome tea and vegetarian options. This place was beautiful and we wish we could have stayed longer. The neighborhood was also beautiful and we enjoyed an evening stroll to downtown and watching the sunset!
Comfortable, clean, delicious snacks available. On demand cable and roku. Nice neighborhood, quiet. Excellent hosts. Would easily stay here again.

Beautiful space and people!!
We very much enjoyed our stay!!
Walked to amazing dinners and was close to all kinds of activities!!
Clean, quiet, and lovely!!

Mary Lou and Allen are the BEST! Mary Lou helped me before we arrived with info about Salem.
Check in was great and very welcoming.
The loft is very comfortable and the kitchen was stocked with coffee and breakfast.
We really enjoyed our stay in Salem and can't wait to be back soon.

A beautiful and unique space. We loved all the artwork and special touches. Even though it is a studio apartment, it felt spacious and roomy for two people, even when we spent the morning working there. It is in a beautiful neighborhood and close to great restaurants and coffee shops.
We loved staying here, would definitely stay here again. Mary Lou and Alan were excellent hosts.
Mary Lou and Alan are excellent hosts. Wish we could have stayed longer

This place does not disappoint!   It's really a neat space.   Decor is superb.    Amenities were well thought out.  We had great communication with our host.  Very comfortable space.   Loved being in a neighborhood yet close to everything.   Quiet.  Our host thought of everything.  Easy to communicate with.   I give this place space five out of five stars!   Highly recommend.

The space was wonderful -- felt like being in a tree house with stunning art everywhere.  Lovely part of Salem.  We enjoyed exploring Salem and the surrounding areas, following tips from our wonderful hosts.  Would highly recommend.
A definite must should you need a place to stay while in Salem.

Do not pass up an opportunity to stay in Mary Lou's loft. The space is filled with inspring art, and the thoughtful touches of breakfast snacks for the morning, the clean and comfortable environment made for a restful stay.  I highly recommend this host and would gladly stay again.

Mary Lou and Alan are exceptional hosts! Their home is outstanding. It’s close to downtown yet hidden in this gorgeous neighborhood. The house is located in back of the property. It almost feels like staying in a treehouse but a very luxurious and tastefully decorated one! So many little touches such as coffee with cream and sugar, granola, yogurt and snacks. They both gave us wonderful suggestions on places to go and bings to do. We absolutely loved our stay!

Staying at Mary Lou’s was fantastic. The loft was decorated with some amazing pieces of art and its layout was perfect. After each day’s adventures, it was so relaxing to come back and catch our breath. And it wasn’t just the loft, it was the entire neighborhood. Downstairs from the loft, there was a cozy outdoor “room” with a firepit, were we could sit and have a drink and go through the pictures of the day. Art was everywhere, from paintings to statues to mobiles….it was so comfortable and welcoming. Even looking out the windows, everyone in the area had these beautiful gardens and landscapes to brighten everything up. We were surrounded by gardens full of everything from roses to wildflowers. Every night, after coming back from our adventures, we would take time to simply walk around the block. The entire neighborhood had lots of little corner gardens with mixes of full blooms or bushes of blueberries and blackberries, huge trees, hidden pathways…. the neighborhood itself was almost a huge public park, where a walk down the sidewalk was one picture perfect setting after another.
Mary Lou is a fantastic host. She made sure we had coffee, snacks, sundries, and every other little thing that made the experience so wonderful. And if that wasn’t enough, on our last day, as we were packing our car to head out, she came out to say goodbye and give us a bag full of chocolate chip cookies she had made the night before.

I highly recommend if you are visiting Salem, check out Mary Lou’s wonderful place. It was a perfect launchpad for our visit to Oregon (where we travelled from the Coast to Silver Falls State Park to the Downtown Salem Saturday Farmers Market) with truly gracious hosts.

We had high hopes, but it was truly even better than I had expected. It was such a unique and interesting space-- something I always look for in an AirBnB. And nothing was sacrificed in terms of amenities and conveniences. We had our own separate parking area right at the loft. The way that the space fully functions as an art gallery and a comfortable living space, using these cool sliding walls, reminds me of some of the grand finales of those home makeover shows. It's just fun.
Mary Lou couldn't be a warmer host. And one night she and her husband happened to be having marionberry pie-- an Oregon specialty that we had never heard of. She warmed up two pieces and brought it over to us. We are not particularly fond of pies in general, but I'm telling you that this was the most amazing pie we had ever had. Not only that, but it introduced us to a cool local Oregon fruit that we wouldn't have gotten in any other state, but would likely have missed out on if not for Mary Lou!
The neighborhood is so beautiful-- every house different and so cool-looking. And located just a a few minutes from Willamette University.
I couldn't recommend more highly!

We loved this space! Mary Lou and Alan were great hosts - incredibly welcoming, communicative, and hospitable.

The space feels like you're staying in an art gallery and the windows provide excellent morning light. We kept the windows open at night which was the perfect temperature.

The town of Salem was really fun. We only stayed for one night, but would love to be back someday!

Such a great stay! Located in a quiet & lovely neighborhood just a few minutes from all the restaurants, we enjoyed our short stop in Salem. Mary Lou and Alan were excellent hosts and very accommodating. We would definitely stay again!

Mary Lou’s place is my favorite place to stay in Salem. Great views, cute neighborhood, close to restaurants, and she has coffee, yogurt and granola stocked in the kitchen. The little art studio is comfortable and quiet. I always look for her place first!
Mary Lou was a great host!  She's put so much thought into her lovely space. It's beautiful, and just what i needed for my short stay.

We really lucked out finding Mary Lou and Alan’s beautiful loft! They provided wonderful amenities, made us feel very much at home, and it couldn’t have been a more perfect location for our hiking trip. We would love to stay there again!

Mary Lou’s place was exceptional and exceeded our expectations. What a fun place with all of amenities and more. We especially enjoyed the art! The neighborhood was beautiful, peaceful, and close to activities. Our only regret is not being to stay longer! Her place comes highly recommended!

We’d love to keep this wonderful spot a secret but it’s not fair to other travelers.

We have made a second visit and hope for more. This loft is perfect, cozy and filled with artistic charm. The hosts always look for ways to welcome and spoil their guests with little extras in the frig, wine, coffee and essentials that are well stocked and available.

One of our very best and favorite air b&b experiences. But shhhhhh, don’t tell everyone.
The very special opportunity to spend our evening in Mary Lou's art gallery made for a unique and joyful experience during our one-night stay in Salem. We highly recommend.
Beautiful space and close to downtown restaurants. Lovely neighborhood. Amazing hosts!

This is the best Air BnB I've ever stayed in. It was beautiful (used to be an art gallery!) and so thoughtfully prepared - Mary Lou left out detailed lists of recommended restaurants and things to do in Salem (including a free pass to a local art museum), snacks, and everything. Definitely check out the restaurants, they were So Good. There was also a cute little logbook where guests could leave notes and drawings for future guests to read. The loft was spotlessly clean, private, and air conditioned! The bed was comfy, there was a TV with Netflix, wifi, and extra of anything we might need. And to top it all off, Mary Lou and her husband were the nicest people ever! 10/10 would recommend staying here, it was the highlight of our trip.

Tremendously unique art loft in a prime location of Salem Oregon. Mary Lou is a wonderful hostess, and maintains a clean and orderly Art filled unit. I’m sure will use it again in the future. Jim and Brooks

This Airbnb is the best I’ve ever stayed in.  Bed is super comfy, bathroom was small but perfect for my needs with great amenities. The space is light and filled with art but also easy to make dark for slumber.  The design of the loft with moveable panels was SO COOl! Coffee, creamer, granola, tea, yogurt!! And the hosts are just the nicest people ever! I hope to stay again on my next work trip to Salem!!
This space is very unique and comfortable. The location is close to downtown and many amenities. It was a great choice for us while visiting family in the area.

A comfortable, restful, peaceful space. Extremely comfortable bed. It is convenient to downtown and an easy place to stay for business, but I hope to be able to come back sometime when I have more time to just enjoy relaxing there. Very friendly hosts with prompt clear communication. Highly recommended.
Mary Lou and Alan were very friendly  and I'm glad we chose them as hosts! The place was very clean and exceeded expectations.
Great hosts. Very private light and art filled loft. About the best Airbandb I have rented. Has own parking space next to unit.

We found our stay in this beautiful art loft to be magical!  It is everything you see in the pictures and more!  It is equipped with everything you need and even things you didn’t know you needed...like a picnic basket fully stocked with paper products  just waiting to be filled with your favorite picnic foods.  I cannot begin to express just how enchanting and inviting their backyard is...the perfect place to sit and unwind at the end of the day and chill with a glass of wine from one of the local vineyards.  Hosts, Mary Lou and Alan are so genuine and gracious...we enjoyed sitting and chatting about Oregon with them.  The neighborhood is absolutely perfect for morning or evening strolls...such beautiful houses and yards.  The hosts, the loft, the art, the yard, the surrounding neighborhood...perfection!
Beautiful loft in a magical yard that Mary Lou and Alan graciously share with you and whimsical statues:). Thoughtful touches and very user friendly kitchenette set up.
Mary Lou's Art Loft was just as advertised. Elegant and sophisticated space both indoor and out. Conveniently located to the city center and other attractions. We will stay again.

Mary Lou and Alan's Loft is lovely and welcoming.  The space is filled with natural light and the artwork is such a treat and well curated in the space. They were great hosts as well; available and discrete.  There were extra touches: yogurt, granola, coffee, milk and choice of sweeteners. There were also toiletries for emergencies or items forgotten at home. We will be back!
Everything was lovely. This was my second stay, and I'm sure there will be a third.
Fantastic place in Salem - I hope Mary Lou would host me again the next time I'm in town!
A beautiful sanctuary! I can’t see any reason to stay anywhere else. Truly a lovely experience and lovely hosts! Mary Lou’s loft is a beautiful and thoughtfully appointed space.
Awesome!

I stayed here for five nights.  Nights: quiet, soft bed and linens, lovely breezes from well-placed windows.  Mornings: soft light, art-filled walls, wood floors, immaculate little kitchen with coffee and scones, compliments of Mary Lou and Alan. I think I may have dreamed of a loft just like this one.  I walked in through the french doors and all my cares just melted away.  Stay here whenever you can.
Best AirBnB location ever!  Colorful, artful, comfortable, warm, and inviting! We can’t wait to return.
It was like I'd known Mary Lou for years!  My stay was so comfortable and peaceful, not to mention colorful and bright.

What you see in the photographs is just a hint of just how stunning this unique loft is. Wake up surrounded by beautiful artwork in you own private gallery. Not only is it pleasing on the eye ,
but practical as well. Sliding panels mean that you can move the canvas on display to reveal a fully functional, well stocked kitchenette. Loads of local information on file too.

I can't  say enough nice things about the art loft!  It was immaculate, cozy and well stocked with all the comforts of home.  Mary Lou and Alan were gracious and hospitable hosts.  I absolutely loved my stay here and I'd highly recommend it!
This light filled space is so thoughtfully put together.   Mary Lou and Alan have thought of everything.  Do yourself a favor and stay here if you’re ever in Salem.
Beautiful loft with everything you could need. Interesting art, a great layout. Very friendly hostess. Great place to stay for a night or hang out for a week.

Fabulous art everywhere you look! A great respite. Hosts Mary Lou and Alan are gracious, attentive and fascinating people. The space is quiet and convenient to downtown. This is a second stay so that says a lot!

Mary Lou and Alan take great care and pride in their home. The art work was wonderful, the creativity shows, the backyard was a a great place to hang out. Great advise given for eateries, galleries, shops, and general getting around. They give attention to details and will definitely stay here again!!!

Our daughter goes to Willamette in Salem and in the past we have stayed in one of the few hotels Salem offers.  Never again. The loft exceeded our expectations and was less expensive than most hotel rooms in the area. It is well appointed and comfortable.  The bedding was incredibly comfortable and the loft is filled with beautiful paintings. We found ourselves admiring the art often (it feels like a quaint gallery).  The loft sits above their detached garage and is accessible from the alley behind their main house.  It is private yet you have the benefit of having access to the beautiful backyard.  This will be our go to place until our daughter graduates and we will certainly tell other parents about it.
This place books fast! I highly recommend Mary Lou's guest suite, she's thought of everything!

Mary Lou's loft was well appointed, sparkling clean, and with lovely views. Also, she was a great host. I even enjoyed some tea and breakfast items that were provided in the room. I would definitely stay here again.

Mary Lou's place is like staying in the most delightful art gallery. It's inviting, thoughtfully well-appointed, and her care for her guests and their stay at the Art Loft shines through immediately. This is now my go-to place for overnight work trips in Salem.

This marvelous place is like having your own private overnight in an art gallery.  Indeed it doubles as one, but the personal comforts abound to at once give it a very comfortable homey feel. I highly recommend.

The loft was exactly as depicted with ample room for 2 and lots of bright outside light.  Mary Lou offered many tips for meals and walking.  We were within a 5  minute drive to restaurants.  Our stay was lovely.

When we checked in, Mary Lou gave us a very informative tour. We really thought it was great. The dishes were all handmade and so stylish. There were free family passes to a local museum, to name a few things.

This art loft is a beautiful compilation of art and style. The personality of this space is so unique! We loved looking at all the art work. The magazines and books were fun! We had coffee, yogurt, granola and snacks which were so appreciated.

I really loved the quick responses and all the communication. It was so helpful. This place is definitely worth the stay.
A really sweet and comfortable place to stay. It felt good to come home and relax. A truly creative space I recommend to everyone. Worth every penny.
A great location, a very nice space, and a gracious host make this a wonderful place to use as a base when visiting the Salem area.
Loft in beautiful neighborhood with very thoughtful touches.  Artwork and art themes throughout.  Very unique experience blended with the comforts of home.

The best Airbnb I've stayed in so far. Gorgeous minimalist living loft. All the amenities, didn't even have to bust into my travel bag. Open, art, light, and comfort. Provided the perfect oasis in the chaos that is visiting family for the holidays.
Mary Lou & Alan are incredibly warm, welcoming folks who made our stay in the art loft remarkable. HIGHLY recommend this enchanting space!

This is like no other place you have stayed in! Beautiful environment, thoughtful attention to details from warm welcome to delicious snacks, and art to surround and delight you.

Enjoy
I love Mary Lou’s place. I think this is my fourth or fifth time staying here and I always look for it first when traveling to Salem. It is cozy, clean, and private.

Mary Lou and Gramps were great! She greeted us when we arrived, gave us a tour of the space and made sure we knew where everything was. The loft is a gem and has everything you'd ever need, complete with snacks, coffee, tea, extra toiletry items, books, drawing pads and pencils, tv, radio, and a nice view. Her local recommendations for restaurants were spot on and her place is so conveniently located to every store we needed to go. Highly recommend!
2nd time here and had a great stay again!

This place is the perfect combination of cozy and stylish.  The neighborhood is quiet, beautiful, and great for walks.  It’s also just a hop, skip, and a jump from downtown which made is very convenient for my work trip.  Mary Lou and Alan could not have been nicer - they are wonderful hosts.  The bed is uber comfortable and I will definitely look to stay here again if I’m back in the area.

This is a lovely little hideaway in a beautiful neighborhood in Salem.  Mary Lou provides thoughtful touches like fresh flowers, delicious snacks and drinks, comfortable bedding, hints for exploring Salem and surrounding areas, and all the dishes, glassware, etc. you need to serve simple meals.  The loft is superbly furnished, and beautiful works of art decorate the space.  This was our second stay, and we were just as happy with it as the first time.

I’m starting this review on my first day arriving for a 5 day stay because I already know I’m going to have a lot to say, and I don’t want to write a rushed review. I arrived on Easter Sunday. Mary Lou let me check in 2 hours before check in, even though they were totally doing family Easter in the main house. She walked me through the BEAUTIFUL garden to the guest house, and made sure I had everything I needed (including a plate of Easter Sunday lunch <3). I spent the next two hours walking around the neighborhood. I cannot express in words how gorgeous the neighborhood is. I took MANY photos :) I finished the evening on my personal patio, which conveniently sits perfectly in the sun all afternoon until practically sunset. Prefer the shade in the afternoon? Don’t worry, the garden bellow is filled with beautiful shrubs and flowers and comfortable seating. Not to mention the welded metal sculptures and other charming original pieces of art perfectly scatter throughout the foliage. Needless to say, I ended my first night in absolute heaven.

The following days were more of the same. Mary Lou periodically checked on me to ensure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. As days passed, I discovered more tasteful and entertaining special touches. For example, I loved the small jar of color pencils and hardback sketch book for guests to fill with notes and sketches. Of course, I also took many more walks around the neighborhood and neighboring parks (yes multiple. And they’re ALL beautiful).

The apartment was stocked with complimentary snacks and breakfast items. Coffee and tea were also provided. I know this is going to sound strange...but the soap and shampoo was sooooooo nice. The bathroom is also stocked with soft fluffy towels and an array of personal hygiene items. This requires a great deal of attention to detail, but it makes a WORLD of a difference.

I could go on and on about how perfect this experience was for me, but I think I’ve made my point. Stop looking. Book this space. It’s comfortable, beautiful, and unforgettable. <3
Great space and a tremendously accommodating host. Worth a stay even you don’t want to go to Salem
Mary Lou’s beautiful loft is quiet and comfortable. She has left special touches throughout to make your stay more delightful.

This Air BnB has set a new high limit for comparison to other stays. Location is perfect and surroundings feel safe and quiet. The space is very well decorated, the light is perfect and the bed is dreamy.  Mary Lou is also a phenomenal host with quick responses and extra touches everywhere.
Always a great experience.  Three times with the Zeeks.  None better!

The art loft is an inspirational space.  I always request this space when I come to Salem to visit family.  It is beautifully appointed, perfectly located in the prettiest neighborhood in Salem and hosted by two very special people - Mary Lou and Alan.

I reserved this Airbnb for my bestie’s parents and they had SUCH a lovely stay there. They said it was clean and interesting and they loved the patio. They also loved the value. The best compliment, I think, is that they told me I should put my own family up there when they come visit. I will absolutely keep that in mind! Thank you, Mary Lou!
Quiet neighborhood. Gorgeous arts everywhere. Wonderful host. We loved our stay.
Beautiful, artful loft in a quiet neighborhood. Alan and Mary Lou are wonderful hosts. Perfect place for a getaway. We enjoyed the outside space too.
Beautiful location, inside and out! If you love art and lots of windows, this place is for you :) Great hospitality.

The Art Loft is a very lovely place for a couple visiting Salem. The guesthouse is very private and situated in a very nice part of town. It is very bright and decorated very smartly.
We would definitely stay here again.

Mary Lou is a treasure! It was a pleasure meeting her and learning about the art loft as well as Salem. The space is so unique and we really enjoyed staying there. There were so many special touches that made our stay very comfortable. The restaurant recommendations were spot on! Hoping we make it back someday!

Mary Lou has one of the best Airbnb places that I’ve been in. The space is filled with interesting art, bed is comfortable, kitchen convenient. Good location and she is very quick with responses to questions. I’ll be back. I was helping my son move into his apartment and wasn’t able to spend much time at the Airbnb but I would have liked to. It’s a light and airy space, shower is great and she has great amenities. I came down with a cold and she even had a pack of tissues! Highly recommend.

Mary Lou’s place was as great as all the reviews you see on here! Sadly we were in and out and never got to meet in person, but she made us feel so welcomed and available if we needed anything! Would stay here again for sure!
I loved this hidden treasure.  Classy and full of amazing art. A treat for the soul and feast for the eyes.  Mary Lou and Alan have thought of everything!
This little loft is so comfortable, we wanted to move in.
What a beautiful space! Everything about Mary Lou’s loft is outstanding. Lovely place to stay, great location, easy access. Can’t recommend it highly enough!

This little art studio loft casita is truly amazing!  The location is enchanting, in a movie set neighborhood (especially in October) on the gorgeous property of Mary Lou and Alan.  They were very welcoming and provided a truly thoughtful, stylish, unique, practical, and cozy space.  If you have any reservations, put them aside and book this one asap, before it's gone!  :-)

My second time staying at Mary Lou's loft; made a point to stay here again, as my first time was excellent. A great home base to lounge in while visiting Salem, great for dozing or reading a book in peace.

One of my favorite Airbnb experiences to date!! The space was clean, comfortable, and unique. The kitchen area had everything you might need plus extra snacks, coffee, tea and creamers. I have been traveling for work for the past few weeks and this was the best nights rest I’ve had in a long time! I hope to be back!

This place was absolutely perfect for a long weekend in Salem. The space is completely unique with local art and moveable walls that allow you to create a more intimate or homey feel. Mary Lou has wonderful local suggestions for places to visit and was extremely helpful. Overall I can’t rank this place high enough.

Five Stars all the way!  Mary Lou is a fantastic host and goes the extra mile to make sure her guests are comfortable. The space is so stylish and comfortable and Mary Lou pays attention to every detail. You will love the location and all of the little touches.  Mary Lou's communication is top notch so you will know exactly what to expect from the time you book until the time you check out.  This was one of my favorite rentals and I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Salem!
Very neat space. An art gallery and a cute studio rolled into one.
The art loft is beautiful. So charming and comfortable. We’ve returned since our first time here and would stay again. Highly recommend!

This is a wonderful, cozy space with just the right amenities for two.  Mary Lou is a great communicator and helped accommodate our parents who were visiting for the birth of our first child.  Fairmount Hills is a great neighborhood for walks with close access to Bush's Pasture Park and downtown Salem.
Great spot in Salem that has too many small touches to detail, but are all very appreciated. The loft is a very comfortable and stylish space. Highly recommend and would happily return!

Staying at Mary Lou's loft was like living in a private art gallery.  The place is wonderfully stylish, exceptionally clean, and has every detail covered.  The neighborhood is a gem in itself, so be sure to factor in time for some leisurely strolls.  We can't wait to revisit this artists loft!
Great location, very quiet, love the art. Bed is very comfortable and the kitchenette just perfect.
Great little studio. Wonderful artwork and comfortable bed. Would stay here again.
Great location. Cool artwork. And gracious hosts. Perfect for spending a day or a week in Salem.

The art loft was a perfect start to our wine week. The neighborhood is lovely and so much fun for a morning walk if you enjoy architecture and great gardens! The loft itself was the perfect size for a couple - tons of natural light and all the amenities you could hope for. Our hostess was also amazing - she showed us around the place and also put together a picnic basket for us as we wandered around the local wineries. I would absolutely stay here again if we visit the area.

This is a whimsical, magical, cozy and welcoming space.
Very responsive owners.
A pure joy

Roomier than expected, but just as advertised. Lots of windows, great vibe, eclectic art to view. Kitchenette was stocked with helpful items. Loved the picturesque neighborhood with quiet streets & large craftsman houses. Hosts are friendly, thoughtful & helpful, while granting you privacy & autonomy.

I came to town for a weekend of family obligations, and this space was exactly what I needed to refresh my body and mind. It felt clean, welcoming, peaceful, and private. I felt at home there - in an intangible way that I’m finding difficult to articulate. I wish I had more time available in my trip itinerary to rest and refresh there. I hope to be able to stay there again the next time I come to town.

Awesome space with amazing Hosts. After a long trip across the country(from Maryland) finding little for vegetarians in airports. It was a wonderful surprise to arrive at the room and find a fruit basket. We attacked it first thing. The space was perfect and private. Thank you for a great stay.

We sadly did not run into Mary Lou in person, but the apartment was lovely to stay in, full of unique touches both artistic and practical, and really wonderfully located. She was a great host- very responsive and very clear. Highly recommend staying here!
What an extraordinary Airbnb— it was a gift to stay there surrounded by paintings, sculpture and carefully chosen  ceramic pottery. Full of light and a generosity of spirit.
Outstanding communicator that is really interested in making your stay welcome. And, we can’t say enough about how much we enjoyed the Art. This really is staying in an Art Gallery.

This is our favorite air b and b and we can't wait to stay again! Bright, light-filled and such a gorgeous, creative space in Salam! We loved relaxing in the morning in the loft before hiking and exploring the area. Close to downtown (we even walked to dinner most nights) and in a charming neighborhood with such friendly neighbors. I can't say enough good things about Mary Lou and Alan - they were so warm and helpful and added such thoughtful touches to our stay (the homemade granola and snacks were much appreciated!) and really made our visit to Salam special :)

Mary Lou's art-filled loft is a wonderful place to stay in Salem, and it's located in a beautiful neighborhood, which is convenient to many Salem activities.  The loft is very comfortable and had everything we needed, plus the bonus of all of the lovely art.  Mary Lou is friendly and easy to communicate with and made our stay a delight.  I highly recommend her sweet loft.

We came to Salem to celebrate my daughters graduation and The Art Loft was a wonderful stay. The little touches that Mary Lou added made the stay so special. From the fresh flowers to a fridge filled with wonderful surprises.
The neighborhood was beautiful.

Our stay with Mary Lou was nothing short of delightful. Check-in was uncomplicated and hassle-free and the space itself was exactly what we needed. I loved the artwork around the space, the amenities were perfect and the neighborhood was quiet enough that we could get some good sleep. Highly recommend this spot to others looking for a get-away and respite from a busy world. We didn't get to meet Mary Lou in person this time because of our schedules but the communication was extremely timely and helpful and left a great impression, virtually!
Great stay! Easy to get to and very comfortable! 10/10

Mary Lou is a very friendly and kind person, her place is so cute and decorated for anyone who loves art! The neighborhood is very charming in an older historic area. Took a nice walk in evening and felt very safe.  Loft is very centrally located with easy access to interstate and only about 30 minures away from Silver Falls State Park.  Bed was comfortable, and loft had a smaill kitchenette if needed. If you are a larger person, the shower will be a tight fit, we are small so it wasnt a problem.
Wonderful compact place with ideal minimum amenities and beautiful interior art decor. Perfect place for a quiet and resting or in/out schedule lifestyle. Wonderful hosts as well. Thank you - Vijay
Absolutely beautiful. Such friendly and accommodating hosts! This is a hidden little gem full of personality & life.
We had a fabulous stay, it was everything we'd hoped for. The surroundings were comfortable and stylish, very clean and well appointed. Excellent communcation too! Highly recommend!!

Great little loft with all the necessities, comfortable bed, nice kitchenette, sitting area and so much amazing art in the loft and beautiful garden. Close to downtown restaurants.  Also, nice and quiet.

Loft was just as advertised. Relaxing space surrounded by beautiful garden in a nice neighborhood. Mary Lou was very nice and a great communicator.  Shower is kind of small if you're a larger person, but fine for me.

Mary Lou is a great host and we absolutely recommend her place. It’s a 10/10!

It has all the amenities you need and it’s a very close distance to downtown Salem, restaurants, grocery stores, and parks.
We loved every minute and wouldn’t hesitate to go back!

The loft is super cute and comfortable. It's a great location and is a great value for your money. The hosts are excellent. They had snacks and food and well as coffee and even creamer ❤️ It was awesome!
Great space with a great host!
Absolutely adorable loft and we loved our stay! Mary Lou gave great recommendations and we hope to be able to stay here again in the future :)
This art loft is wonderful- the artwork filled space is serene and peaceful. The host is wonderful as well. I will be back!

I don’t think I’ve ever stayed in a nicer place. Surrounded by art on a hill in the trees with every amenity provided. The yard surrounding is stunning. The neighborhood is charming, friendly and walkable. I stayed here two weeks after my daughter and son in law who live a block away had their baby. I took care of them all day. This little bungalow took care of me each night and morning. Mary Lou was so helpful. Her positive energy is an important part of it all.

I found myself saying this place felt magical. This despite a heavy rainstorm. The artworks are special, and I found a book, signed by the author who stayed here, about his climbing Everest. Had to read that!
Will stay again.
The space was beautiful; hosts were charming. The art, inside and outside, was inspiring. We look forward to going back when the whether is warmer so we can hang out in the garden!
A wonderful and convenient location, and a friendly and responsive host. It was great staying at Mary Lou's loft.

Very comfortable and inviting loft space in a quiet and peaceful and walkable neighborhood.  All the interesting art really makes the space special and sets it apart from others. There were many thoughtful touches, including books, coffee, tea, and better than average snacks, to get you started. Hosts are very friendly, welcoming, and responsive. I highly recommend the art loft and would absolutely stay here again.

My wife and I have stayed at the Art Loft several times while visiting family in Salem.  There's nothing not to love about the space, especially if you're an art lover and looking to get a sampling of some of the work of local artists that Mary Lou represents.  Looking forward to our next stay!

This place is an absolute gem. Beautiful, cozy, light filled apartment space with lovely art and a gorgeous yard, fantastic walkable neighborhood, views of the mountains at sunrise, friendly hosts, spotless and well appointed.
