Our stay here was perfect! Christina was friendly and had great suggestions for things to do in the area. Can't say enough good things about this spot!

This was a wonderful short stay on our way to Tacoma.  The home and bed were very comfortable.  I especially liked the art that had positive sayings and loved sharing a room with a piano! Christina's home is vintage and decorated eclectically and her communications were excellent.  We didn't get to meet Christina, but maybe we'll find her home available again.
We enjoyed our stay at Christina's home, a cool Salem home in an old treed neighborhood not far from the capitol. Would definitely stay again.
Awesome decor, comfortable bed, nice lighting, and enough books for a life time.
We booked very last minute. We were tired so we didn't chat with them much, but they seemed like nice people.
Very cool house in family neighborhood.  Good for walking and pets.
Had a wonderful stay here. Very friendly and gracious host. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would happily stay again if I can

Christinas place is located in a wonderful quiet neighborhood but is still super close to the capitol and downtown.

The house is older but they have done amazing things with it to make it feel like the perfect home and we were very comfortable.

Christina was awesome at communicating and extremely flexible with my fluctuating schedule. Her fiance was gentlemenly and gave us the best suggestions on what to do and where to eat.

I'll definitely stay here in future travels.

My partner, dog, and I had a nice stay at Christina's.  We were in town visiting family so just needed a place to sleep. Christina was super prompt in our correspondence which was much appreciated. I noticed that her and her husband were very conscientious of being quiet at night and in the mornings.  Everything was clean and tidy. Will stay here next time we are in town.
Christina's place was a perfect place for my daughter who went down to see her friend's graduation at the university nearby. The place was just as advertised and Christina was a perfect host.
Very welcoming and clean. The communication was great! We're running late and they were very accommodating. It's must stay place while you're in the beautiful Salem. We will be back again!
Perfect!!!

Cozy little character heritage home amongst others in a quiet neighborhood, surrounded by blossoms and old growth trees.  I felt instantly comfortable and welcomed into their home; they were both very accommodating while I was stranded waiting for my vehicle repair.  Peaceful back yard/garden area to sit and enjoy the sunshine. Was about a 20-25 minute walk to the downtown area. Thank you for the lovely stay!
Christina's home is comfie, like visiting a friend...friendly, without requirements for socialization.
Christina was a very kind and accommodating host! Her place was very lovely and quiet. I had a very restful stay.
I only stayed in Salem for one night so I didn't get to see much of the city. But the neighbourhood the house is in is quiet and there are a few restaurants near by.
Room was very nice and within walking distance from the Amtrak Station so it was the perfect place for our trip.
Wonderful, quiet home with everything you could need.

We were on a road trip and booked this very last minute. We are very appreciative that the communication was clear and easy. Check-in was also seamless as it is self-service. Perfect for us who was checking in at midnight.
Close for commuters and in central location.

A lovely little home! I only stayed for one night but the home was tidy with WiFi. There was not a lock on my room door and the hosts had another air bnb guest so I didn't feel comfortable leaving any important items in my room unattended. Otherwise a great stay!
We didn't have the opportunity to meet Christina but she had her basement tenants taking care of checking in/out. It was a nice and smooth stay!
Our stay here was wonderful. It was accurately described on listing and was located in a nice, quaint neighborhood. We would stay here again.

Nice place to stay. Attractive neighborhood of older houses. Nicely decorated with art and vintage pieces.
It's close to Willamette University and the best breakfast restaurant in the world-Word of Mouth.
I had a lovely stay at Christina's place.  Comfortable bed, quiet area, heater available, and a really friendly cat to pet outside(if you're into that).  Thanks!

Very cool spot it was perfect for me because I was right by the door easy access in & out nice really clean bed plus a really awesome cat that loved me & most don't it was a good stay & I would recommend it!
Friendly house! Clean and accommodating. Played the piano in my room and that was AWESOME. The cats are even rad at this house. 2nd stay and I'll always come back :)
Our host was quite delightful and very hospitable our bed was very clean and comfortable we also enjoyed the literature that was around the house thanks so much for having us

Christina's place is centrally located, just 10 min walk from the Amtrak station, restaurants and public transit. A quiet house in a residential area. The place was just what I was looking for on my trip to Salem.
We had a nice time in Salem. We enjoyed a good night's sleep and nice conversations.
Very friendly hosts!
My mother and I had a nice stay at Christina's place. Her and her husband were very kind and accommodating.
Great stay! Christina was a wonderful host. It was the perfect stopover after a long backpacking trip through Oregon.
Great hosts

It was a pleasure staying at Christina's charming home. She responded in a timely manner to my inquiry and any questions that I had. She welcomed my two pups and was gracious to give me a late check out. The location was perfect, just minutes from downtown. I'd highly recommend.
Christina is a great host. She recommended several places for us to go to that were super cool. No a/c but thankfully it cooled off at night.
Christina and Arnaud were fantastic and friendly hosts! They gave us suggestions for places to go and really made us feel at home. Would definitely stay again!
The communication was excellent, bedroom was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay again at Christina's place.

Lovely place, if renting the hole house is ever an option for you I would highly recommend. Otherwise know that this is very much a quiet and respectful shared space. Don't make mess to clean up later, don't expect mess
See previous review
Nice place and great location. Christina and her husband are very friendly and accommodating.

Stayed only one night at Christina's, which was just 2 blocks from where my friends were getting married the next day. Lovely backyard, sweet, walk-able neighborhood, and cool old craftsman.  Christina was welcoming and made me feel right at home.  Great value for the money!
Great hosts, great place, great value!

Great price for good little set up. The location is a very short drive to downtown, the Capital building, etc. The neighborhood is nice and quiet. The house was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is shared, but we were never inconvenienced by that. We were just passing through town so we did not get a lot of time with Christina and Arnaud, but the brief interactions were delightful.

Our favorite part of our visit was all the friendly kitties in the neighborhood.
Quiet place to stay not far from downtown. Simple and easy!
Christine and her husband were very kind. Room was okay for one night.

Darling newlywed hosts, loved their decor and sweet hospitality! Walking distance to anywhere you’d want to go. I was in town for Family Weekend at Willamette... I almost don’t want to share that it was the perfect location as I’d like to find it available again for the University’s events -  lol! I was a Airbnb virgin... this was a fantastic first experience!

Christy and Armaud are good ones. We stayed in the front room. It seemed like a quiet area which is great. Space heater and fan available. It's right by the front door and off the living room, so be okay with sharing space. Nothing fancy, just a bed to sleep on and nice people. Eezy peezy.
Christina is great host, we had really nice stay there, clean, quiet room. Just 10min walk to the train station. Than you...
This is an older home so don't expect much for what you pay

Like a lot of Oregonians, I’m guilty of not checking out our capital city enough. So I booked a two night stay at Christina’s so that I could actually “sightsee” in Salem. Her place is located in a nice historic neighborhood very close to a small university and with easy access to downtown and the river. I know because I both ran and walked between them multiple times. The house itself is very nice and the room cozy. If you’re coming to Salem, check out Christina’s place. You won’t be disappointed!
Really cool house with a lot of character. Room was clean with a nice bathroom.
Cute house in a quaint neighborhood close to Willamette and downtown!
Simple and easy.
Beautiful room and house! I love staying at Christina and Arnaud's home!
Nous avons passé une nuit chez Christina, ils ont été très sympathique avec nous, le quartier est calme. La chambre étais propre mais beaucoup trop encombré et la salle de bain n'était pas propre.
Thank you for being so kind and welcoming!!
Basic room not alot of privacy. But they were very friendly hosts :) cosy, homey feeling home :)

Christina's house is lovely. The whole neighborhood has real charm, and is conveniently located near the Capitol. Cozy bed, friendly hosts, and bear claw tub!  This was my first time at Christina's place, but I've already re-booked for my next trip down to Salem!

Christina & Arnaud are kind and welcoming hosts. Communication was always timely and clear. Their home is a wonderful place to stay in Salem! I loved the piano in the room! I look forward to my next visit.

The accommodations were exactly as described. I had little interaction with Christina as I left early each day and returned late each night, but Christina had everything arranged/supplied for my visit and I could not have asked for anything more.  I will definitely stay with Christina upon my next visit to Salem.

Didn’t get to stay very long at Christina’s, but I got a chance to meet her for a little bit,  super helpful and friendly. I enjoyed my stay, I was comfortable.  Her house has some really cool character to it. I definitely enjoyed it. Would recommend it for sure.
Christina's place reminds me of the Victorian houses in San Francisco. Their place is conveniently located near downtown as well as the hospital. I appreciate Christina and her husband's hospitality.
Great hosts in a great location. Would recommend to others or stay here again when in Salem. Very good experience.

Checking in to Christina's place so easy. Room just as described and we would stay again. Very peaceful and private, yet close to what we needed.  Christina took care to "check in" even while away.  Thank you.
Great stay!  Stayed with this host twice now, and both times were comfortable stays with excellent communication from Christina.
Great spot by a super nice host
Quick and professional with her responses.
The place was great! The owners were extremely accomodating, the room was lovely, and it felt like a cozy home away from home. I love the google map that they designed of local cool spots to hangout!

Christina's place is in a great location if you want to be near the Capitol. She is a welcoming host. I only stayed two nights, but when I mentioned that the bed was pretty soft, she made up a much better for me bed with a firm mattress in another room that did not have a guest that night.
An amazing couple with a beautiful space in a very quiet neighbourhood. I felt welcome, comfortable and at peace. As my first airbnb stay, I was extremely impressed and hope to stay again.
Hospitable, clean, friendly weighed with private, easy to find and safe neighborhood. I would absolutely recommend Christina’s place! She went above and beyond to accommodate a traveler.
Quick, easy and great hosts! Loved that we could use the kitchen and shared spaces. Would stay here again.
Christina’s place is exactly as described, it’s cute and cozy and in a great location in Salem. I would definitely recommend staying here!

Christina's house is a beautiful home that is so easy to love and unwind at! The location is convenient and parking is plentiful. The home is clean and comfortable. Great value!

I would highly recommend!
Beautiful old house, fine room, very comfy
Beautiful home! Great location!
So lovely. The room was quiet and the neighborhood was full of families and children (so I felt safe as a traveling single lady!). Can’t recommend more.
Christina's place was adorable and in a great location. She and her husband were so welcoming and friendly. I really enjoyed my stay and wish I could have stayed longer.

This room was perfect for a quick 1 night stay in Salem! Within a 5 min bike ride to the Amtrak train stop in Salem it was perfectly located to experience all of what Central Salem has to offer. Thanks so much Christina!
Great host and the place was very welcoming. I have a dog and their yard was great to let him play, while we enjoyed the cool weather sitting by the pool area. I highly recommend this place.

Very beautiful house with classic and charming furniture. Close to every monument In Salem. I had to use the Supreme Court library and it was a few steps from the house, also the train station is very close. The hosts were not there but they still cared that everything was alright, Alex the neighbor is a very lovely person, she was very helpful and we had a very nice talk.

I hope to come again and stay for more time.
Great place!

Lovely Craftsman home... so inviting and warm, with lovely touches throughout the house.

Christina made sure to send clear instructions about check-in and had information about Salem and the area on hand.

If you are fine with sharing space with other guests, this is the place for you. Lots of comfy couches in living space.

Christina was always quick to reply to my queries, and I had a chance for a quick chat with her in person, which was lovely. I can't wait to come back, and to have a chance to use the beautiful outdor spaces as well!
We didn't get to meet Christina but she had great communication and was very kind. Everything went very smoothly and we loved staying in their comfortable, cozy home!
Thanks so much for having us and bring a great host.
Check in was super easy, and the host was very organized and welcoming!
Cute Craftsman style home with thoughtful hosts. Perfect for us and our pups!
Amazing place, excellent place and communication with Christina.
great place, would recommend!!

This house is adorable. Beautiful decor. Very homey. It has a great location super close to food, Willamette University, state Capitol, and the convention center. I recommend it to anyone wanting to visit Salem.
This place was a really good value.  I would recommend it to anyone that needs to stay in Salem.
The bed is a futon but it was an easy check in and an easy drive from Portland on our way to the trail of 10 falls. Great for the price

房东很好。
房子特别有艺术感，住着也舒服。
非常干净整洁，房东特别热情，我们聊了好多关于旅游计划。

房东提供了旅游的好多意见
强烈推荐给大家。
The hosts were very friendly and helpful.  The room was perfect, comfortable and on a quiet street.  We had everything we needed.
Homey, friendly, very enjoyable stay. I loved it! I will definitely stay there again next time I need to be in the Salem area.
Great place!
Great place to stay for the money. I axtually think it is better than many cheaper motel rooms. Very easy to message and great response time. Would use anytime in Salem
Sweet house and Christy very good about communication. Comfortable stay and as described.

This place is worth going to over anything else in Salem. I am actually a Salem native that is up here visiting family. Living in LA and driving up here is difficult. Family and friends unfortunately didn’t have a place for me to stay. Hotels were over 80 dollars a night with tax. I looked to Airbnb but the problem was a lot of places are too Far East in Salem or grungy looking and bloody expensive. This home is in a decent part of town, close to downtown. It’s old, but not so old that things are out of date. It’s a beautiful house and check in was a breeze. The husband was super accommodating and allowed me to stay late to get my laundry done. It felt like not only was I in my hometown, but I was visiting another friend or family member. Everyone, including other guests were super kind. The bed is a little firm, but I dig it. I slept very well. The old-style shower was definitely fun. Towels and linens were clean and available. I will definitely stay here again the next time I’m in salem visiting family. Trust me when I say I’ve looked at other Airbnb’s in the area and nothing else can beat this one for the price.

This Airbnb was sweet surprise, though given our communication with Christy beforehand, we expected it to be great. Both Christy and her husband are very accommodating and generous. The house is comfortable, the location perfect for us.

Christina has all the details covered, just look around at all the signage that explains all the possible questions we could have. This was our first Air BNB experience, so we weren’t sure what to expect, but we’re hoping future trips are this great and thought out. She was great at communicating the details and made her home feel like our home. Highly recommended.

The room was very  comfortable and hosts  very friendly.  I was surprised on how close to town it was and some great places to eat. Make sure you try    Word of Mouth    great breakfast and only a short walk
Christina and Armand were delightful and responsive hosts.
Was such a lovely home to stay in. Christina and her husband were very welcoming and felt 100% comfortable. Definitely worth staying in anytime!

If you need a place to stay in Salem you can’t beat it for the price. Nice comfortable bed with clean linens. Shared bath- shower a little small (claw foot tub) and awkward, but lots of hot water and very functional.
All and all a great deal..... I’ll be back!

Description of the room is as written.  In addition, this older home is full of character and is located in a safe, quiet, walkable neighborhood of unique older homes. The hosts are awesome: friendly, articulate, well-traveled, engaging, helpful. Arnaud works from home, so was here to greet me and give me an orientation upon arrival, which I appreciated greatly.
I enjoyed staying here so much that I extended my stay.

Nous sommes arrivés tard et nous n’avons pas eu la chance de rencontrer nos hôtes.
Néanmoins, la chambre était agréable et conforme à la description.
Great place close to State Capitol and Willamette University. Cozy home with lots of charm - recommend!
Great place! I met Arnaud during my one night stay. Check in was easy, I slept great, and the place was immaculately clean. I highly recommend.
Christina was quick to respond, and a great host in the short time I stayed at her home. The room was clean and the house was easy to get into and check out of. Highly recommend!
Good place to stay even for a single night
Really cute place also very friendly host.
Very close to the State offices, etc.  Clean, easy, was just there one night but everything went smoothly.
I enjoyed getting to know the host. We had similar interests. It was a very comfortable and creative home.
Wonderfully cozy home and a really convenient location!
Great hosts, friendly, communicative.   Clean space with excellent location.
Christina was a fabulous host! Loved the hospitality, area, and welcoming home!

A beautiful home in a great location. The house was warm, immaculate, and decorated with fun art. Christy and Arnaud are fantastic hosts! Had a great time listening to music, eating,
and having wonderful conversations. I hope to visit them again!

Christina was very easy to communicate with and gave plenty of information for us. Check in and out was a breeze. I'd definitely recommend staying here, as it was very affordable for the location and for a private room.
Outstanding hospitality. A bit older home. Other than squeeky floors the place is graet.

Quiet setting in nice neighborhood close to downtown.  Guest room with nice street view yet private feel.  Well organized layout in lovely craftsman style house.  Lots of care about providing information about everything from household guidelines to WiFi to city amenities. Christy and Arnaud were friendly and fun to talk with.   I felt at home there, will happily revisit and recommend to friends.
Darling house in a great location, easy parking and check-in, hospitable and friendly hosts; could not have been nicer!
Great hospitality, if I’m ever in the area I’d stay definitely stay again!
Brief stay. Very pleasant. The piano and music books were a special touch.
Christy was super friendly.  Check-in was easy and the room was comfortable.  Nice neighborhood and a beautiful house.
Great place to stay! Will definitely stay again when I’m in the area. Hospitality was great!

Welcoming, easy going and responsive hosts. Although I was having issues with the app, Christy and Arnaud were very quick to connect and help me have all the information I needed. I didn’t use the kitchen as I had commitments elsewhere. Bed and bathroom were clean and welcoming. Nice notes about the house share info to help you make yourself at home. Bedroom I stayed in was at the back of the house not the one pictured. It was nice to be on the east side of the house in the morning. Lots of windows to let light in when you want it and curtains to keep it out when you don’t. I enjoyed my stay and would stay again!
No complaints.
great host. good price. would stay again
A cozy, clean house that made for a wonderful stay! The hosts were extremely welcoming and ensured comfort. Recommend to all others!
Beautiful back bedroom
A really interesting house and lovely hosts who make you feel at home right away.
A lovely space and very comfortable. Wish the weather had been nicer so I could enjoy the fire pit in the yard. Next time!
Great comfortable, homey, friendly place. I enjoyed talking with Christy & Arnaud and hope to stay here again.
Great place, great location, great folks. Tough to beat on all three counts. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
Great private space and very clean and accessible shared spaces. Looking forward to staying with them again!
Great folks and nice homey place.
Great
Had a great experience. Their air bnb is close to downtown. I was able to do many things on foot. Both Christy and Arnaud are on point with communication, room is tidy, over all welcoming.
Very comfortable, great value
Great location, nice room, lives up to photo.   Very comfortable..
Amazing price when I needed a last-minute place in Salem. Cute home.
Great hosts and wonderful older old with lots of nice touches that made our stay very comfortable.

Christy and Arnaud's home is conveniently within walking distance of downtown. Their home is peaceful and pleasant, and I'm sorry I didn't wasn't able to spend more time there. They are communicative and I appreciated that they were flexible with my check-in time. And their dog is especially friendly! I regret that I could not stay longer and play with him!
Nice location, easy walk to Willamette U. and the state capitol building.
Wonderful place to stay in with great character. Very much recommended.

I was in for a pleasant surprise to see a lot of archaic stuff at the home, this was truly special and unique experience. Christy and Arnaud are great hosts and very friendly. It was like home for me.
Great people, great location.  Place has a neat old time vibe.  I love how they have renovated, but kept the original feel.

Christy and Arnaud were fantastic hosts! The room, bathroom and house were sparkling clean and the check in process was easy.
Thanks again!

Christy & Arnaud's place was perfect for my stay! Although it was short, I felt very welcome and at-home. Arnaud was there to greet me and I was able to meet their lovely puppy, Otter. The bedroom, bathroom and house overall was clean and met all my needs.

Check-in was smooth and communication was great. They are wonderful hosts and know what they are doing so you know you will have a nice stay. I appreciate that there was a lock on the bedroom door as they had other guests in the home so I felt even more secure. Most importantly, the bed is comfy and the blanket was SUPER COMFY which was nice after a long day of exploring... I need to get myself a blanket like that!

Thanks again, Christy & Arnaud!
Highly recommended, it was a great stay!
Hosts are among the coolest and nicest people we have ever met. They are so accommodating and easy to speak to.
A nice and clean house in an easy to access location
This was a great stay for me. Great location, awesome communication, and an adorable old house. Incredible value, I’m happy I chose it!
This place had great value! We didnt find the bed comfortable but for one night it was ok. Christy and Arnaud were super friendly and generous with their space!
A delightful and charming place to stay!  Lovingly decorated with so much attention to detail. Great communicators, clear and prompt in their replies and assistance.  Two thumbs up.

Christy and Arnaud are extremely hospitable. They allowed us to use their washer and dryer as well as their kitchen. They were so gracious. They even let us take our bikes off of our car to chain up to a tree in their backyard just to be safe.
Christy and Arnaud’s place was super clean and stylish! We loved our stay there, will come back for sure! ☺️
Very good value and polite hosts.
Great value for a quick stay. Highly recommended!
Convenient access to freeway and very responsive hosts.
Great location with welcoming hosts. Room was comfortable and clean. Thanks so much for hosting us!

This house reminded me of a youth hostel for adults where everyone gets their own room. Comfortable, and clean. Christy and Arnaud were friendly and with the other guests made for interesting conversation. I would definitely return.
As someone who has co-hosted an Airbnb in the past, I was incredibly impressed with Christy & Arnaud’s space. Perfectly suited my needs and all communication was so clear. Thanks guys!

This is a great little spot. The hosts are super friendly/helpful and their dog is wonderful. The room has a ton of character and we honestly wish we could’ve stayed more days in Salem as the house was just that good.
5/5 a great place to rest your head. Christy and Arnaud are very friendly and are great hosts. They have a labradoodle that is very friendly if you like dogs. The room is just as described.
Awesome Hosts n place suggest anyone that comes Salem for visit
My Airbnb stay was just a passing on by type of stay. It was such a nice space in a lovely home!
Lovely home, lovely people, very helpful and hospitable. Made us a fire, totally let me butt in the kitchen and cook, had s’mores with us :) We had a great time
We really enjoyed staying here! Easy to get to and check-in. Had access to bathroom and kitchen with no problems. Lovely space and people. We would definitely stay here again.
Great hosts and great place!! Had really nice time at their house! Highly recommended!!
It was a pleasant stay
Clean quiet stylish classy old house. It was perfict for good clean working class like I was hoping for. Gr8 for me because I like my privacy....
This is such a sweet, charming and quaint place to stay. The owners are extremely responsive, pleasant and caring.
Second time here, a great spot when staying in Salem.
A welcoming, easy abnb stay with a great location and hosts

El alojamiento esta cómodo para acceder desde la carretera, habitación en la parte frontal de la casa, con un futon muy cómodo, muy recomendable. Y Christy y Arnaud se desviven por conseguir que te sientas como en casa, muy recomendable
It’s a quaint little place with a cozy bed that was a great place to rest our heads after a long day of wedding festivities. Would definitely use again, especially for the price!
With Christy and Artaud we had a good time during our stay nice and interesting chat. Great hospitality and very well treated. The house is cozy place where to stay.
My stay was very enjoyable. I appreciated the easy check-in and quick response. I would absolutely book again here as well as recommend this place:)
Amazing place. Quiet neighborhood and extremely clean. Great communication and very flexible and understanding. Highly recommend

Das Haus von Christy & Arnaud ist sehr hübsch. Es liegt recht zentral in Salem und ist sauber & gemütlich. Wir waren nur eine Nacht da, aber es war ein netter Aufenthalt. Ein besonderes Dankeschön an Christy für Ihre tollen Tipps für unsere weitere Reise! Jeder Zeit gerne wieder!!

This is an amazing couple. Very kind and sweet. There dog is so cute and friendly! They had great suggestions for things to do in terms of attractions and food. They really make you feel at home and that you’re not invading one bit! Make yourself at home here and relax!
Close to downtown Salem. Great Hosts. Quiet neighborhood
I just needed a place to stay for the night, and this home was perfect!  The price was right, it was clean, easy to check in, quiet, a great place to sleep!
What a lovely house - character and personality everywhere. Communication was great. Christy and Arnaud are welcoming and have cultivated a sweet home with Otter the pup.
Looking forward to my next stay! Great location and easy access to Willamette U. and the Capital. Christy and Arnaud have been great.
Another great stay with Christy and Arnaud. They are considerate and open. This makes my workweek commute so much better!
A warm and homey, well decorated, comfortable home.

This was my first time staying in an Airbnb and my experience was amazing! I also had my 7 month old lab with me and him and otter had a blast. The home is so cute and unique I really felt at home. Thank you so much.
The place is nice, clean, and cozy. There wasn’t a TV in my room so it was a bit disappointed, but other than that, everything was good. Hosts are nice and friendly!

Ok, first of all location. You cannot get a better location - it takes 15 mins lovely walk to downtown. Then there’s the house - so charming, 1925 Craftsman. Super cute and excellent amenities. Then there are Christy and Arnaud - they are the most generous people you could stay with. They went out of their way to make me feel at home and show me areas of Oregon I wouldn’t have otherwise get to see. Their dog is super lovely too!
If your travelling in Salem with a dog and looking for an AirBnB then Christy and Arnauds is one of your best bets.
It's a charming old house with a nice personality. It's quiet. Quick response made my last minute reservation easy.
Amazing place to stay! The host is very nice and friendly. The house is clean, warm and cozy.

The home is warm and inviting, with a location that has easy access for getting around Salem and the surrounding areas.  The hospitality was fabulous.  Christy and Arnoud were easy to reach if I needed anything and kept me informed about any other guests that would be staying there.
Comfortable bed
Quiet comfortable Place located near to almost anything.
My stay was very comfortable, I felt at home getting to meet their sweet dog and give the chickens a visit.
We enjoyed our stay at Christy and Arnauds home. It’s a perfect place to catch a nights rest. Close to town and they were wonderful hosts!
Christy and Arnaud are great hosts! They offer a fun place to stay at a great rate!
Cute room, lovely hosts, ideal location - thank you Christy and Arnaud!
My stay was so peaceful & valuable! Positive vibes & clean atmosphere!
Amazing Airbnb better then you could expect !!!! I highly recommend booking with Christy and Arnaud if you get the opportunity. Thanks guys for and amazing experience.

Awesome Airbnb. My stay here was even better then I could have expected !!! Would strongly recommend booking this Airbnb if you get the chance. You can’t go wrong. Thank you guys for the wonderful experience. I look forward to the next time.

The low price makes this an attractive place to stay. If you only care about saving money, it's a good choice. The place is aesthetically pleasing and in a convenient neighborhood. It was not sparkling clean, despite reviews. Maybe it was just the day I was there, but the floors were dirty in the bedroom and bathroom. Also lots of neglected areas with heavy dust.

I hadn't read the listing closely enough, and didn't realize how many guests could be there with one bathroom. There were three rooms and four guests with one bathroom, which only created mild inconvenience. There is a large dog on the property, and he came into my room. Also, another guest had a dog with her. Just good to know if you don't want dogs around.

The main reason I didn't give a better review is because the host contacted me the day I was to arrive and asked if I would switch rooms because another guest was staying for longer than I and would have to switch rooms mid-stay unless I gave her my room. I had intentionally chosen the room I did, but I felt uncomfortable saying no, knowing that I was putting someone out. I didn't answer right away, and then the host contacted me and said never mind, I should stay in the room I chose. But then I arrived at the house at the same time as the other guest and felt awkward not offering to switch. I did, and she was very grateful. The room I ended up in was fine, but the whole experience felt strange. I told the hosts that in the future they should throw an incentive in if they ask people to switch.

Because of the dirty floors and communication, I won't book again. If you just want cheap and convenient, it's a great find.

Wonderful hospitality, fantastic location, unique home - and i loved the back yard! I have a service dog who rarely gets to be off leash when we travel. Christy and Arnaud were accommodating and kind - and their dog was a joy! They were very responsive. I will return. Thank you!
Awesome host and very nice place to stay for it's value. Amazing back yard with a beautiful flower tree. Definitely will stay again

If this place is available, don’t hesitate. Probably one of the best spots you will find. The hospice in this home was awesome, and definitely cool people to talk to. Also they have the coolest dogs!!
worth the visit and the stay. very respectful and peaceful. also very affordable

Great place to stay, easy to find, and a wonderful value! Although we only stayed one night, it was a very pleasant, comfortable experience! Communication was great, Christy let me know there would be other guests during our stay and was very thorough in explaining how to check in upon our arrival. Fresh towels, clean linens, and a cozy room are what you can expect during your stay as well. I definitely recommend a stay here and would stay again!
Fantastic value and communication.
Great place in a nice location Christy and Arnaud are very responsive
Very friendly hosts.
Friendly couple.
Still friendly.
Excellent place to stay—affordable, clean, convenient!
Great spot and very accommodating hosts!
Comfortable stay! Christy was responsive and the room was very clean.
Great hosts and great value for the price. We really enjoyed our stay here.
Excellent experience. Beautiful, restored historic Craftsman home. Friendly hosts. What I used to love about Airbnb! The hosts went way out of their way for me, many thanks.

Thus place is great. excellent communication, friendly hosts. welcoming and very clean space. it was me, my husband, our 2 year old daughter and our dog. Room fits a pack n play perfectly! Thanks Christy!

My room accommodations were very clean and comfortable. The neighborhood was very clean and quiet, I got to see a lot of it on my morning run. And I had a chance to Sit and visit with the homeowners as well and they are wonderful people. All in all I would say don’t hesitate to book if you’re looking for a place in Salem.
Christy and Arnaud are very nice people, super kind, and friendly. The place  is awesome, super clean and organized, love their plants and dogs. Very recommended.
Awesome place with lovely hosts and two adorable dogs. I will definitely stay here again :)
Incredible stay. Very clean, easy and perfect communication. House is very comfortable and welcoming with lots of plants and art. Highly recommend.
Second stay here in the other gust room, another excellent n' smooth night, still highly recommend this place!

I was delighted with this AirBnb experience! Christy was very accommodating allowing me to stay an hour longer.  Her home was centrally located, clean, offered what was stated, and was definitely a bargain.  There were signs throughout the areas I stayed in, making it easy to navigate.  I definitely would stay there again.

Christy was super nice. My queen bedoom was spotless, the mattress firm and comfortable, bed nicely made, maybe fragrance free laundry soap was used because I got no headache, slept like a happy baby. I didn't need heater or fan but both were available.

I'm middle of the road on the sensitivity scale to chemicals. If you are more sensitive, bring your own fragrance free bath soap.
Charming house, friendly hosts and funny dogs
Beautiful home! The yard is a good size for if you have a pup with you. King bedroom was absolutely massive and had plenty of space for a couple and their things
Will continue to come back here when I need a place to stay
10/10 would recommend! Christy is a great host which made it easy for a first time user of airbnb.

Clean, comfortable, and an excellent value. Wonderful hosts. Great location in Salem.
This is a must place to come if your looking for a relaxing com place to lay your head down. You’ll love the vib of this old style home lots of plants to set the tone of your arrival
Excellent value, for a lovely stylish craftsman home, great hosts, relaxed, friendly, most comfy bed

Such a bargain, the bedding is nice and cozy,  the communication is great, and they are a friendly couple with some awesome dogs. House is very clean, as is the room i stayed in. I appreciated the way they set up check in and check out and how courteous they are to their guests.
Great Value!
Loved it here. Quiet and plenty of street parking. Old, charming and yet everything you need. Close to everyone and everything I needed.
Christy and her husband are wonderful host. Their place is nice old house in good quite neighborhood

Christy's place is very cleaned and beautifully remodeled. I enjoyed my short stay and highly recommend it.
It was a pleasure staying with Christy. Their house is in a quiet, pleasant neighbourhood and we were provided with everything we needed. Thank you for hosting us.
The house is dated. But, considering the price, cleanliness and the vibe of the house and the neighborhood, I can recommend it.
I’ve stayed here twice while on a quick business trip to Salem. Location is great for the value! The room is nice and the hosts are prompt on answering guests.
Wonderful place all around.
Perfect stay.  Hosts Christy and Arnaud are welcoming and accommodating. Their home is comfortable and quiet. A real treat.
Beautiful living room!
Christy’s place is so comfortable and she really makes you feel welcome. She takes the time to talk to you and has wonderful local suggestions.
This was the perfect stay. Very hospitable hosts and really kind. I would stay again!
Nice and friendly.

Christy’s home and her pets are amazing!!! The room was super clean and very welcoming. I have no complaints. This was a perfect stay!

I feel so lucky my daughter and I had the opportunity to stay at Christy’s Airbnb.  It’s affordable and in a great location close to restaurants, stores, downtown Salem, Bush Garden, Willamette River, etc. I want to stay there again in the near future to visit Silver Falls Park. The house is clean, quiet and the room is just as advertised.  I spoke with Christy who seems very friendly.  Her and her husband Arnaud are very great with communication. The backyard has an above ground swimming pool that looks very clean and ready to enjoy.
This was a lovely and charming stay
The room was very clean and quiet, Christy and Arnaud were super nice and made sure I had everything I needed.
Just what you need for passing through. Very nice and a good spot.
There house was clean quiet and comfortable.

Christy and Arnaud are fabulous hosts and their home is delightful! The house is on a gorgeous tree lined street. I had a comfortable and cozy stay at their place. Really a quite suburban home where you can stay for the night and have a god sleep.

Great place to stay.
A cozy location and room, and Christy and Arnaud were very accommodating and friendly. Really recommend this room to anyone who is staying in Salem.
Great Craftsman home in Salem.  Neighborhood is close to downtown and neat.  The home is great, cool AC even during the hot day.  I would stay again.
Staying one night in Christy's apartment was beautiful! We had everything we needed in our room and could even use the kitchen. The garden and the dogs are absolute highlights!

Really nice place to spend the night. Christy gave us good traveling tips. We enjoyed our stay at her house. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. Thank you for letting us stay!!
This was my second time staying here and I was equally happy to be here. A great room/house and great people.
Although I was only a short guest at Chrissy's, I felt extremely comfortable. My hosts were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and cosy. Would recommend Chrissy as a host anytime
Great place to stay! Clean, description is accurate, and beautiful houseplants to admire!
Beautiful, peaceful, serene. 10 times better than any hotel! Simple, clean, and lovely.
The house was nice and the owners of the house were decent aside from not seeming to care that my girlfriend fell & hurt her foot in a ditch near the curb where they have a sign in the ground.
Great stay for a night on our way to Crater Lake. Spacious room!

Loved everything about this place!  Totally reasonable price, so inviting, I would have eaten the soup I was offered upon arrival but I had my heart set on Mexican food. Definitely staying here again the next time I find myself in Salem.
Great location, great ease of check-in, great value. I’ve stayed at this location in the past before this trip, and I’ll stay again in the future whenever I can.
Very friendly hosts, cute home! Very thorough notes/instructions kept around the house.

Great place, very good value! Clean and quiet. Host provides detailed instructions for guests, and is helpful and promptly communicative too - truly the best of what AirBnb is all about.  Exactly what I needed for a peaceful night's sleep. Comfortable bed in a tastefully-decorated room in a lovely old house.  I will happily stay again anytime!
Cute house with lots of character and the most comfortable bed! I had the best nights sleep.
Cute, quaint and comfy!
Great clean room! It was fairly close to everything we wanted to explore in the area. The hosts were very kind and friendly :)
I enjoyed my stay at Christy‘s. It was clean, quite and the location was perfect for me.
I've stayed with Christy several times. The location is great and the accommodations and clean and comfortable. Great host!

Great AirBnb.  Christy and Arnaud are excellent hosts.  I asked Christy where I might store my bike and she immediately put it in a locked storage area.  I also appreciated the specific directions to the their place.  For reasons I do not understand the AirBnb G Maps  interface sent me to the wrong location. Arnaud's welcome message let me know others had also experienced location problems so I knew to put their address directly into G Maps.  It then gave me the proper directions.  Would be happy to stay there again!

What a beautifully decorated space! It was close to everything we needed. The hosts were very accommodating to my needs, and had signage around the house to help me locate all the essentials. I felt safe and couldn't have asked for a better airbnb. Would wholeheartedly recommend!
This is a beautiful home. I felt safe (which is important as a solo traveler) and comfortable through my stay. I enjoyed chatting with the hosts and petting their sweet dogs.
Very comfortable stay for the night! Thank you Christy!
amazing experience
A great place to stay for a night.

Christy and her husband Arnault 's hosting was excellent; from their tasteful decorated home/space, to a comfortable room /bed,  clean and great spacious bathroom. Great place!

Christy and Arnaud have a great place set up for any travelers needs. The location was perfectly close to all things down town Salem. The dogs made our stay extra homey, and our hosts gave us plenty of suggestions for great local spots in town.
great central location. the bed and pillows were so comfy. definitely would stay again

The room was great, the bed was soft and the room was decent sized.  I was alone so I got to spread out and take up the entire bed. This room and the shared areas in the house were fantastic. Thank you so much for the smooth check-in and checkout process.

nice cozy place to stay. feel right at home and i like the paintings on the wall. Recommend stay; i’ll come back for sure

Christy’s place was comfy, inviting, and very cute. The decor was very homey which instantly made us feel at home.

Easy to get in, the hosts were flexible with our last minute booking. Quiet spot, cute and safe neighborhood. Extremely comfy bed.

Thanks for having us!!

I did not get to stay there as the host had to cancel due to an emergency but the host did inform me on time and I was able to make contingency plans. the host did offer me a free stay for the night should I ever decide to return there and I was extremely pleased to hear that and was not expecting it though but they were very thoughtful with that. great service so I will look forward to my stay there in the future. would highly recommend this host to anyone and everyone.
Beautiful and clean place to stay. The hosts were great as well. Very close to everything you need, stores, restaurants,  I5. I will be back, thank you

Lovely room and beautiful restroom. Definitely will recommend staying here again!

Clear instructions, a welcoming-but-privacy-respecting host, a very comfy bed, a heavenly shower, and good coffee — everything I crave as a weary traveler! Plus access to a kitchen and lovely porch! If I’m ever in the area again I would hope to visit Christy’s place again.
Great stay! Thank you for your hospitality!
We had a pleasant stay in Christy’s charming home. There was a full kitchen, nice living area, nice bath. Would recommend for anyone visiting Salem.
Very clean, charming place close to the Capitol and downtown Salem.

Stopped here overnight and it was perfect. Super clean and they have a beautiful home. So many pretty house plants and a really cute front porch area with a daybed and books

Jean is a lovely host. Her home is beautiful, carefully and artistically appointed, clean and bright. It is obvious that Jean takes care to provide for the comfort and convenience of her guests. The location is ideal. Close to downtown, the University, the Capital. This was my second stay with Jean and certainly not my last. The property and the host are "super."

Jean was very responsive during the booking process and extraordinarily welcoming when I arrived. Besides the property being better than described, Jean was nice enough to have a batch of freshly baked oatmeal chocolate chip cookies on the table for guests. They were amazing. I wasn't able to take advantage of the bicycles she offered, but there's always a next time.

This is the place to stay if you're bike riding through the area. Host has a bike stand and tools in a secure shed for storage. Also she has a wealth of local bike knowledge, and décor to match :) The outside garden is a paradise of shade to relax in. I appreciated the separate entry and in-room bathroom. Plus a parfait for breakfast!

This turn of the century house is a great place to go back in time to fir and oak floors, old rocking chairs, oval rugs, really quaint. Great period furnishings with modern mixed in. Relaxing. We will visit again when in Salem.
Nice, spacious and clean place. Highly recommend.
Very accomidating. Great experience!

This is a lovely old house in a great location with easy access to the things we wanted to do while in Salem. Jean is a great host that takes pride in her home and the care she shows her guests. A long time Salem resident, she is knowledgeable about the area and willing to help with information. If you are looking for a quiet restful place this is it. No TV, just conversation with your host or fellow guests.

This was our second stay with Jean in her beautiful home. She is a gracious host and attended to our needs like we were family. A peaceful quiet retreat within walking distance of downtown. We would definitely stay again when next we are in Salem.
She made me feel very welcome I was quite impressed with her house. She made the best breakfast

Very clean and updated 1912 house in downtown Salem, within walking distance of eateries, parks and other points of interest. Jean's house has tall evergreens on three sides that lend privacy to bedroom windows. We left windows open all night. It was lovely.

We stayed in the Cedar room.  It was clean, beautifully decorated and had it's own private bathroom.  There were beautiful sitting areas, a desk with stationary, a couch, a table and chairs, all with plenty of lighting.  Outside the room, there was a shared living area and a small kitchen with a refrigerator and dishes, coffeemaker, etc.  There is no air conditioning, but it was cool weather so we were comfortable with the windows open.  There is some road noise, light sleepers might want to choose a room toward the back of the house.  Jean was absolutely delightful as a host.  She was attentive, and wonderful company.  She fixes a continental breakfast included, or a full breakfast for a very reasonable price.  This was a true BnB experience.  We will definitely stay here again!

If you are coming to Salem, look no further - this is the best place in the city. I recently relocated from the DC area, and Century House became my home away from home - literally - for my first three weeks in Oregon. I cannot say enough good things about this place! Location, cleanliness, warm and inviting space, quick response time, fantastic host, Century House has it all - and to top it off Jean makes delicious home-cooked breakfasts every morning that can't be beat!

I had the good fortune to try out two rooms during my long stay, the Maple Room and the Cedar Room. Both were great, although there are a few differences between them. The Maple Room has air conditioning, while the Cedar Room does not, so that's something to keep in mind if you are coming during summer. The Maple Room has a bathroom right next door that is quite spacious. The Cedar Room has a smaller en-suite bathroom, with a sink in the bedroom. If you are someone who is sensitive to road noise, be advised that the house is on a busy street and there are dogs next door that like to bark a lot. It did not bother me, but if that is a concern for you I think the Maple Room was a little more insulated. The kitchenette is available to both rooms and is equipped with a coffee pot, small fridge, microwave, and two-burner hot plate sufficient for boiling water. There is a cute dining room adjoining the kitchenette and Jean always leaves homemade cookies there that are so tasty.

Not only is Jean an amazing host, during my stay she became a good friend. She went above and beyond, from allowing me to check-in very late, to upgrading me to the Maple Room when it was really hot outside, to driving me downtown when I didn't have transportation, to storing my luggage when I was traveling. She's also a very good Scrabble player! If you are a cyclist, you are in for a treat because Jean is passionate about the sport and knows all of the trails and places to go. I also really enjoyed the breakfasts, which were always something new each day, and it was fun to have the opportunity to meet the other guests and chat with them. Stay at Century House - you won't regret it!

My husband and I stayed here with our 22 month old toddler and had a wonderful stay, I am truly grateful I found this home. Jean is a gracious host and made us feel so welcomed. She loves children and it shows in the extra touches she adds to the room. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to any family.

Jean's hidden gem was delightful!  I find myself in Salem for work and chose Cedar Room just because of its proximity to my meeting location.  I ended up being spoiled for 3 days!  Breakfast was amazing - so much thoughtfulness and care.  I enjoyed getting to know and a fellow guest over coffee each day and check in - late at night!  Was a breeze.  I cant wait to return to the area to explore a bit more and will definitely stay at Century House when I do.  Can't recommend Jean's hospitality enough!

Jean is a wonderful host and the home is very comfortable.
Walking distance to downtown and a number of other sites.
Jean is a superb host of an immaculate, well-furnished, restored, historic, classic Willamette Valley farmhouse. Easy drive into downtown. Great breakfast!

Jean is wonderful host and was very welcoming during our stay at her home.  The room we stayed in had lots of character with all the modern facilities we needed.  The centre of  Salem is a short gentle stroll (30 minutes) from the property.  We will certainly stay again when we are back in the area.
A nice place .Thank you very much.

Jean was a wonderful host and had all sorts of thoughtful touches throughout her place.  She was very quick with a response any time I had a question.  She served a great breakfast and even asked about my dietary restrictions from the beginning which was such an added bonus!  I will definitely stay there again.

Jean was a fantastic host - very accommodating as we got in late. She responds quickly to messages and has a lovely home that was immaculate.  We wouldn’t hesitate to stay again or recommend her place to others.
The place is lovely and very clean. Jean is a gracious host and treated me to a great breakfast over interesting conversation! Hope to be back soon!
One of the best B&Bs I've stayed at. I absolutely recommend Centennial House. Jean was just the best. Many thanks.

One of the most charming, beautiful airbnbs. Jean Your host Jean is a person of artistry, kindness and it shows in her beautiful home and the rooms for her guests. She is Your comfort and safety is foremost and she takes extraordinary care to care of the guests facilities. It was a pleasure and I will happily return to visit as her guest again.
Jean is the best host I’ve ever met.
A wonderful place! The room was private, clean, and spacious. I also appreciated the easy walking distance to downtown Salem. And the complimentary breakfast was lovely, as well!

If you’re staying in Salem, look no further than the Century House. Jean is easily the best host we’ve ever met. She is just so lovely - from giving us a tour of the space to checking in with us throughout our stay, she was so communicative the entire time. Jean is also just so incredibly kind, a truly wonderful person to be around. The house itself is great, with a few common areas and a small kitchen for guests. Opt for breakfast - Jean makes fantastic baked goods and will leave a whole assortment of goodies for you! Overall, you can’t go wrong if you stay at the Century House!
Close to Willamette, clean and comfortable.
Will absolutely be my go-to when visiting Willamette. Wonderful host, great space and very convenient location.
Good place to stay. Host provides good house supplies. Cute decorations and comfortable rooms.
Great location, quant and cozy cabin in the heart of Salem. I would stay here again!

We booked this apartment based on it’s proximity to where our family lives in Salem.  Communication was friendly, and the check in/out process was quick.  Not very clear with instructions, though... as the code changes each day, so the check out code is different from the check in code, but we had a quick response from the manager to get a new code.    We also were granted an earlier check time, but we ended up not needing it.  The flexibility was much appreciated, though.  The bedrooms are not photographed in the listing, but we took a chance based on what we saw in the other photos of the apartment.  One bedroom is off the living room and doesn’t have a door.  It has a 4-poster bed, with a somewhat run down desk and office chair.  Helpful if you’re working from home, but there’s no privacy and room feels small with the larger furniture in it.  (It looks like it was an office space converted to be a second bedroom.)  The other bedroom is off the hallway by the bathroom.  Decor was pretty neutral for both bedrooms with white blankets and linens.  The second bedroom had a unique choice in throw pillows on the bed... one says “Love” and the other says “Hip Hop”.  The bathroom has a bit of a tight squeeze, particularly between the toilet and the elongated sink/counter.  The space has great potential to be a super cute apartment.  The ceilings are fantastic, and the there’s tons of great natural lighting from all the windows.  The apartment just needs a little TLC.  Seems there are some personal items left strew about, not really adding to the decor.  For example,  there’s a random chain necklace hanging on a nail in the hallway.  In the morning, I spotted a white fuzzy sock/scarf on the bed frame.  I didn’t look too closely as I didn’t really want to know what it was.  The mix and match gives it a cluttered feel, and the space would be suited better if some older home goods were stored or given away.  The cabinets were partly empty, but then we found all the dishes still in the dishwasher.  After I noticed a few strands of hair on the bed sheets, I diverted my attention elsewhere, but couldn’t really get comfortable.  Also, we didn’t use the shower, but it took a very long time to get hot water in the kitchen sink.  The outdoor patio space is probably great in warmer seasons, but we didn’t use it as it during our stay.  Finally, if you’re a coffee drinker... bring K cups for a Keurig machine.  None were provided (as we’ve experienced in other stays), and I didn’t see other options to make coffee with the grounds we brought with us.  Overall, this AirBnB felt like we were staying in someone’s current home, and they couch-surfed at a nearby friend’s to give us the apartment for the night.  Thankful we found a place to stay in Salem, but in comparison to other AirBnBs we’ve visited, this one has room for improvement, especially for the price point.

I loved my time in Salem! Victoria’s home is so welcoming. The location is very convenient being downtown, but nestled away in a neighborhood which offers a park with miles of trials. I made great use of her patio off the front which has a large dinning table, fire pit, and grill.

I was in Salem for a 3 month job contract and stayed in Unit #4 at Pringle Creek Flats. It is a quirky, charming little space that felt somewhat like I was living in a treehouse during my May through August tenure. It is right  next to Bush Park which served as a delightful  "backyard" and is also within a mile of all the downtown locations for eating/shopping/etc. If you happen to work at Salem Hospital, you really can't beat the location. During the last month I was there, the weather got pretty hot on several days, and although there is no central AC, the little plug in portable units kept the flat decently cool. Plus, the summer heat resulted in a profusion of blackberries showing up almost overnight in the abundant hedges right by where I parked my car. Delightful! I felt very safe the whole time I was there, the other flat occupants were quiet, the keyless entry was great, the laundry facilities were fine (I only had to wait once in three months to use the coin operated washer/dryer) and I would definitely stay there again.

There were many disappointments with this place. The place was not cleaned. There were dirty dishes and stains on very appliances. There were issues with the bathroom regarding water temperature. Hard water in the toliet. Musty toliet smell. The amienty were not as advertised. No dish washer and paid laundry. Furniture extremely old and had stains. There was no fire alarm until I spoke up. Homeless people roamed the environment.
I would use again
Wonderful location! There's a great breakfast spot a few blocks away called Whites. I wish we had more time to walk around the neighborhood, it's beautiful!

This is an adorable house on a quiet street. We didn't spend much time in the neighborhood as we were there to see Willamette University and they kept us busy.  House is very clean and comfortable and charmingly decorated.
The is in a great spot, not too far from the Capitol. It was clean, comfortable and well appointed.

Had a nice stay at this home.
Welcome site at the end of a long day!
Awesome cottage and a lovely neighborhood
I would stay again in a heart beat. The home was close to anything we needed but still quiet. The tub was wonderfully deep and Linda is a gracious host

Linda is a great host!  The home is warm, comfortable and well-appointed. The kitchen has everything you need for cooking, the beds are comfortable and the location is close to downtown while still in a quiet safe neighborhood.  Linda's recommendations for restaurants were excellent and she was very flexible with checkin and checkout times.  Highly recommend this home for your Salem stay!

What an adorable house! We came to salem for a family get together and this house was perfect for everything we needed! Two bedrooms and a bathroom was just right for the 3 of us, and a baby too! We loved having the kitchen to cook breakfast and dinners at home, and the charming living room and decor made us feel right at home. Linda was always just a text away, and was so sweet to stop by and check in and introduce herself to see if we were all doing okay! Loved the neighborhood, and we were perfectly located in the center of salem. We loved our evenings at home and even used the DVD player for a movie night in, and there was also plenty of tv Chanel's to choose from! The beds were extra comfy too! Thanks for a great stay! We will be back again on our next visit to salem!
厨房设施齐全，适合家庭短住
Linda was amazing. Responsive and nice. The house is adorable, wonderfully comfortable, well stocked with all the necessities and more, and very very clean. We loved loved loved it!

A small but cozy house with 2 bedrooms, very comfortable for 3 adults to stay in for 2 nights.  We had a living room and a kitchen available to us.  A lovely quiet neighborhood with mature trees and flowering shrubs.  There's so much to do around Salem -- see the Capitol building, visit Silver Falls State Park, eat at downtown restaurants, and taste wine at the wineries of the Willamette Valley.

Linda's house is cute and cozy.  Very clean and neat. The updates in the bathroom are great. The new paint and yard work make this '20's house perk up. Linda put in a new ac unit to help during an unusual heat wave in Salem. Perfect place to rest for our family.

Linda's place is lovely, spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Beautifully decorated and has everything you would want. Highly recommend and would definitely stay there next time we visit Salem.  It was a perfect place to stay.

This house was a great place to stay in Salem. It is close to downtown. There were plenty of toiletries and essentials. The house was very clean. I would happily stay here again if I find myself in Salem again!

It is a great, central location. THe back yard has a tree swing and our 2 young daughters loved it. We had new borns and Linda managed to find a play pen for the duration of our stay. Would recommend this tidy and neat home.
GEMMSS.
Linda was a great host. Great communication. The place was really charming and in a lovely neighborhood. I would highly recommend staying at Linda's house.

Stayed here during Willamette opening days, and the house was perfect for us.  Short drive to campus, short walk to a good pizza place.  The space is open, clean, and nicely decorated.  Hesitant to review because I plan to stay here on my next visit to see my daughter.  Thanks Linda!
This place was clean and cozy. A great place to come back to after a few days out and about.
Great cottage!  Linda's place is perfect to recharge at night.

Linda’s home is absolutely perfect!  It’s an adorable house with everything you need. The kitchen is very well equipped and Linda even left us snacks. The home is immaculate and nicely furnished and the beds are super comfortable. The porch is so cute and a great place to sit and relax. You can walk to coffee shops and stroll through the streets. I definitely recommend this home and will return on my next visit to Salem!
Linda was a fantastic host and her home was perfect for my family during graduation weekend. It was in a nice location and had everything we needed. I would definitely stay again.

We loved our family vacation at Linda's place. The house is close to downtown and within walkable distance from Bush park. The close proximity to Children's museum and Riverfront park was a big plus as we had a toddler with us. The house was clean and well decorated with artwork. Linda was very prompt in communicating with us. We had a great time.

The cottage was an amazing place to make a stop on a week of travel. Close to the main drag of Salem. Great to make a dinner and relax on the deck. Linda was an amazing host that was there to address anything needed. Will definitely stay again if available.
Wonderful homely place with a feel good colorful environment.

Linda's place is a charming, artistic retreat from the city.  While close to downtown, the tiny cottage is clean, quiet and peaceful; the ticking of the antique clock is the loudest sound in the place.  I loved the collection of art displayed in the cottage, and I will never forget the sound of my son experimenting with the baritone ukulele and the instruction book provided.  That really was a once-in-a-lifetime moment. She also provided real cream for my morning coffee, which is a service I will always, always appreciate.  Strongly recommend.

A very charming home in a charming neighborhood in a convenient location. Extremely clean and comfortable. I loved the rocking chair on the front porch and also enjoyed sitting in the sunshine on the back deck. We were sad when it was time to leave!
The home is cute and convenient. Linda was great and very communicative. Wonderful stay in a quiet neighborhood.
Linda was a great hostess! Very responsive and accommodating. My coworker and I stayed in the house while traveling for work, and it was a perfect space for 2 people.

Linda's place was wonderful! My parents and I came up for a family friend's graduation and it was exactly what we needed. Her place was very cute and extremely clean with plenty of space and the necessary amenities. Linda was very responsive with anything I needed. The arrival was easy as can be even with our very late flight.  The tree lined street was extremely quiet and very pretty. We wished we could have enjoyed the area longer. Should we find ourselves in Salem again, we would definitely use Linda's place.

The house is charming, beautifully decorated and landscaped,  lovely neighborhood, very close to a large park for walking along the river (with or without a four-legged friend).   A perfect spot to relax and/or base for area exploration.
Great host with love to care hospitality unlike any others!
Linda was an amazing host with great care & help. She is a wonderfully caring and communicative host with a lovely home great for families looking for a great get away!

More than an old cottage!  This cottage has been completely remodeled with modern amenities and electrical outlets.  It's spacious and clean with lots of natural light.  It would make a great place for a multi-day stay.  It's ;located close to downtown and was easy to find.  Linda was thoughtful and responsive. I'll be staying there again next time I'm in Salem...if it's available!
Very cozy, host is very accommodating.
Wonderful home, I would stay there any time I am in Salem.

This is a charming house that accommodated us very nicely!  We enjoyed the amenities such as deluxe coffee maker :)  Close to everything yet still quiet.  Be aware owner lives on property in a separate cottage.  Also, there is a basement that owner uses; and we were a bit put off by the fact that there was no lock on the tenant side!  We could go into the basement, but also anyone could come into our space!  Overall, very well appointed home that has been nicely and tastefully updated.
Linda was very helpful and willing to work with our unexpected change for our stay. I would recommend Linda and this place to those who are interested in staying here.
Linda was great! I am looking forward to my next stay!

Charming, clean and comfortable. Accommodations were exemplary.   Great location and very easy to find. Our host was very responsive to our need for an extra bed. Loved this place. Would stay here again and again.

I planned a short trip and excitedly selected a day short which left me searching for an extra day that was out of my budget. I emailed Linda and she assisted in making sure I had a somewhere to stay. Linda took great care in thinking of every detail in her space to make all guests feel welcome. The units were very clean with lots of little details that made the unit feel like home. I can’t thank Linda enough for being so helpful and responsive to each and every concern. There are hosts that you never get a chance to meet, and sometimes you may prefer it that way, Linda is the exception. Awesome place — Awesome human!

Linda's 1920 cottage is perfect!  Cute, clean, centrally located.  We, my sister, nephew and I, were there for a week and it was just what we needed.  Linda is a very gracious hostess and is easily available to answer questions or give advice.  I just got home and already miss the little cottage!
Cute two bedroom, 1 bath with great rocking chairs on the front porch.
Great stay! Plenty of room to be comfortable. Very clean and welcoming. I would definitely recommend staying here.
Great little home, very clean, quiet neighborhood, walking distance to restaurants.  Great host.
Such a cute house to stay in. Had everything we needed. Even got to check in early.
I had a great stay at Linda’s place. Quiet, clean, and the perfect location was exactly what I needed. Thank you!

This is an awesome home and host! You can find everything you need. It's spacious and filled with excitement in every corner of the house. The host offered our child another air mattress. She found our missing credit card and mailed it to us. Highly recommend!

This is a perfect location for Willamette University parents dropping kids off or picking them up. This is a quiet street, close to campus, with two comfortable beds and all the amenities needed for home cooking.
Wonderful second stay at Linda’s place, I really appreciate the hospitality. Great place to stay in Salem.
This home was clean, had plenty of amenities (kitchen, coffee, entertainment) and in a great location next to the park in Salem. I would recommend this to family and friends.

Lovely little cottage in a lovely location in Salem. We were delighted with everything about this place. Wish we could’ve stayed longer! It was capped off by a great visit to the restaurant “word of mouth”. Highly recommend the flying biscuit and the crème brûlée French toast
Well-appointed space that is a great place to stay. Close to downtown, but in a quiet neighborhood.
Such a cute house! Wish we could have stayed longer!

This is a lovely small house, spic and span, fully equipped kitchen, fun decor. Very comfortable and cozy. We were pleasantly surprised at how spacious the living area was. We were able to store our bicycles in the basement also.
Everything was wonderful!

This is a lovely spot. It was a perfect home base for 4 adults and a child in town for a wedding. Cool, clean, and well appointed, this was the perfect home base. We enjoyed evening glasses of wine on the deck, cooking breakfasts and dinners in a real kitchen, and easy access to the rest of the city. Everything we needed!

The tree lined street is the first indicator that you’ve taken a step back in time - a time when neighbors talked over the fence or visited on each other’s porches drinking coffee in the rocking chairs. This is what you will find when you stay at this bungalow. Accommodations are spotless, amenities are great and the house feels like a home. Close to restaurants, parks and the history of Salem. Will definitely stay again!!
Linda is awesome! Very accommodating and responsive. Saved me some time and money with local transportation recommendations.
This home is in wonderful shape. Linda has a great eye for decorating and many updated touches make this a beautiful home to stay in when visiting Willamette University.

Linda’s place was just perfect. Very clean with no clutter. Walking distance to a large park and family friendly restaurant. Her house was very airy and had such a calm, peaceful feeling about it. We loved staying there and would definitely stay again.

Good house, good location--all you need!
Despite my reading other reviews and looking at the photos, I was pleasantly surprised at how roomy the house was.
Linda was a great host--she came by after I arrived, just to make sure all was good (and it was).
All the amenities you'd need, and then some. (I was just passing through, so I only got to enjoy the place for about 13 hours overnight. I wished I'd planned to stay longer!)
Because I find that internet varies wildly in Airbnb rentals, I want to add that the coverage was good and speeds were fine (11 mbps and up).

We stayed one night in Linda’s lovely home while in town for a wedding. To be honest, I’d been hesitant about the space since it described some shared area, but had no issues. Check in via the keypad was flawless, the property was spotless, the quirky decorations felt fun in the well lit, open space, and it all felt very private. We had use of the adorable craftsman home to ourselves. Linda’s communication was clear and kind, and the whole experience was wonderful. I would absolutely stay here again!
Linda's place was very inviting , comfortable and sparkly clean.  I would highly recommend it!
We totally enjoyed our stay.  The location worked out well for us.  It is in a quiet neighborhood, and we plan on staying there the next time we visit my sister.

This adorable cottage is perfectly located close to town. It was very clean and very nicely and comfortably decorated. The espresso machine was perfect. Linda answered all messages quickly. Would stay here again!

This home was perfect for my husband and I. From the moment we pulled up to the home we felt at home! Outward appearances were charming, neat as a pin, so perfect! We especially loved the tree lined street.

Linda was wonderful with correspondences. Very clear with entry and exit of home. Very comfortable bed and loved the high windows for the gentle breeze in the evening.

Other family members have stayed here recently and they were just as charmed. We will definitely be back. Thank you Linda!
Very clean, well appointed cottage with a most helpful host.  Fantastic place to stay!!
I would highly recommend Linda’s place, great distance from the WU district and far enough away to feel like you’ve got a quiet space. Beautiful home and very clean.
Linda’s home is wonderful. It was cute and comfortable for my family. We were visiting nearby wineries in the Wilamette Valley, and the place was very convenient for touring.
Very nice place, I would recommend staying here with a nice quiet little neighborhood.

This home is a perfect place to stay - walking distance to downtown and the trails on the river, but tucked in a quiet neighborhood. Linda keeps her home clean and decorated fresh for the seasons. It really is a home away from home.
This is a great place. To stay if you are cycling the Willamette Scenic Bikeway.  It is one block off the route and close to a few restaurants.  It is well kept, spacious and very clean.
Amazing house - home away from home!

I would stay forever if I could!  Loved the home, the neighborhood and Salem!  My husband and I felt as though we lived there.  Charming....beautiful artwork, comfortable beds, and perfect in every way! Complete with pumpkins galore on the beautiful front porch!  We will be back!

We were just passing thru so did not use most of the space but everything met our expectations.  We had driven all day so took a walk to stretch out legs and were pleasantly surprised.  Great neighborhood with beautiful homes.

Linda was super quick with communication before and during our stay. The house is beautiful and there were games and toys for us and our son to play with. Lots of extra blankets and towels and coffee in the kitchen. There was plenty of shops and places to walk to. The park is only a few blocks away from the house. We would definitely stay here again.

Linda's place was a perfect choice for us. Great location with lots of food options nearby, quiet neighborhood, and a sparkling clean and well-appointed home. We'd definitely return if we need a place to stay in Salem.
It was a lovely home in a cute neighborhood! All the amenities and very clean and comfy!
Such a great space! We were only staying for the night so we didn't get to utilize all the space and amenities. I would definitely stay here again and even more so for an extended stay.
Very charming house with lots of cheerful art. We appreciated the easy check in process and the hospitality of the host. We enjoyed using the Wii and the Nespresso coffee maker as well.
Stayed at the cottage for one night during Veteran’s day weekend. The house was quaint, clean, and beautifully decorated. The patio was a great place to enjoy a morning coffee!
Lovely stay for one night in Linda's place. House was very tidy and exactly as pictured. Great value for a nice spot.
A great little place to stay. Very cute & stylish & close to everything you need. I loved this house!
Great location! The neighborhood was fun to walk around in, lovely houses to look at. Also a nice mile walk to downtown. The courage was clean and stylish.  Loved it!!

This was our first AirB&B stay and it was fantastic. Much better than I ever expected. Linda is very responsive and her Cottage is adorable. Very clean and has everything you need. Will come back when next in the area.
We were there over the Thanksgiving holiday and we pleased to find everything we needed for home away from home, including a great kitchen.  Linda is super nice and a great host!
Good place clean and comfortable, very friendly host.

Very nice large home. Not too cluttered or crowded with excessive furniture. Beautiful art on the walls. Great location close to Willamette University & the Capitol. Quiet neighborhood with plenty of parking. Excellent choice-
