This space was SOOOO peaceful, the decor was perfect. I just had a solo getaway and the space had everything I needed. It’s simple, cozy, and gorgeous. I felt safe. I felt inspired. Will probably be back!

The garden flat has an incredible personalized experience. Thoughtful touches are all over the space including a menu of food options from their property and some fresh fruit left on the table. Kayla even left us with a bag of dog treats so we could become friends with Franky and Sam during our stay. Our expectations were surpassed in every way and we couldn’t think of a better place to stay while visiting the area. Big thanks to our hosts!

Stay here!! My husband and I picked this place to stay for before and after our wedding! It is the most charming and romantic Airbnb. It was so clean and well stocked of everything. Couldn’t have been a more perfect place!
A cute little space that was perfect for what we needed!

We had a great stay at Kayla's AirBnb! It's possibly the most beautiful AirBnb we've stayed at. The decor, ambiance, and layout is great for couples, and you really feel like you can get away and relax. We would definitely stay here again.
A most enjoyable unique place to stay with such kind hosts.

Stayed here a few nights while dropping my daughter off at college and hope to book it again anytime I come back to visit! I was surprised that it was significantly larger than I had anticipated from the pictures. The bedroom and kitchen are both decent-sized rooms and there is also an entry area and sitting room with desk and reading chair/ottoman, plus a large bathroom. Everything was clean and the decor is well-done and makes it feel homey without cluttering spaces you might need for your own things.

While it is in the basement so, as Kayla notes, there will be foot traffic (human and doggy) overhead, I didn't find it disturbing. However, If you are a very light or late sleeper, it's something you might want to consider. I was concerned that it being a basement would make it somewhat dreary but was extremely pleased to be very wrong about that. Most walls and floors are painted white and several windows let in the external light. Best was the lighting in the apartment--there was a lot of bright overhead light you could use in every room if you wanted, but also options for lower level lighting, as well as two small reading lights on either side of the bed (a feature I think every bedroom should have but so few do.)

I didn't have any issues, so we didn't need to communicate much, but Kayla was very responsive with check-in and check-out communication.

Absolutely charming!!! This space is absolutely beautifully appointed, quiet and close to anything you need/want. The owners have thought of every detail to make it comfortable and a bit luxurious. They "warn" you about their fur puppies, but they were so quiet and unassuming. The pictures are completely accurate. Definitely would stay here again.
Gorgeous Airbnb, beautifully designed, actually bigger than the pictures indicated. Friendly hosts and gorgeous dogs. Would happily stay again any time I’m in the area. Thanks for having us!
Great decor,  feels like staying in the French countryside.
My family and I stayed here so we could take a drive to silver falls, which was very close!! The space is beautiful and cozy. Would stay again if I was ever in the area
Our stay could not have been more perfect!!
Unique, French country styled home with all of the right touches
Great cozy stay with enough room  to spread out.
Cute, Clean, friendly place, easy to find, hour from airport, centrally located so if you feel like mountain adventure one day or beach the next it’s not far.

We absolutely loved our stay here! It was incredibly charming & so perfectly decorated. We loved making friends with the chickens, Sam & Frankie. The space was even a bit bigger than we thought. We will recommend it to anyone we know headed this way! Thank you for the amazing hospitality.
This was the perfect spot for a relaxing weekend in wine country. Beautifully thought out space with sweet little details. The host was very responsive and communicative.
Super quick communication, and a great location

Kayla’s place is very beautiful. Simple decor that still feels warm. The place is very bright for a basement and has the essentials of what you need for a short stay. Close to downtown salem with a five min drive. Far enough from the city so you have some quiet.
The Botaneity basement is beautiful. Every detail is perfect. I would highly recommend staying here for a cozy, peaceful escape central to Salem and wine country.

Impeccably curated, great zones to work / relax in the space. Beautiful light coming through in the morning and close to downtown. Kayla was great and communicative. We couldn’t get the hot water in the shower to level we like, and it would be great to have the ability to cook food in the kitchen as they offer ready made mixes. Great stay and would certainly come back.
Kayla’s flat is adorable, with nice touches throughout. Communication is great and she is very timely. You have a very safe and cozy feeling when you stay here!
Beautiful space, much larger than appears in the photos. Kayla was a great host and even made cookies for my arrival. Very cozy and warm even in winter.

Kaylas place was stellar!!probably  the nicest place we've ever stayed in...we were met with soft Christmas  jazz music..an inviting cozy fireplace..soft ambient lighting. Kayla obviously has an eye for interiordesign!!we can't wait to return

This is the PERFECT spot for a solo traveler or pair of travelers in Salem.

I arrived after dark & was having difficulty making my way to the apartment door. Robert came down to guide me, making me feel welcome right away.

While it’s a basement apartment, it doesn’t feel dark/claustrophobic. Lots of natural light; once the sun sets, there’s recessed lighting throughout & plenty of floor & table lamps. The space was incredibly warm for having concrete floors & throw rugs in a few spots as there are space heaters in each living space. Even with the December cold, I felt warm and cozy.

The décor made it feel like a French chateau. The place is stocked with lots of goodies & extra toiletries. Since it was Christmas, I didn’t get to see the winery, but I would definitely make the trip back down for it. It’s a beautiful property set off from the road. I can just imagine how nice it would be to do a wine tasting in their workshop in the summer.

Many thanks to Kayla & Robert!
Kayla was super helpful and accommodating for my stay. The place is absolutely incredible! Immaculate vibes for sure- definitely worth it!
I live just 15 minutes from this space and this is the second time I’ve rented it to just have a weekend staycation away from my busy household and just relax.  I love this space!!!

Lovely lower level apartment, tastefully renovated, with a decent amount of light for a basement. Despite space heaters, we found it cold and drafty so it may not be the safest choice during wintertime.  Outdoor stairs are a little hard to navigate in the dark or in wet weather.
Wonderful little pied-a-terre! Felt like Paris! Warm and cozy this winter. Can’t wait to experience it in the summer with a glass of wine outside!
A lovely and beautiful place to stay. Loved the vibe!

Beautifully decorated air bnb that makes you feel right at home! Highly recommend staying here. The chickens in the backyard offer a cool unique experience too. Kayla was super responsive and helpful. Can’t say how great our stay was!
Very beautiful and clean place. Interior decor and cleanliness were just amazing. Host was super helpful and communicative all the time.

Our stay here was wonderful! Dilani was such a kind host! Everything was clean and exactly what we expected. I appreciated that there was air conditioning and that the house was well stocked with essentials. The location is great with it being just a 5 minute drive from downtown.
What a spectacular place!  And the special touches are a great surprise like a fully stocked refrigerator and pantry!  Will definitely be staying there again!
Very easy to work with. Perfect for what we needed.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed over Christmas and there were even some Christmas decorations. We had plenty of room for 5 adults. The only thing  to me aware is that there is only one TV I’m the house.  My teenager used the TV room as his bedroom, which wasn’t an issue during Xmas, but could have been an during another timeframe. We will definitely stay here again.
Evolve is very easy to work with. The house was perfect for my crew traveling for work.

The Diva's Den was a perfect home away from home for our family of 5.  We were in Oregon visiting family in Portland and Salem and came across this house and so glad we did, it is just a street down from both my mothers-in-law and also my sisters-in-law house, so it was absolutely perfect! The home itself is very comfortable, clean, and well set up. The TV room was great for our daughters and those who wanted to watch TV away from the living room where family was having conversations. This is a very cute and nicely decorated home, it made we want to come home and decorate mine a little cozier! The amenities where a huge, unexpected plus, the host has a well-stocked kitchen, with the basics such as spices, oil, butter, etc, but went above and beyond by purchasing a few items for us before we arrived, such as breakfast items consisting of bacon, sausage, eggs, yogurt, coffee, creamer, bread, orange juice, and a bottle of Oregon Pinot Noir and chocolates!! The bathrooms had shampoo and conditioner, I had brought some so didn't need it, but it just shows the thoughtfulness put into making her quests feel comfortable and at home. The Host, Delani (I believe is her name) checked in with us via text and made sure we had everything we needed.  She has brochures on restaurant and winery recommendations as well as things to do in the area. Downtown was very close, maybe 5 minutes if that. Just down the street and walking distance to Safeway, this home was very convenient. The outside back yard is so nice, we only wished we were able to make use of it and BBQ, but it rained the entire time we were there.  We will definitely be back in the future as long as it's available. Thanks Delani!

We liked our stay for the most part. We were happy with the hostess, her kindness and generosity in providing food for us and making our lengthy stay possible. We liked the full kitchen and would have liked some cotton wash cloths and a drainer for the dishes. Some utensils were missing like large spoons and spatulas. Loved getting the variety of coffees and gluten free/lactose free food. Unfortunately we were not able to enjoy the lovely back yard do to business and weather.
The two things stood out as negatives and those were the comfort level of the beds (may be just our special needs since we are seniors), and the smell in the house. This is a subjective thing, as we are very sensitive to the floral scents of detergents and cleaning supplies. Overall the stay was nice and very homey and the hostess went above and beyond to be helpful and gracious.
Nice house
Loved the homey feeling. A great place to kick back after a day of sightseeing
Good location and host is very nice. The furniture in the house isn’t the most practical and it’s a bit cluttered. House is very clean and has what you need for a stay
Lovely home! Clean, nice enclosed cabana in yard to sit visit and enjoy the nice weather! Would stay again when in area!

the home was excellent location was great and the neighborhood is quiet and close to shopping and the heart of downtown Salem. host is very helpful and always ready to answer any questions we had. we will definitely book this home again. it was a great
Overall great experience with the place.

Danila is one of the kindest and most responsive hosts I have ever had and I've done airbnb a lot.  She bought a coffee grinder when we texted her that we had gotten some whole bean coffee for Christmas and was completely responsive to our needs.  And her house is REALLY fun with plush and interesting furnishings and decor.
When i travel to portland this will be our first stop
Very cute home. Conveniently located in Salem. Curt and Deb are very responsive hosts!
Very nice  place. Very clean. Nice  Neighborhood.. And close to everything stores  Parks. Good communication with the host.
Not the greatest location, but other than that it was very comfortable.

Curt & Deb’s place was a real gem in the heart of Salem. An older home with lots of charm. Close to many attractions as described. The beds were comfy and kitchen well stocked with supplies and extras. Check in and check out were a breeze and owners were very communicative.
We were in town for the world beat festival, I will definitely stay again next year if possible.
Such a nice place. This old house has so much style and space. Plenty of room to spread out and relax. Very well cared for and cozy home.
Look at my previous review before booking, they need to fix the issues or at least let you know ahead of time about parking.
everything was nice and the trip went very smooth al instructions were clear and easy to follow. was a bit skeptical when I saw it from the outside needs some tlc but the inside was nice.
This spot was great! Walkable to downtown and very spacious. We were really gracious for the AC on a super hot day.

The house was nice and clean. Well stocked. Kurt was very helpful in timely manner when we accidently locked ourselves out of upstairs bathroom.
Out doors could be trimmed up so house looks more inviti g from the outside.
The house is very comfortable and clean. My family enjoyed their stay. There was plenty of room for all.
House was great! The neighborhood wasn’t the best, but we were close to a lot of places we could shop/eat!
Had a great stay and really enjoyed ourselves. We will come back the next time we visit salem.
The house was clean and comfortable, and was outfitted with lots of extra touches. Thank you for letting us stay at such a lovely home!
Plenty of space for 5 of us. Nice and clean with lots of conveniences. Will definitely come back and stay here.
Great place to stay but wifi did not work  what so ever we had a leak on the hood fan so we were not able to cook anything

The home had a very well-stocked kitchen and we were able to prepare meals for a family without needing to purchase anything but food.  A really special touch was a full water cooler for our use.  We had plenty of room for everyone and the beds had cozy soft blankets.  Check in and check out were very easy.  It was a very quiet neighborhood and conveniently located near downtown.
Our stay was fantastic! The beds were incredibly comfortable, the kitchen was stocked with just anything you could possibly need to make meals.
The home was clean and very well stocked and provided large jug of water, and Curt dealt with the ice problem immediately.   Home had ample amount of room for our family.

Curt’s place was great for our bunco babe getaway! We had plenty of room to relax and enjoy down time with comfy furniture and a nice table for games.
The kitchen was well stocked, beds we’re comfortable, and there were plenty of clean towels and toiletries
We appreciated the location being close to the fairgrounds and many restaurants

We would definitely stay here again

Great place to stay. Close to fairgrounds and downtown. Very complete selection of teas and coffee to start the morning. The house was lacking nothing that we needed. The very comfortable beds with real comforters on top made for a great nights sleep. We will be back next year!

Me & my husband traveled to Salem to work at the local hospital. Originally the plan was for 3 months, but we ended up staying almost 6 months - I don't think we could've picked a better place or host. Neil's place comes with all the comforts of home, and was clean, well decorated, and convenient. The unit is centrally located to everything in Salem. Multiple grocery stores, eateries, and attractions nearby. PDX is about a 50 minute drive away and made traveling to surrounding states for business super easy! Neil's communication skills are flawless - quick, flexible, and efficient! Throughout the stay we had no concerns or problems and would gladly stay at Neil's property again if ever in the area & would highly recommend to anyone needing somewhere to stay in Salem. Overall & easily Neil is one of the best host I have encountered and owns one of the best Airbnbs I have stayed in!

Perfect!! This beautifully decorated home was an awesome place to start our new lives in Salem. The home is clean and comfortable. Our host Neil is very thoughtful with the many amenities stocked in this home. We were able to do everything we needed as if it were our own home, and not have to run to the store to buy extra things. The home had all the appliances, kitchenware, bedding and towels, cleaning supplies and full size washer and dryer, so we didn't have to worry about anything! The services included with the home included Smart TVs, High Speed Internet and Home Security, which kept us entertained and secure when we stayed indoors.
And last but not least, Neil was a fantastic host! He made sure we had open communication from check-in to check-out. From giving directions to the home, helping replace a broken appliance, to making sure to ask how we are doing, and if we needed any suggestions for fun things to do in the area, he was always there when needed. We were very fortunate to be able to call this place our home away from home, even if for just a short time.
Decent location, good communication. Smaller than pictured and very hot upstairs during the summer with no AC- just a heads up.

This house is beautiful! Great location, clean interior, free wine & snacks from the host, as well as literature and information regarding location attractions and restaurants. Overall a fantastic stay. Angela communicated quickly and clearly. The entire stay was a pleasure.

Angela vacation home in Salem is a beautiful place to stay and is centrally located which makes it quite easy to get around town to see the sites.  We really enjoyed our weekend stay and will return for a longer visit in the future.

The Garden Cottage worked great for our stay in Salem. Clean and comfortable.  Convenient to  main streets. Quiet neighborhood. Nice step-in showers. Large refrigerator/ ice maker.  We thoroughly enjoyed staying in Angela's house. Definitely will stay again.   Enjoyed the fresh bouquet of Stargazer Lilies.

The Jefferson Cottage was absolutely amazing! A cute spacious home away from home stocked with everything you could possibly need! Angela was a phenomenal hostess. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will utilize this home again when we come back to Salem! Highly recommend to anyone looking for that home away from home feel!

Here's an unusually well-appointed, spacious, and comfortable home! Our group of four had plenty of room to spread out and chill in the evenings. Excellent amenities in a quiet neighborhood, with a friendly and helpful host. A real stand-out amongst my many AirBNB experiences.

FANTASTIC HOME!!! So easy to access and check-in, very well stocked kitchen. There was even a bottle of wine waiting for us! As well as some snacks and a list of local recommendations!!! Staying here maybe it possible to cook at home nearly every evening and truly enjoy time as a family together.
The bed was soooooo comfy! I usually have back issues when I stay away from home, but not here!
There was body wash, and tiny shampoos, etc left for us. Oh, and curly hair ladies….there is an awesome diffuser hair dryer!
WE HIGHLY recommend this property. The owner was fantastic, the home is fantastic, and the location super central. Give this home a 10 out of 10 !

The cottage is lovely.  We loved the artwork and loved sitting by the fire in the super comfortable living room.  We enjoyed the wonderful yard and quiet neighborhood.  Being an older crowd, we had some issues with the stairs.  They are very steep and might not work for every group.

We loved our cottage stay! It was even bigger and cuter than we expected, was very clean, and had all the essentials. The beds were super comfortable and the neighborhood was adorable and quiet. We would definitely come back!

This home was so amazing. It was truly a great time! It felt just like it was our own home. It had everything you needed. It was very clean and the host was great! The basement/game area was our favorite! Overall this cottage was so cozy and cute. Many memories were made. Definitely will stay here again in the future!

We stayed at this house for the Christmas holiday because we have family in Salem. When we arrived, the house was decorated with Christmas decorations. There was so much care from our host that I can't express in a short review how personal our stay became. Thank you Angela for taking such great care of us.
Great location and even better accommodations! Clean with great personal touches !! We will be back again when we visit Salem !!

The Jefferson Cottage is absolutely fantastic! We booked a 3-night just under a week out due to an unfortunate family emergency in the area. Angela was so friendly and warm and the check-in process was easy and seamless. The cottage is outstanding - welcoming and cozy - and the perfect place for our last minute weekend. We arrived to find a bottle of wine and snacks, which we eagerly devoured after our drive! The cottage had everything we needed from coffee to toiletries. The layout was perfect for two couples, allowing us to each have our own bathroom and bedroom on separate floors. There was also a cute extra bedroom we did not use at all, with two twin beds. The living room on the main floor had comfy seating and a fireplace. We did not use the basement rec room at all, but we peeked down to check it out and it is appointed with games, books, a comfy couch, and a nice fireplace! The cottage had a home-y and welcoming feel and all the modern necessities. Overall we had a wonderful time at the cottage, which was so appreciated during a stressful family situation. Check out was easy. I would highly recommend the cottage and would certainly stay here again the next time we come to town!

The house is charming and well equipped with everything we needed and more!   The landscaped yard gave us much enjoyment.  The neighborhood is adorable and close to everything.  We all agreed we we would stay there again with no hesitation.

Wow. We were charmed by Angela’s place the moment we pulled up the driveway and saw her tulips and sweet garden. The house was wonderful and sparkling clean. Angela gave clear instructions and such a warm welcome. She even keeps gardening shears in the kitchen, so guests can clip a bouquet of blooms from her yard. We loved walking the vintage neighborhood. We had chilly rain (and some snowflakes), so it was awesome to have the cozy gas fireplace in the evenings with a cup of tea or good coffee (provided by Angela!). There was a bedroom and bath on the main floor, which was great for my mom so she didn’t have to go up and down the stairs. We’d never spent time in the Willamette Valley before, and this was the perfect base. So easy to get to Riverfront Park with its carousel, downtown Salem (delicious lunch at the Wild Pear) Silverton, the Oregon Garden, Silver Falls State Park, and Wooden Shoe Tulip Farm (spectacular!). Honestly, we can’t wait to go back. And we would DEFINITELY book this cottage again.
Awesome place but I'd be careful if you have older people as the stairs are very steep.   Very cute house, great location, host was very easy to work with.

This house is SO cute - the bedrooms are cozy, the garden is incredible, and the downstairs TV/playroom area is perfect for hanging out. The kitchen has most of what you need to cook, and there are grocery stores nearby for anything you might be missing. I'd highly recommend this house.

Was very excited to stay here! Beautiful property and listing showed 3 separate bedrooms, two with queen beds and one with two twins. There were three of us, so three separate rooms was perfect! Unfortunately when we arrived, they had locked one of the queen bedrooms up " since they only host people listed". We had brought an unexpected guest child due to unforeseen circumstance. I texted host upon arrival since situation happened that day. We weren't notified of locked bedroom prior to entering the house. I asked host if door could be unlocked she responded she couldn't come unlock until after 8pm the last evening of the stay(which honestly is pointless by then). I ended up sleeping in the twin room with my teen since my adult daughter is too tall for twin bed. Unexpected kid had to sleep on a sofa. Dead flowers in kitchen upon arrival. We still tidied up, washed all the towels, ran the dishwasher, took out the trash and recycle despite our lack of beds we fully paid for. This place would have been decent if the bedroom had not been locked. Disappointed and will not refer any of their properties in the future.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this lovely little home. Thank you for saving our forgotten items. Thank you again for your courtesy and kindness.

We had a great stay at this adorable cottage!  It was very roomy and we enjoyed watching movies in the basement.  It was clean and had everything we needed.  The beds were so comfortable!  The landscaping was beautiful and the neighborhood was quaint and quiet.  Overall, a very nice place to stay.
House is lovely, fully renovated and functional.

We loved this home in a beautiful neighborhood! So well taken care of, and the attention to detail was spot on. Close to many services and amenities. It was a perfect space for our group of four - the three bedrooms on two levels was great for privacy as well. The lower level family room was just perfect for watching movies and playing games. We most definitely will stay there again!
Angela has been amazing. So helpful when early check in was requested. The crew are really grateful!
Great place to stay for a few days in town. Clean and well kept . Great service and communication. Thanks so much!!
Fantastic property, beautifully updated and very comfortable. I’d definitely book it again. Vicki J
Great stay
We loved it thanks!
Nice place
This was a beautiful place. Photos are accurate. Perfect place for my three grown children to relax and hang out while we visited campus.
This place is a gem. Clean, convenient and the communication was easy and prompt.
Enjoyed our stay and they thought of all the extras to make it “home away from home” feeling !

Everything was perfect, we very much enjoyed our stay. The bed was perfect, the kids loved having a tv to watch during our down time or to watch movies at night. The location and parking where great, we had the shopping center literally around the corner. We will stay or look for this place if we decide to visit Salem again.

Carole’s place is wonderful! It’s beautiful and spacious, with all the amenities one can think of. The bed was one of the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in. The host left snacks and some wine for us, which we really appreciated after a long day out. One of the days, we locked ourselves out (our own stupidity) and Angela was very prompt in opening the door for us. Overall, very safe, convenient, comfortable and close to restaurants and bars. We highly recommend it!
Great place! Will definitely stay again. Even accommodated a last minute booking request late in the evening without skipping a beat. Thank you!

A fun, beautiful little apartment in the heart of Salem. Too many great restaurants within walking distance to choose from. A fantastic bookstore across the street. Could have easily stayed a week. Highly recommended!

Great location - there were so many choices for breakfast, parks nearby, and it was a easy stroll to get to the capital buildings and the college.  The apartment was well appointed and clean.   Check in was easy and the host was great at communication.
Very convenient to Willamette University and many close restaurants and shops.
This apartment is in an excellent location...right in the heart of downtown Salem. Convenient to everything and very comfortable and pleasant. We hope to stay again soon!
Lovely Airbnb. Great location, clean and well organized. Highly recommend. A great value for all they offered, too!

Had a wonderful 4 night stay in this well appointed, comfortable, conveniently located apartment. Some of the prior reviews have mentioned street noise, but after about 10 or 11 p.m. it is fairly quiet through the night, and picks up the activity again about 7:30 a.m. on weekdays and remained pretty quiet until about 8:30 on Saturday.
The location is wonderful if you want to get out and walk, shop, go to restaurants and experience the area. There is fabulous walking along the River and over into Minto Island. The restaurants in the area are plentiful and varied from fine dining (Rudy's Steakhouse), to sushi, Thai, pizza (A Slice of New York Pizza just around the corner), bakeries, etc. While maybe in past years this area might have been sketchy, it is certainly experiencing a rebirth and is quite vibrant - the exception maybe is the Salem Mall that seems to have had better days. Yes, some interesting individuals now and then, but what city doesn’t have that, and it felt very safe.
The apartment itself was really clean and well furnished. The kitchen was well stocked with cookware and essentials (thank you for the wine and chips!), as was the laundry and bathroom. It allowed us to travel lighter than in some places.
My husband was in awe of the shower! He’s 6 foot 2 and usually has to scrunch down in a shower, but the head was up high and adjustable for me. The shower also had nice power and controls. It’s great to start out your day with a pleasing shower!
We appreciated the brochures and information about local areas to visit and not left unnoticed was the pride of ownership and respect for the apartment with coasters left in many places and with leg covers for the chairs to prevent scuffing the floor. These little touches demonstrate the care for this historic apartment/building.
As others have mentioned, the communication has been quick and thorough and it was easy to get access to the apartment and to park in the public parking less than a block away (with street parking also available for up to 3 hours).
The views from this AirBNB are amazing....huge 8' windows overlooking downtown Salem.  I wish I had known about this property on previous visits to Salem
Great location
Great place is downtown Salem. Very close to Minto Brown park, restaurants and bike rentals. Well maintained space with a good kitchen and spacious rooms.
Nice place in downtown Salem. Very close to Minto Brown park and many restaurants. The kitchen is well equipped and the rooms are spacious.
We enjoyed staying in the downtown apartment. Great location and apartment had everything we needed and more. Quite a bit of street noise in the front bedroom, but the back bedroom was very quiet!
Nicely furnished apt in a great location.
Very convenient downtown location!  Check in and out was easy. Great space.
Spacious, clean apartment in a great location!
Charming apartment in a great location and close proximity to Willamette University. I enjoyed my stay here very much and liked the convenience of exploring downtown Salem. Thank you!
Cute 2nd floor walk up - perfect for our family of 3!

Carole was an excellent host and very responsive. The apartment was really nice with everything one could need. the location was superb. There's plenty of options dining. I loved my stay here. Easily one of the best Airbnb's I have stayed in.

A great apartment in the heart of Salem! Fantastic location—walking distance to restaurants, bakeries (yummy cannoli and coffee nearby!) and adorable little shops. A beautiful park with children’s playground is right down the street and street parking was readily available during non-peak hours. During our stay (over a weekend), the street and nearby businesses were bustling at dinner time until about 11pm, and then very quiet until late morning. The home was outfitted with all the necessities and was very clean, comfortable, and plenty spacious for our family of 4. Our hosts were generous and left a welcome gift and even delivered a fun surprise for our young kiddos to enjoy during our stay! This is a sweet spot in a sweet little city.

Great spot in Salem with good amenities within the apartment and great experiences within walking distance. The street was a bit noisy in the evening, but that could have been because I stayed over a holiday so there were more people out than usual.  I had a spot of trouble getting into the apartment at first, but Carole took care of things and had great communication with me throughout the visit. Would stay here if I'm in the area again.

Great place well appoint and centrally located. It has everything you want. The front bedroom can be a bit noisy but a white noise app on your phone fixes that. The back bedroom is quiet. It is a great value and I would repeat.
Everything was easy and comfortable. Just as advertised! Good bedding and shower. Parking was no problem.
The perfect downtown location!
Great Salem, Oregon location. Big windows look down on a quaint city block. Small town urban vibes. Great place to stay. Beds are decent and so is water pressure.
Lovely space, great location, excellent communication, and very helpful accomodations and supplies in the apartment.

Angela was quick to respond when we had any questions, which we appreciated so much considering we were staying there for our wedding weekend (we had our wedding reception at the Reed ballroom across the street). There’s the minor inconvenience of the 3 hour on-street parking only but that is out of her control. The home was nice and homie. Perfect place to stay with coffee stands, restaurants, bars within walking distance.
Great location. Great facility.  Easy access to restaurants and downtown.
we had a wonderful time at the loft. it was close to many great places and the loft was very clean. we couldn't have have asked for better communication from booking to check-out.
I very much enjoyed my stay in Salem.  Angela was a great host.

What a wonderful place in the heart of downtown Salem. The apartment is very spacious, comfortable, and had everything we needed. We are parents of a Willamette University student and this place was close enough to her. We hope to stay here again sometime.
Awesome place to stay in Downtown Salem.  Plenty of dinning and shopping around.  Very close to a lot of outdoor Oregon activities.  I will definitely rebook next time I am in town.

Great spot right in downtown Salem. Lots of shops and eateries within walking distance and also very close to the Riverfront Park and Minto Island Park for a nice evening stroll. The loft was clean, stocked, had secure entry and just one other occupied loft across the hallway. Parking was not a problem. Would definitely book this perfect spot again and recommend to anyone looking to stay in downtown Salem. Communication was prompt and responsive from Host Angela which I personally appreciated very much. Great choice!!!
A fantastic place right in the center of  town with great everything mere steps away. Everything you need for a great stay.
We really enjoyed our stay! We would definitely stay there again.
Super clean, great location, easy parking.
I love this place for trips to Salem! The location is perfect and the apartment is cozy and clean! Angela is an excellent host!
Great location,  very clean
Nothing like staying right in the midst of downtown Salem energy!

It was fun to be able to stay right in downtown Salem and experience downtown living for a weekend. There are so many restaurants to choose from. We even got to watch a Mardi Gras parade from the window on our second night. Super memorable and would highly recommend.

This place was just what was described and just what I needed for a midweek stay for work.  Fun being able to hang around downtown and then be right at home after a great dinner or a pint at one of the breweries!

My husband and I stayed at the Loft for 4 nights this past week. We are working from home in Portland and when the PNW heatwave struck, we looked for a lovely spot with central air to avoid the heat with walking distance to vegan restaurants, space to accommodate two remote workers who need great wifi and space for yoga! The Loft was all those things, plus comfy beds, incredible amenities (gorgeous kitchen with full cooking set up -- we ended up making more meals in than out because of this beautiful kitchen!) and the space was gorgeous beyond my expectations -- the photos do not do this historic space justice. We loved staying at the Loft and took walks along the Willamette River and enjoyed the downtown eats! Highly recommend Slick Licks for vegan ice cream! :) Carole was an extremely responsive host and was wonderful to coordinate with, there was free parking and check-in/check-out was self serve. We can't wait to visit again!
Amazing unit! Huge, bright, perfectly located. Book it! You will love it. It is a true loft (no closed bedrooms just wall dividers). I’d gladly stay again.

One of the most stunning places I’ve stayed in and I’ve been in lots of AirBnbs!  I used to be a host before we moved to Mexico.  Not only does it have everything you need, it is in a great location.  Walkable to great stores and restaurants!  Wonderful riverfront park a block away!  We hope to stay here again!
Beautiful place, great natural light, super comfy beds, easy check-in, great location... Our only complaint is that we wish we could have stayed longer!
Carol’s place was so unique and beautiful! Great location downtown, a little noisy late at night but it is a downtown loft. If you want to be downtown, this loft is perfect!

Fantastic place! Spacious, comfortable and fully stocked with anything you might need in the kitchen and bathroom. If you want to be right in the heart of downtown, walk to coffee, shopping and restaurants, this location is ideal!
Despite being located in the downtown area the loft is very quiet and cozy. Carole is a great host and is super thoughtful and friendly!
Couldn’t have been any better!
amazing spot to catch up with friends!

If you want a great space to spread out with family, or even on business like me, this is your home away from home. You can walk to a ton of great spots. While in Salem, this is my go to location to stay.

Thank you for creating such a comfortable and inviting place to be.
Extremely well designed place in a strategic location downtown. Thoughtfully appointed and fun. I enjoyed it.
This was a great place to stay. It was wxactly like the pictures. It is above a dance studio and check in was a breeze
The Loft was perfect! Great location, loved the decor, lighting and it was stocked with everything we needed. Great place for a stay while in Salem.

Excellent location if you need to be near Salem’s convention center. Fantastic vintage building with modern upgrades and conveniences. I felt pampered in this space. Classy, comfortable, & clean. Thanks again!
Terrific spot - lots of room, eclectic and interesting decor, and right in the center of everything in Salem. Communication was stellar, and check-in was a snap. Highly recommend!
Carole went to great lengths to make her place amazing and comfortable. Please respect the property and rules. It’s a well stocked pantry and cabinets with plenty of cooking utensils etc.
Lovely place - clean, great layout and amenities. Highly recommend!

Beautiful and spacious just as listed. Very well-appointed kitchen. Great location in downtown Salem. Host was very responsive to all communications. One caution-don’t leave anything valuable in your car. Our window was smashed but the car alarm scared them away before they could grab anything in the vehicle. An annoying footnote to an otherwise delightful trip.
We stayed here on our wedding weekend and it was perfect. We didn’t spend a ton of time in the apartment, but the nearby cafe was perfect for breakfast!

Angela's loft is spectacular. We couldn't stop remarking on the beauty and artistry of the design. It is fabulously conveniently located in downtown Salem, with a terrific café on the corner. The street is a bit loud with traffic at times, one might sleep better in the bedroom closest to the bathroom. We so enjoyed exploring the town and the waterfront. We've already booked a return trip...
Large, eclectic, fun, comfortable, and well equipped. If the location suits your needs and you don’t mind stairs, the unit is really cool.
So glad I chose this lovely place to stay over. Location, host assistance, amenities were top notch.

This loft is fantastic! Perfect location for walking downtown and to the park.  Very comfortable bed and the loft is outfitted with everything you need. You will love the vibe and the interesting items in this space 🖼🪴♟🚪 we are already discussing our next stay here 🍷
great place to stay.

Angela's loft is in a great location in downtown Salem,  a couple of very short blocks from great restaurants and the waterfront. I love that Angela leaves her fridge stocked with condiments so we don't have to buy those on top of groceries. The beds are comfy, the art and lighting are fantastic, and the ceilings are high. It's really a lovely place we love to stay in when we visit Salem.

This is a great place to stay in downtown Salem. We enjoyed all that was to offer in this place. The location was exactly what we wanted so we could get around by foot downtown, but with parking available.
We only needed a two rooms, but this has great entertaining space if you are getting together with others for some games or dinner. The kitchen was perfect for hosting and we will select it again if we do that in the future.

Fantastic, spacious, well appointed condo in the heart of downtown Salem.  Located near many great restaurants and shops, and a short drive away from the countryside.  Highly recommended if you’re staying in Salem!
Angela's lift is beautiful, cozy, conveniently located, well equipped, thoughtfully decorated - the list goes on and on. It's our favorite place to stay in Salem.

Right in the heart of downtown Salem is a sophisticated, charming loft worth your investigation.  City noise was not an issue.  The elevated kitchen is unique and a great idea for the space; well equipped, easy to use.  Beds are comfortable with plenty of blankets.  Furthering the loft motif, the furniture and decorations fit perfectly.  The floors are truly beautiful.  The site pictures are a true depiction of what you will get; not just well staged photos.  Don't click further, this is the place to stay in Salem.  We will be returning.
Nick left us without access to his listing and never responded to messages and phone calls. We were lucky another host was willing to accommodate so late at night.  You been warned.
Nice and comfortable. Very quiet location, centrally located.

It was good for the money. I stayed there last year and had a great experience. This year was a bit different, provided feedback to the hosts, hopefully they will implement improvements and you will have a great experience as I did last year.
Thank you for a clean space and excellent communication. We appreciated our stay!

Not a good experience. The check in time was 3:00pm, i was not able to get into the room until 7:00pm. i asked for a refund, and the would not give me the refund and instead made me wait 4+ hours past the check in time to even get into my room which i found very inconsiderate. Also, the AC in the room was broken, and given the heat wave we’ve been having of over 115 degrees, it was extremely uncomfortable and hot the entire stay. Unfortunately i would not stay here again.

Potluck rooming with 4 beds upstairs, 1 master downstairs in a large historic home with charming interior. Big bathroom upstairs. Roomy kitchen / living room/ dining. Fridge out of order, would need to go downstairs to use (luckily didn't need a fridge or the kitchen).
The woman who keeps the home tidy was very friendly.
I stayed weekend of the 4th, hot days, and the hosts were really hard to get ahold of. Checked in 3rd eve... messaged on Abnb and left voicemail regarding a non-performing AC unit. Hadn't heard back from them by message or phone until the next afternoon when I inquired again. I cut a bit of slack for the hosts being out of town on a holiday, but... this is a business right?
However, did allow me move to a new room with a working AC unit for night 2. Was a pleasant stay otherwise.
My stay was extremely comfortable. Nick and Julia we great hosts and are very communicative. This was my second time staying here and I would gladly book again.
Convenient room for a quick overnight stay. No frills and inexpensive. A/C in the room on a warm evening was nice to have.

I really cannot say enough about Jean. She is the consummate host. Being at her beautiful Salem home had the feeling of staying with your favorite aunt but without any downside. The accommodations are lovely, everything is spotless, and Jean provided us with various daily treats. She even serviced our room daily which I didn’t expect at all but which was a delightful surprise. The location was perfect for our needs and you can walk to the amazing Word of Mouth Bistro. Also there is great parking that is gated at night. A note for anyone mobility challenged, the space is up a rather long set of stairs. We will definitely be back!
This was my second stay at Jean's home, and it again, was wonderful.
Carole’s home is beautiful! Great stay and great host. Location is perfect and close to downtown Salem. Would definitely recommend.
Excelente
Amazing place. Would recommend this x1000. Carole definitely has made the house a home for your stay.
Great place. Lovely house. Very quiet neighborhood. Perfect for our needs.
Nice home. Handy location. Had a great stay.
A comfortable house in a historic neighborhood with great walking opportunities.
20 minutes from wineries in west Salem.  Great locations. well equipped home perfect for our long weekend.

The house was really comfortable. Great beds and excellent location for visiting my son at Willamette It is across the street from a high school - but it was the weekend so there were no students around. The neighborhood was very cute and the kitchen had everything we needed. We would definitely stay there again.
Very convenient and cozy location!

Great location! Blocks from  restaurants, bars, shops, Riverfront Park. Loved the bed, shower was great and there was pretty much everything you could need. It is a 100+ year old building and the heater does not work great so it does get cold. Bring a sweatshirt, use the blankets or portable heaters provided and you will be fine. Also, this building is downtown so you can expect to hear cars and people throughout the day and night. If you come with that expectation you will enjoy the space and location. Carole was quick with communication.

Great space! Very clean and comfortable. Location is great! Many restaurants/bars  within walking distance. The park just to the west is a great place to walk and take in the sunset! We’d definitely stay again.
It was awesome
The set up and location of the loft was great for our trip.
It was a perfectly located stay and full of everything we required!

We stayed in Carole's loft for two weeks while our home was undergoing repairs. It was a wonderful experience and was just what we needed for our little family. Carole was a fantastic host and was super quick to respond to any and all questions.

The loft had absolutely everything we needed for a comfortable stay. We especially loved having a washer/dryer and dishwasher in the unit. The space heaters kept us cozy and toasty. It was fun to be downtown and run out for coffee and pastries at the lovely cafes and bakeries that are in the vicinity. We enjoyed taking the baby for a walk at Riverfront Park which is a block away.

Thank you, Carole, for letting us make the loft our home for a few weeks.
Great location in a great town. Right in the middle of everything in Salem, but the apartment was quiet, comfortable, and had everything we needed.
Nice place! Plenty of room! Great location.

Centrally located we were able to walk everywhere we wanted. The neighborhood was friendly and accommodating. We felt safe and welcome. The bedrooms were cozy. Each had a desk and adjustable lighting . The table was in the nice big kitchen which had everything needed to cook.  Carole is a great communicator and reached out for any questions or needs we may have had. Warning you must be able to climb the stairs.
clean place, great downtown location and communicative host
Great place to stay downtown.
Very hospitable! Thanks so much!!
We liked the shower and everything we needed was there. The main bed wasn’t comfortable for us.
Stay was great, apartment was cozy, all the typical amenities, seem less check in/check out procedure. All in all a great place to stay.

Great loft in a perfect location! The place was fully stocked and we had everything we needed for our stay. Easy checkin and very nice to have a designated parking spot in a gated lot. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a place in Salem!

Nice clean place as advertised. Host we very clear and communicative. The remote for the a/c died right as we were settling in (no fault to the host, these things happen), they were right on it and got it fixed/replaced and all was great!
The apartment was more spacious and beautiful than expected! Convenient parking, easy check in, and close to everything in Salem.

Had a wonderful time, the house was perfect for a small group of people. It was clean and the location was perfect for whatever you wanted to do. Planning on our next trip. Jessica was always a call or text away if we had any questions.
This was a great Airbnb! We loved our stay here! The place is very clean and had a good parking location and it also had all amenities as advertised.
We enjoyed our stay at Jessica's place in Salem.  The house was clean and organized.  We enjoyed the complimentary coffee and oatmeal.
This home was perfect for our family of 4 for a couple of days.  It was immaculately clean and very nice and tastefully decorated.  We would definitely stay here again.

This was my "home office" for a few days and that worked out perfectly. A very nice, clean place with plenty of room and plenty of assets. The place has a welcoming feel that makes it easy to go "aahh..." at the end of the work day.

amazing and clean place
Calm neighborhood and had to problem staying here
Thanks Jessica!

This home is tastefully decorated and had so many "extras" like spices to cook with, coffee, creamer, oatmeal, and popcorn. The neighborhood was quiet, ensuring a good night's rest. The bed linens and towels were so nice and felt luxurious.
Beautiful home. Would stay here again.

Jessica was awesome. The location was perfect, nice and quiet neighborhood and very close to freeways, shopping, and restaurants/food. The house was cozy and clean. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay even for people on a budget.

After a long day of traveling from the east coast, we were so relieved to walk in to Jessica's clean and well decorated house. Everything was as described. Lots of amenities to make our stay even easier, and an amazing Asian market on the corner to boot! Beds, towels and kitchen utensils were high quality. The location could not have been better for us as we were visiting our son, and we felt very lucky to be able to stay so near to his apartment. Jessica's place was perfect for our needs and we would definitely stay again.
Beautiful. Incredibly easy to relax and disconnect for some good R&R
Jessica’s place was super clean and comfy. The location was central to our needs. We would stay again.
It is a nice place!

Jessica's description and pictures of the home are 100% accurate.  The neighborhood is modest, not scary and quiet.   Only recommendation is to keep some simple lawn chairs and table in the garage that could be used on the patio.
Jessica's place is an excellent home away from home. Very cute and warmly decorated, but also lots of very functional and thoughtful details. We would definitely consider staying here again!

The Airbnb was comfortable and cozy. It was perfect for what I needed. Communication was easy with responses that were quick and clear. The place itself was very clean and easy to settle into. I would definitely consider staying there again.

This is a great little house in Salem that is very well appointed and decorated in a way that makes the home feel cared for. Jessica was quick to respond to everything, and has decorated the house beautifully. Highly recommend!
Super clean home, host has great response time
We had a lovely stay in this home.  It's very well appointed, clean and comfortable.  The neighborhood was quiet. Jessica is an attentive and communicative host.
Very nice and comfy home to stay in! If I’m ever back in the area, with no hesitation would I book this place again!
Very nicely appointed place. I enjoyed my stay in Salem.

The inside of the home looked exactly as expected. Jessica has done a wonderful job with decorating this home, which we appreciated thoroughly. She communicated quickly when issues arose. It was odd to have neither a television nor a dishwasher, but those are small in the grand scheme. Our largest concern was that prior to arriving at the home it’s difficult to tell the neighborhood it lies in. We did not feel safe due to the types of individuals walking past at all hours of the night. Men on bikes sat outside watching us unpack.
It was awesome!! Super cute and decorated so well!
well decorated, very clean, and comfortable.   had a great stay and Jessica’s house had everything we needed.  will definitely be back to stay here the next time we are visiting relatives.

When I got there, I was pleasantly surprised by the updated interior.  It looked fresh and well thought out.  Plenty of dishes, pots, pans and yes, a toaster!  I should have asked beforehand, but after having arrived late in the evening, I didn't consider to plan breakfast.  After all the listing said breakfast was included.  I just figured I had not found the access instructions yet.  So I messaged the host. I got the reply well after normal breakfast hours the next day. There were supposed to be some oatmeal packets in the basket with the tea and single use coffee.  There were none.  But I did not message the host and report it.  Breakfast was already over.  I had found more things that I did not like and that was just the topping.  In all, good for a couple or small family to stay while doing other things, as long as you don't want to watch TV.  Use the chain on the bathroom door or it will wander open. Have fun watching the squirrels play in the trees of the back yard and the children in the school playground on the other side of the chainlink fence.
This is a sweet cottage, nicely decorated and comfortable. It was perfect for my home base while taking a workshop at the Kroc Center. Jessica's response time was quick and helpful.
Wonderful little home, great host and great location!

I would highly recommend staying here if you have the chance. The location was great and close to both downtown and also to other areas of Salem/Keizer. The place was very comfortable and spacious. We especially enjoyed the provided snacks (coffee, tea, popcorn).

Jessica is an exceptional host and incredibly responsive and proactive with communication. We had everything we needed and it ended up being a great launching pad for downtown activities and heading out of town for bike rides and hiking.
Jessica was excellent at communicating and checking in on us. Thanks for the stay

I was here for 5 months as I am a travel nurse from out of state. The location is great, the place is beautiful and very clean. Neil was great with responding in a timely manner. It is a little pricey for long term stays like I was, and that’s the only issue I had. Overall, I would definitely recommend!
Neil’s place was clean and beautiful! Close to anywhere we wanted to go. I highly recommend staying here!
Our stay here was great.  This is a great location.  It’s close to everything in Salem.  The house was exactly as advertised and Carole was easy to work with.
Great location - downtown is easy walking distance. Clean and comfortable.

This house was everything and more. It matched the listing perfectly. Had just enough dishes, pots and pans so that we were able to cook some meals at home. We were close to a grocery store and downtown and could safely walk many places. The beds were comfortable, sheets and towels amazing. Glad to have a coffee maker and toaster. I would definitely stay here again if we come back to this area.

This is a great little place, easy walk to Willamette U, and downtown.  It appears very much as billed, lovely period architecture, wood floors, tile etc.  Heat is modern and easy, parking was no problem.  Just a very homey, comfortable stay.  Would happily stay here again

This was a great place for a family of four. Plenty of room for everyone. The location was great. Loved being able to walk to the grocery store and be close to Downtown. Parking was easy. It was nice and quiet in the evenings. We did a lot of cooking and it was nice to have a full kitchen with utensils, pots and pans, etc.
Great comfortable place to stay.  Close to Willamette University, the capitol and the downtown.

This is an older house that has been well remodeled without losing its historic charm such as the many built-in cupboards and fireplace. The location is very convenient. It's within walking distance of a grocery store and many of the local attractions. The place was very well equipped with almost everything we needed, including a washer and dryer. Wi-fi worked well & was easy to connect to.
This is a great place for a stay in Salem. We'll try to use it again the next time we're in town.
A great location and a great host.
Our stay was smooth....easy check in, good (and fast) communication, and a very convenient location to downtown Salem! The beds are also SUPER comfy!

Carole's place is in my top 2 Airbnbs I've ever stayed at.  Everything was great!  I'm an Airbnb host myself and I can tell that she has given careful thought to what travelers want and need to enjoy a trip to somewhere new.
Carole is very communicative and hosts a wonderful spot to stay. It's very clean, great location, and has everything you would need during a stay!

Carole was very kind to let us book this place super last minute. Spacious rooms. Beds were comfortable. We did see little bugs on one of the beds but we think it was just due to it being near the window. Doors may open unexpectedly probably from it being an older home… Was a little spooked when reaching out to host after hearing 3 loud thumps on the roof we got the response of “if you’ve got a ghost it’s new to you. I certainly hope is not wanting to stay! 👻😜” sooooo we’re sorry if we left a ghost there. Read upon another review someone was in the basement upon their arrival thinking she had the place to herself. Would not recommend staying here alone. But if you’re a heavy sleeper, a man, this would be a nice place for you :) We were not able to stay there another restless  night but Carole was generous enough to give a refund for the remaining night.

All in all we would stay here again!
The house was lovely, and the neighborhood was also lovely. We had a little bit of trouble finding where to park (it was dark when we got there) but that was a maps thing and had nothing to do with the property itself. If your GPS tells you to go turn on 14th st go to 13th instead. The house was great, there were some additional condiments in the fridge and washer and dryer in the basement, and a really fun guest book.

This was a great place to stay for our visit to Willamette University.  There was a short walk to the grocery store, to a great breakfast spot (the Sassy Onion), campus and downtown Salem.   We didn't have a car and we didn't need one. The house was a cosy, homey place to come back to at night.  I enjoyed all the period cabinetry - fun doors and doors in the kitchen and the bathroom.  Fantastic shower!  I hope we'll stay here again if my son decides to attend the university.

The house itself is great. Location couldn’t be better - close to downtown with lots to do in the area. The only bathroom in the home is upstairs.  Coffee is provided, but other pantry items are scarce. Thankfully there is a grocery store two blocks away! Our only minor issue is the parking - the street parking in the whole neighborhood is permit parking only. We had 2 cars but Carole was only able to provide 1 guest permit. When I asked about public street parking nearby, I never got a response. Thankfully, we didn’t get a ticket, and I’m not sure what we would have done if that happened.
Love this place … clean , cozy and quiet … walking distance to Willamette University, downtown and grocery store around the corner and of course the beautiful capital.

Great location. The place was comfortable and had everything we needed.
Thank you!

The house was clean and quiet and met our needs well.  The location was ideal for visiting Willamette University and downtown and convenient to stores and restaurants.  The beds were comfortable and the host was responsive when we had a question.  The only issue we encountered was that the kitchen did not have sufficient equipment to prepare simple dinners.

Super centrally located but quiet and easy parking due to dead end street.

House is lovely- lots of vintage charm and clean and well appointed - everything we needed for our stay.

Highly recommend!

This is a great place! The home is spacious, clean and bright. You are able to walk to the downtown area for shops and restaurants. Carole is amazing, easy to reach and a very attentive host. I highly recommend staying here!

This is a good base to explore Salem, it is maybe a 10-minute walk downtown. The property was little older than I was expecting but it was clean, has a brand-new shower, and the beds were very comfortable. Carole was extremely helpful throughout our stay!

Very beautiful place and great price too
We had a great time here

Adorable townhouse in a beautiful neighborhood. We had a wonderful stay and look forward to another in the future. Angela is a fantastic host, great with communicating and very accommodating. The location was great, near stores and restaurants, very convenient.
Charming and tastefully appointed home in a great location.  Quiet street.  Very clean and comfortable.

This sweet house has been carefully updated without erasing its period charm. We found it close to groceries, restaurants (Word of Mouth!!!yum) and liquor stores. It was close to downtown for shopping or eating. House was clean and well equipped. And we very much enjoyed the air conditioning as it was a HOT one in Salem.
Lovely quiet house in Salem. Older building but everything was clean and in good repair. Will definitely stay here again next time I’m in the area!

I came out to help pack up and move my son. Packing and moving is never fun, and normally arduous, so having a quiet place to stay at the end of each day was really important.

Well, this place for the bill perfectly — a bedroom for each of us, a quiet neighborhood at the end of a cul-de-sac, with a grocery store just a block away.

I couldn’t have asked for better, and the host was remarkable in every way.

This one made my Favorites list.
Great place to stay
Great place, great location!
Great place and location. Comfy, cozy and easy to walk to downtown Salem and Willamette University.

The house was very comfortable and well maintained.  The kitchen was nicely outfitted with lots of pots, pans cooking utensils, cutlery,  glass & dinnerware.  Coffee was readily available - both drip and Keurig -  as well as various other useful kitchen condiments.  The location was excellent for our purposes and Angela (the host) was very prompt and helpful in responding to a couple of inquiries we made of her.  She did an excellent job taking care of the house and the guests.  We were most pleased with our stay.  Thanks Angela!    Alan and Sharon
Really nice place to stay. Quiet neighborhood.
Angela was very responsive and helpful, and super friendly! The place was clean, cozy, and comfortable! Thank you so much!!
lovely 2 bed 1 bath townhouse, very close to campus. well stocked and clean. would stay again.
Had a lovely stay, five minute drive to Willamette. Would definitely stay again!
Great location, cozy house. Loved that I was able to do a load of laundry.

Exactly as described- roomy , easy parking, great location for us. Kitchen well equipped and what made my wife much more comfortable, duvet and shams all washed between each guest. Would recommend to anybody going to Salem stay at this location.
We enjoyed our weekend.

Wonderful spot in a lovely neighborhood. Well appointed and so comfortable- would have liked to have stayed longer! Walking distance to Willamette U and downtown. Angela was very responsive and clear in all communication

Clean and charming Airbnb within walking distance to Willamette University, restaurants, and parks. Bedrooms and bathroom are upstairs. Laundry machines are in basement. The permit parking only applies to weekdays. There are plenty of street parking spaces without permit restrictions near. We had a very nice stay. Thank you Angela.
Location is great. Very nice place. Truly enjoyed it. And Carole is excellent!
Stay went well. House was clean, backyard was private. Nothing to complain about :)
Had a good stay here, the house seemed to have everything you need to enjoy your stay.

Angela was a wonderful host. She was responsive to all of our needs. If there was something that we needed, she did her very best to accommodate us! The place is nestled in a quiet and small cul de sac. Neighbors are pleasant. The house is spacious with a cute patio. Nice study area. Plenty of space! Extra linen was provided and she even has a host of games for entertainment! Would recommend to any travelers in the Salem area!
Everything was exactly as described
It was a great location and enjoy the vibe of the place. Great customer service.
Sooooo cute and such a big and open space to stay in!

What a fun and unique place to stay in downtown Salem. This rental has safe, private parking and a full kitchen and bathroom. Lots of room for two people and it's close to downtown restaurants and bars.

Amazing location in downtown Salem. Close to everything you need and a has an available parking spot. Very clean, and comfortable. The hosts were great and communicated well with great instruction for checking in easily.
Perfect location, walking distance to shops, food and parks. Spacious and clean accommodations.

The location is smack downtown. Park, shops, and Willamette U are just a few blocks away. Expect traffic and people noise even at night. Parking is secured behind a gate. It’s a clean, spacious and comfortable unit. Carole is wonderful. We slept well and ate well. Did not do any cooking.

Great location, in close proximity of the University. There a tall flight of steps up to the unit, so be prepared to carry your bag up. Besides that, check-in was very easy and we enjoyed staying at this apartment!
Great spot! Cozy and clean

My second time staying at the loft. Love all the space, Netflix on the TV in the cozy livingroom, lots of light and closet space in the bedroom and the fabulous downtown location where you can walk to great cafes and restaurants. We visited Archive coffee, Tap Root and Epilogue and loved them all. Definitely recommend.
Fabulous and perfectly located for our trip. Very comfortable and welcoming.

We rented both of the Tiger Station lofts and it was the perfect situation for our larger group (with one baby in tow). So cool to stay in downtown Salem! We could walk everywhere and trust that logistics would be simple.

We had a great stay at the Lofts! The location is awesome!! Short walks to so many restaurants, bars and shops. We also loved being 1/2 block away for runs and after dinner walks through the 3  connected Riverside parks. Secure parking was a plus to leave the car and explore on foot. Angela is a quick communicator and great host. Definitely recommend the Lofts if you are coming to Salem.

Easy check in with helpful directions, dedicated parking spot and well-stocked unit.

Lots of nightlife in the area and a nearby train. Pack earplugs if you are a light sleeper.

Excellent shopping and restaurants all within a short walk.

Unit is clean, comfortable, tastefully decorated and secure. All expected amenities and quite a few nice extras are included. GREAT Wi-Fi- helpful when working on vacation. Looking forward to returning.
The perfect spot to explore downtown Salem! Great space overall and would totally recommend to friends

We were in Salem for the Ironman race and the location couldn't have been better.  It is situated by the Riverfront Park and all the restaurants and shopping.  The place is very comfortable and nicely decorated.  Large bedroom with a huge closet. It was great having a washer and dryer in the unit and when I accidentally left some special items in the dryer they even mailed them back to me.  Thank you for the great stay.
Such a unique, historical, and fun place to stay in downtown Salem. You are so close to wonderful food and shopping, all while having a ton of privacy. The space was so spacious and comfortable.
One of the most communicative host I have ever had and extremely great location :) the overall stay was very comfortable and we would definitely come again.

Angela answered the phone immediately when we had trouble figuring out where it was (our fault, we’d been driving for 10 hours and didn’t see the clearly labeled door in front of us) and was super accommodating when I needed to check out a bit later. The location is great, lots of restaurants nearby and right by the waterfront park. Easy 10 minute walk to Willamette. Very clean and comfortable!

We absolutely loved staying at the Tiger Station loft. The large windows and ample space made the place feel so comfortable and relaxing. The proximity to tons of local restaurants and bars was also fantastic. We walked everywhere!

The biggest plus was probably the fenced in parking spot. Our vehicle felt so safe!
Awesome location, large apartment with ample amenities. Highly recommend!

The Loft was very convenient for us, and it was great having a washer and dryer.
The stairway is steep and long, about 20 steps up.
The description we read said there are two bedrooms. There are two beds, but one of them is in the entrance hall, and someone in the bedroom has to walk by it on the way to the bathroom. We only used the bed in the bedroom, so this was not an issue for us. But it may be for others who need to use both beds.
Great, cozy apartment in the heart of the downtown area. Tons of great shops and food to walk to. Loved it.

Great location and value . A really nice place to stay.
Thanks Dennis and Amy

Angela was a great host! Very easy to communicate with and she was accommodating. We had a really great time staying in this apartment. The location was really amazing with over a dozen restaurants and cafes within 1 to 3 blocks. The space was also very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again!
Lovely place to stay, great location, and big apartment! Just fyi, (we did not check the pictures closely enough) there is only one bedroom. The other bed is in the living room.

Angela was such a great host! She was very responsive to any questions. The apartment is super cute and felt even bigger then the photos. It was also a convenient walk to the convention center for me. Angela was also sweet enough to let me park my car there past checkout which was very kind!

The bunkhouse is a gem -- very comfy and cozy and in a truly lovely location.  The bed is very comfortable and the bathroom is spacious.  There is nice outdoor patio with table and chairs for dining.  As advertised, there isn't really a kitchen per se.  If you can make do with light meals/salads/sandwiches, it will work for you.  If you like to cook (as we do), it doesn't have cooking facilities beyond a toaster oven and microwave.  We were treated to fresh figs from the garden!  This would make a fabulous place for a retreat or romantic getaway.

The Bunkhouse was a great place to stay. Away from the crowds and cozy.  The view was amazing.  Enjoyed having coffee and dinner on the porch.  Carole was great at accommodating and communication was excellent.
Very professional and Courteous, highly recommend!
Quiet and cozy

This place is charming and on a large, peaceful nature reserve. I enjoyed the restful 3 days I spent here. That said, there were a few unpleasant surprises:
* The listing mentioned there were roller shades on the windows, however there were no window coverings at all. The bunkhouse is on the first floor on a shared property, so privacy was not guaranteed and there was no way to completely darken the room for sleep.
* A large guard dog lives on the porch of the main house. It ran at me barking on the first day but luckily was on leash. No harm done, but that's the kind of thing I'd expect to be mentioned in a listing.

Pretty cool spot for adventure if your an outdoor person, you can leave your stuff and explore and come back like nothing. Safe little get away but only one thing is there is a big window in front of the bed which is kinda creepy but other than that it was a lovely stay . Would come back!
Rustic in a unique location. Very good communication by the host. Best to arrive in daylight.

This is a pleasant hideaway in an area you wouldn't know about but which is actually quite close to town. Some folks have written about the exposed windows. It's fine. This is a private property, gated even, and being able to look out on the grounds is part of the charm.

The bed is comfortable. The hot water plentiful. The quiet, broken by birds and the wind, healing. Forget trying to use the internet. Sketchy isn't the word for it. It simply isn't there. But if you are able to unplug or use your own hotspot (which is what I did) you'll be fine.
I enjoyed the cute, homey bunkhouse, and the surroundings are absolutely beautiful.
you are not walking to anything and you are not cooking anything.  it is charming and quaint and I really liked it.

Had a great time and it was a really great location. Fair warning though there is a giant window without blinds that face the house on the property. A little chilly the first night because the fireplace takes a while to warm up the space but once it does it’s super warm and cozy. The heated blanket also helped but we didn’t see it until the last night. Other than that the property was very beautiful and totally encapsulates what I wanted to show my boyfriend for his first time coming to my hometown. I definitely recommend this place for nature lovers!!
Comfy bed, beautiful grounds!

This is a beautiful rustic country setting, and the grounds are beyond beautiful, perfect for us.  If your a everything must be perfect kind of person, then this place isn’t for you.  My husband was training for a Ironman race and found the trails next door perfect for biking and running, I’m unable to walk much and found the stream and birds wonderful to watch from the front porch.
beautiful property, I visited in January and got to see all sorts of wildlife out on the river

The area was beautiful, and it was a nice place to stay for a few nights. However, the internet connection was absolutely awful - we couldn't use it at all - and there are no curtains on the massive bay windows that face the house, taking away the illusion of privacy. The guests are also required to wash their own dishes at the end of their stay, which is odd considering the $50 cleaning fee, and also meant the dishes weren't very clean before we even used them. Lastly, there's a door off the bathroom that leads into a storage room and visibly towards the upstars, and it doesnt lock. We could hear people moving around upstairs and in the room and that made us a little uncomfortable. Otherwise it was a nice stay.

This place is beautiful. There are definitely curtains in the bay window, and the bay window doesn't directly face the main house, as mentioned by a few other visitors. The internet is a little slow, but it works just fine for sending emails and quick web surfing. The dog mentioned in one of the comments does bark, but Peaches gets used to your presence after a day or two and stops barking. She's a good pup. I loved the grounds, the landscaping, the yard art and statues, and the morning fog. Great place.

My bunkhouse stay was incredibly peaceful & quiet. I slept great!! The location is great with quick access to beautiful Minto Park for a walk or bike ride. If I had any questions, my host was quick to respond. If your up for a cozy - rustic adventure, this is a great place.

Carole,
The “Bunkhouse” and the surrounding grounds are so serene and the birdsong is spectacular! Thank you for hosting me in such a wonderful place!
David
Seattle
Lovely and beautiful even in the Oregon rain! Listing was accurate and Carole was responsive to messages.
The place was so quiet and comfortable that I slept until noon. I don't think I have ever been some place that is that peaceful and solitary. I needed the rest!
Absolutely wonderful stay no complaints. 10/10
A peaceful place with plenty of room to roam outside.
This place is so lovely! Very peaceful and quaint. We were warmly welcomed by the lovely Ms. Peaches. It was a lovely get away and definitely will be coming back in August! Thank you!!
Great place to stay. Lots of birdsong to listen to.

The grounds are amazing and peaceful. Driving into the property has Princess Mononoke vibes. Parking is convenient and easy.

Close to everything I needed yet felt like I was way out in nature complete with birdsong.

All in all a very quiet and enjoyable stay.
Beautiful setting, stunning grounds, and enjoyed a week in this incredible bunkhouse. Better than most 4 star hotel/motels.
Beautiful property! We really enjoyed the peace and quite.
Wow. Spectacular property. You can't go wrong here.

Peaceful, beautiful location just out of town. Directions and communication with Angela was great! As mentioned in the listing wifi was poor but if you just want to relax unwind and enjoy the scenery I definitely recommend.

I really enjoyed staying here and hope I can return. the room is rustic barnwood style as you would expect as part of the Garage Barn. But really comfortable and super quiet. and with the surrounding nature is so beautiful.  they have it set up to be able to enjoy the outdoors with garden paths and different benches to sit and take it all in.

Wonderfully peaceful place makes you connect with nature.
I highly recommend the host as well!
Wonderful place, my 2nd time there! I will come back again…and again!
